story:
To get the ball rolling, in August 2014, we opened a delivery/carryout restaurant consisting of a 250 sq. ft. kitchen, an elevated shed for dry storage and a counter with 4 stools.  We were open from 11-8, 6 days a week and pumped out fresh, delicious scratch made goodness all day.  Our thoughts were that we would get started here, build a brand, then move forward with our full service restaurant,  as planned.  All was falling into place perfectly, we were busy, my husband and I, plus 1 employee building sales day over day, week over week, month over month, year over year.  We are at the point where it is time to expand into a full service operation, we have reached our potential due to lack of time in the day, lack of space for cooking, storage and people.  We physically can't add any cooking equipment, storage or refrigeration or staff.  Unfortunately, while we have been growing, the cost of our island life keeps rising.  Commercial spaces are now to the point of no profit.  

So, we have decided our best course of action is to move our life and our business to a larger city with vibrant revitalization, the proper target market, a craft beer, cocktail  and food scene for us to be a part of and a comfortable setting for us and our dogs.  We are headed to St. Petersburg, Florida!  We like the city for the small business advocacy, the focus on the environment, the dog friendliness and the casual lifestyle.  

We have identified a space that allows us to get started on a smaller scale but fits our needs of anticipated growth and also lends to our budget, design concept and is exactly in our desired location.  The funds will be used to acquire the space, apply for required permits and begin the build out for our beer cooler and bar, purchase tables & chairs, signage, and plateware.  

The building is on a corner in a thriving district of the city that is home to other foodie restaurants, bars, shops and nightlife.  The restaurant will seat 40-50 plus a bar that seats 15-20 and sidewalk seating for 25. The decor will be modern rustic with simple design features.  We will use beer signs that are cohesive with our decor and framed art that is representative of our Midwestern background and of the entertainment we will provide.  The menu and decor will represent the modern and rural way of the Midwest and the laid back lifestyle of Florida.  The design will use re-purposed wood, beer barrels, metals, bicycle parts, and unique lighting to provide a cozy, relaxing spot for a beer and bite to eat. 

Risks and challenges

The greatest challenges we will face are unforseen issues with the building during build out, shipping delays for equipment, and contractor delays. 
We are doing our due diligence to inspect the major components of the building prior to signing the lease, hoping to address items of concern in advance. 
We have established relationships with several restaurant equipment suppliers so we can use that to our advantage when buying and shipping those items. 
We will use local contractors who are referred to us by trusted sources in the community.

story:
Hey! I'm Josh, and I’m the co-founder of Nature Restore® - a health & wellness startup brand located in sunny Southern California.

I know first-hand the importance of eating our veggies & fruits, as I've been going through my own personal transformation from poor health towards a more vibrant and energized life.

But let’s be real... when we’re on-the-go, have a demanding job, or have children to care for it’s not always easy to lug around the whole produce department.  

And if you’re anything like me, you want to keep your health and wellness a top priority while not sacrificing the commitments that are important to you. 

This is why we are creating ROOTS™ - a tasty once-a-day drink mix that ensures you’re getting a healthy serving of greens and berries.

Your contribution to this project will make this product go-to-market possible. And we’re thrilled for people to enjoy ROOTS™ and get their key nutrients that are vital for a vibrant and energized life!

We formulated ROOTS™ with two things in mind: 

  1. We know that people are on the fence when it comes to eating healthy, primarily because taste is a major factor. So we made sure to formulate ROOTS™ to taste good, which includes BriesSweet™ organic tapioca maltodextrin to ensure it stirs easily and mixes well with water. You're gonna love it!
  2. We wanted to ensure that ROOTS™ contains a blend of exotic yet nutritious veggies and fruits. We searched for the perfect mix of greens and berries and they all have amazing benefits.

  3. The superfood heroes inside of ROOTS Superfoods are defined as a ‘food or food component high in a specific nutrient considered beneficial to health and wellbeing’. We definitely think we should all consider adding a few of these nutritional bullets to our diet each day.Here’s our guide to some of the most nutritious and beneficial superfoods. Although some of them sound new age, they’ve all been around for centuries, us modern humans are only just cottoning on to what our ancestors already knew!

King Kale

A super, super green, kale is delicious cooked or eaten raw in salads. It’s also easily blended up into smoothies and juices for a quick and simple nutritious kick. It’s one of the most nutrient-dense foods around. It’s packed with vitamins, minerals, antioxidants, beta-carotene, and lutein which is essential for good eye health.

Wonderful Wheatgrass

Despite its name, wheatgrass is naturally wheat and gluten free. It’s full of fiber for healthy bowel movements and nutrients for glowing skin. It’s also alkalizing which means it helps counteract the acidic effects of alcohol, coffee, and processed foods. Grow your own wheatgrass and juice it, or add powdered wheatgrass to your smoothies.

Super Spinach

Made famous by Popeye, spinach is a health-giving staple green in salads, smoothies, and juices. Most well known for being packed with iron which helps keep red blood cells healthy, spinach is also high in vitamin K, essential for blood clotting. Spinach is one of the best sources of vitamin K and is also a good source of vitamins A and C, folic acid, manganese, and magnesium.

Stupendous Spirulina

If only one food could be hailed a superfood, it’d be spirulina. It’s a complete protein, ideal for vegetarians and vegans, and helps reduce sweet food cravings. It’s an algae, and is a beautiful deep sea green-blue color, usually found in powdered form and adds a nutritious boost to smoothies. It’s high in B vitamins for energy, the powerful antioxidant phycocyanin and Gamma-Linolenic Acid, a rich form of Omega 6 for heart and brain health.

Glorious Goji

Used for over 6000 years in Traditional Chinese Medicine, goji berries are a fantastic source of vitamins A, B2 and C, iron and antioxidants. They boost the immune system and help protect the heart and brain. Add to breakfast granola or eat by the handful!

Amazing Acai

Naturally grown in the Brazilian rainforest, acai berries are bursting with antioxidants. Antioxidants help neutralize free radicals, harmful compounds found in pollution, cigarette smoke, and UV radiation. Especially good if you live in a busy city! Add acai powder to your daily smoothie.

Excellent Elderberry

The tiny, deep purple elderberry cannot be eaten raw, but powdered elderberry can easily be added to juices and smoothies for a superfood boost. They’re rich in flavonoids, antioxidants that help protect our cells against free radical damage. They’re also one of the richest sources of immune-boosting vitamin C, perfect for fighting winter bugs.

Captain Camu

Native to the Amazon rainforest, camu camu berries are also amazingly high in vitamin C. It’s thought that just half a teaspoon of camu camu powder in water contains over 400% of the recommended daily value! Also full of beta-carotene and other antioxidants, camu camu is great for the immune system.

Neat Noni

Polynesians have been drinking noni juice for centuries to boost energy and keep their immune systems strong. Recent scientific tests have shown the juice to be a good source of B vitamins, vitamins C and E, calcium, potassium, and iron. It’s also high in quercetin, a powerful flavonoid with anti-inflammatory properties.

See how many of these super superfoods you can fit into your diet each day and reap the health benefits. How about a smoothie containing each one? A true nutritional powerhouse to start the day!

For the every day "Sally & Tom", ROOTS™ is your stepping stone to better health & wellness. 


Your contributions to this project really helps us complete the final stages of manufacturing minimums needed to bring ROOTS™ to market - printing the packaging, getting the drink mix packets filled with all the greens and berries we’ve sourced at an approved contract manufacturer, and giving you the opportunity to enjoy delicious superfoods drink that won't leave an odd earthy aftertaste.  

The funds contributed to this project will be used for printing, packaging, production, and distribution. Any contributions beyond our goal will allow us to reach more backers by increasing the marketing and advertising budget and give us the option of expanding the product line later this year (which would be amazing!).

 

Grab a ROOTS™ packet whenever you desire.

 

When it's time to enjoy mix with 10oz cold water.

 

Stir. If you have a water bottle, SHAKE! :)

 

Sip it all up. It's easy to enjoy. Kids love it!

\

 

It's the green drink your kids will drink! 

Yes, it's that easy!  

 

 

 

 

We'll be giving our supporters a range of perks options that you may select from. 

 

FOUNDERS CLUB MEMBERSHIP

One of the items we have for those who select the Super Supporter perk level is a FREE year membership to Nature Restore's Founders Club where you'll receive special wholesale pricing for an entire year on all Nature Restore products! (Order limits apply to special wholesale pricing to 10 individual SKUs per month). This is a great way to get all your health & wellness products at a bargain.

ROOTS™ (20 individual on-the-go packets per box)

 

 

ROOTS™ T-Shirt

See the perk levels to contribute! 

 

 

As a brand, we’re committed to helping the planet. We already donate 1% of all product sales from our existing products to 1% for the Planet, a non-profit organization which connects businesses, consumers, and nonprofits. Any contribution you make towards this new product line will also make a difference, too!

Here are the organizations that Nature Restore contributes to. Our leadership team has selected organizations of their choice! 

Oceania: Richard W., general manager

Water.org: Josh B., director of marketing

Animal Hope & Wellness Center: Jason W., operations manager

Accionatura: Ken M., sales director

Wildlife Forever: Niki C., sales & marketing manager

Advocates West: Adrienne L., assistant creative director

1to1Movement.org: Sara M., office manager

We've been diligently working on this project for several months now, and we've completed the ingredients and taste. We're so excited for you to try this healthy drink mix! The only potential risks we see is the specific shipping time. We’re aiming to have these products come your way by late July or early August. In the case of any possible delay, we will keep everyone updated on the production process. That’s our commitment to you!

 

If you’re unable to make a contribution but would still like to help us in a simple way, please share this campaign on your social media profile(s) of choice by using Indiegogo's sharing tools. 

We’d appreciate the additional exposure of Nature Restore® and our new ROOTS™ product we’re excited to make available to everyone!

To your best health & wellness,

Josh

Co-Founder & Marketing Director, Nature Restore

story:
My Story

Hi, My Name is Kristina Grimes, I am an Alumni of The Culinary Institute of America and 25 year plus veteran of the food & hospitality Industry, Wife and Mother of 2 girls and the Chef/Owner of Thyme On Your Side Artisan Market & Café in Farmingdale, NY
            I opened Thyme On Your Side Artisan Market & Café  in 2015 In Bethpage, NY and I moved the Store to this location in April of 2017 because our former location was not conducive to the growth of the business for many reasons. I was in a situation where the Landlord did not want to renew my lease and I had to find a place very quickly that was close enough to be able to keep my current customers. 396 Conklin Street was presented to me at the perfect time as a sublease situation that was supposed to be temporary. Although the space did not have a real commercial kitchen and was to be shared with the current tenant at the time, I was willing to make it work until I could find a permanent spot. The intention was always to move to a space on Main Street that had a proper Kitchen. Since this all had to be done within a couple of weeks’ time I was not able to really investigate the situation and the sublease, although written up and approved by both lawyers, ended up not being valid because it was not approved by the landlord. At this point I had already moved in and was set to open the next day so after some renegotiating I was able to take over the lease which was quite costly but was my only option at the time.

The Challenge

Since our relocation the business has been growing faster than we can handle in the current kitchen or lack thereof. Although being busy  is a good problem to have I am working with only 2 induction burners as my stove, a convection oven and three steam kettles of which only one works. We have just about tripled our daily sales in just a over a year and are in desperate need of the right equipment which will be way over what the business can afford all at once.

The Solution

At this point I have two options which is what I need the funding for, both will keep the business in Farmingdale which is the goal. One is to stay in the current location and build out a kitchen which will be very costly. Second is to move to a space on Main Street that is for sale and has more foot traffic, a full commercial kitchen, dining and retail area that will be large enough to accommodate our growing customer base

How You Can Help

My funding goal to be able accomplish this and stay in business in Farmingdale is approximately $50,000.00. This will cover all moving expenses, a public bathroom so that I can have seating, a few more small appliances and a paint job. Everything else we already have and it's just waiting to be utilized.

So check out all of the  great perks we are offering in exchange for your contributions and Please Help out if you can.

If not please just spread the word by Sharing on one of the links at the top of this page. Everything Helps and Anything is much appreciated.

story: ^::::::::::::::::

Launching soon - Atlas Distilling is a small-batch craft distillery and restaurant, housed at the 188 year-old Atlas Mill in Clinton, MI.

 

Two Michiganders and a Washingtonian.

We are Ryan, Ethan, and Yuri. Ryan and Ethan met in 4th grade and have been friends ever since. Ryan became a mechanical engineer, eventually working at one of the nation’s largest commercial distilleries in Iowa. Ethan left for Washington to pursue a career in law enforcement. Whenever we got back together, we talked about the idea of opening a distillery in our home state. It soon became more than an idea, we decided to make it a reality. What if we could bring a small-batch, farm to table, craft distillery to the most perfect little town in Michigan? After a long search, we came across the Atlas Mill, situated in the heart of Clinton, MI. The once operating 188-year-old mill was a staple of our village and the second oldest business in Michigan when it was half destroyed by arson in the late 2000s. With its rich history, we knew we had found the home of the Atlas Distilling Company.

What will the historic Atlas Mill be making now?

Smooth, crisp corn vodka, Michigan juniper berry gin, small-batch corn whiskeys aged and matured in our 188-year-old grain elevator. All of these spirits will utilize ingredients from local farms, including Ryan’s own family farm. That’s what we mean when we say farm-to-table.

All of our spirits, including our vodka and gin, will be corn based, all grown locally. Truly keeping the spirit of the grain mill and southeast Michigan alive in our products. Our tasting room, labels, and brand are inspired by the Mill which gave us our name, and the town which gave us everything else.

Keep an eye out for special edition runs of spirits like a Fall Festival Rum, Rye whiskeys, Grappa and anything else the village yearns for. 

A Distillery unlike any other in Michigan.

We wanted Michigan corn being bottled at the old Atlas Mill. Now we just needed someone to help us make it a reality.  We called countless distillers, brewers, and anyone who may have a lead.  Gatling Still Works, our still manufacturer, told us they had found our man. Yuri Simon isn't new to the beverage world. With his 13 years of experience in brewing, winemaking,  and distilling, Yuri will start producing great craft spirits as soon as we fire up our still. 

Our still, a patented, one of a kind, work of art created by Henry of Gatling Still Works, is being custom ordered and made to our specifications. The flavor profiles and feel of the corn spirits coming out of our Alexandria still will be as unique as the still itself. 

The spirits won't be the only great thing being created by Atlas Distilling. When you come to our tasting room, you'll be able to dine on simple, delicious, fresh food. Our menu will be influenced by Michigan cuisine staples. Enjoy our food and laugh with your friends while you watch stand-up comedy, listen to bands, and play trivia against your neighbors. The same neighbors that made this distillery possible.

Why Clinton, Michigan?

We picked the Atlas site on impulse, overwhelmed by it's history and prominence in our village. We knew that we could overcome any shortcomings if we had this property for our distillery. Once we started our research, we realized how lucky we were to pick our hometown, Clinton, MI. 14,000 cars a day pass through our village along Michigan Ave.  Detroit, Ann Arbor, Jackson and Toledo are all within 50 miles. New homeowners are moving out to our slice of heaven in droves.  When folks are looking for a place to put roots down, we think our distillery may help them make that decision! 

What have we done so far?

We bought the land and site of the mill knowing we had the perfect place. Next, we had to make sure we could legally use the property for distilling. We petitioned the Village of Clinton and successfully rezoned the land to allow us distill and serve food while maintaining what remains of the old mill. We have plans, blueprints, and renderings of what will be the future Atlas Distilling Co. Henry (our still maker) is waiting for us to give him the order to start building our still.

We started with an idea, and now we're asking our friends, family, and you the community to help us raise our funds.

Where you come in.

Soon, you'll be able to sit by the Raisin River and make memories with neighbors, while sipping on a premium Clinton made liquor. You could also enjoy our craft spirits in the comfort of your own home with family and friends, but we can't do this without you. In order for us to start producing craft spirits, we need a place to house our custom Alexandria still. Your contributions will help raise a small tasting room right at the base of the Atlas Tower. Our goal of $170,000 will allow us to build a beautiful distillery. With $150,000 going directly to the build out and the remaining $20,000 being used to put a deposit on our still, fermenters, and other equipment.

Once our campaign goal has been met, we will raise the remaining capital needed for the still bottles, barrels, and licenses through a traditional bank.  We need your help to get to there!

Will I really be helping Atlas?

Absolutely! - We can't thank you enough for investing in Atlas Distilling Co. When we open our doors and you crack open a bottle of corn spirits that YOU made possible, you can be assured you didn't just help Atlas, but Clinton and Michigan as well.  Atlas is about friends starting a business in the community they love and ensuring the community continues to grow for the next generation.

Your contributions will have a direct impact on us, the community, and you, when you taste that perfect handcrafted Atlas cocktail. Proudly made right here in Clinton, Michigan.

How risky is whiskey? 

Whiskey sales have been increasing year after year, quickly becoming scarce in some parts of the world. The supply for craft bourbon in particular can't keep up with the demand.  We may be local, but the demand is global.

"Whiskey in particular, the highest-priced products are flying off the shelves the fastest," Distilled Spirits Council spokesman Frank Coleman told The Associated Press. It's the sixth straight year that spirits have increased their market share in the overall alcohol industry relative to beer. " - Fortune Magazine

US whiskeys are also setting the export pace, accounting for 70 percent of the $1.4 billion in domestic distilled spirits shipped overseas last year.

A study backed by the American Craft Spirits Association reported the craft industry achieved $2.4 billion in retail sales in 2015, growing at a compound annual growth rate of 27.4%.

In 2015 the market share for craft spirits reached 2.2% in volume, up sharply from 0.8% in 2010

How can we make this happen?

The amount of support our community has given us already has been incredible. The buzz around town has us more motivated than ever. You can help us out by sharing this campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and e-mail. Send it to your mom, your best friend, your 3rd cousin in Oklahoma! 

#atlasdistillingco

The more we spread the word, the sooner you will be enjoying Atlas Distilling Co's handcrafted spirits!

Thanks, 

Ethan, Ryan, Yuri, Jenna, & Jade
story_txt: Launching soon - Atlas Distilling is a small-batch craft distillery and restaurant, housed at the 188 year-old Atlas Mill in Clinton, MI. Two Michiganders and a Washingtonian.We are Ryan, Ethan, and Yuri. Ryan and Ethan met in 4th grade and have been friends ever since. Ryan became a mechanical engineer, eventually working at one of the nation’s largest commercial distilleries in Iowa. Ethan left for Washington to pursue a career in law enforcement. Whenever we got back together, we talked about the idea of opening a distillery in our home state. It soon became more than an idea, we decided to make it a reality. What if we could bring a small-batch, farm to table, craft distillery to the most perfect little town in Michigan? After a long search, we came across the Atlas Mill, situated in the heart of Clinton, MI. The once operating 188-year-old mill was a staple of our village and the second oldest business in Michigan when it was half destroyed by arson in the late 2000s. With its rich history, we knew we had found the home of the Atlas Distilling Company.What will the historic Atlas Mill be making now?Smooth, crisp corn vodka, Michigan juniper berry gin, small-batch corn whiskeys aged and matured in our 188-year-old grain elevator. All of these spirits will utilize ingredients from local farms, including Ryan’s own family farm. That’s what we mean when we say farm-to-table.All of our spirits, including our vodka and gin, will be corn based, all grown locally. Truly keeping the spirit of the grain mill and southeast Michigan alive in our products. Our tasting room, labels, and brand are inspired by the Mill which gave us our name, and the town which gave us everything else.Keep an eye out for special edition runs of spirits like a Fall Festival Rum, Rye whiskeys, Grappa and anything else the village yearns for. A Distillery unlike any other in Michigan.We wanted Michigan corn being bottled at the old Atlas Mill. Now we just needed someone to help us make it a reality.  We called countless distillers, brewers, and anyone who may have a lead.  Gatling Still Works, our still manufacturer, told us they had found our man. Yuri Simon isn't new to the beverage world. With his 13 years of experience in brewing, winemaking,  and distilling, Yuri will start producing great craft spirits as soon as we fire up our still. Our still, a patented, one of a kind, work of art created by Henry of Gatling Still Works, is being custom ordered and made to our specifications. The flavor profiles and feel of the corn spirits coming out of our Alexandria still will be as unique as the still itself. The spirits won't be the only great thing being created by Atlas Distilling. When you come to our tasting room, you'll be able to dine on simple, delicious, fresh food. Our menu will be influenced by Michigan cuisine staples. Enjoy our food and laugh with your friends while you watch stand-up comedy, listen to bands, and play trivia against your neighbors. The same neighbors that made this distillery possible.Why Clinton, Michigan?We picked the Atlas site on impulse, overwhelmed by it's history and prominence in our village. We knew that we could overcome any shortcomings if we had this property for our distillery. Once we started our research, we realized how lucky we were to pick our hometown, Clinton, MI. 14,000 cars a day pass through our village along Michigan Ave.  Detroit, Ann Arbor, Jackson and Toledo are all within 50 miles. New homeowners are moving out to our slice of heaven in droves.  When folks are looking for a place to put roots down, we think our distillery may help them make that decision! What have we done so far?We bought the land and site of the mill knowing we had the perfect place. Next, we had to make sure we could legally use the property for distilling. We petitioned the Village of Clinton and successfully rezoned the land to allow us distill and serve food while maintaining what remains of the old mill. We have plans, blueprints, and renderings of what will be the future Atlas Distilling Co. Henry (our still maker) is waiting for us to give him the order to start building our still.We started with an idea, and now we're asking our friends, family, and you the community to help us raise our funds.Where you come in.Soon, you'll be able to sit by the Raisin River and make memories with neighbors, while sipping on a premium Clinton made liquor. You could also enjoy our craft spirits in the comfort of your own home with family and friends, but we can't do this without you. In order for us to start producing craft spirits, we need a place to house our custom Alexandria still. Your contributions will help raise a small tasting room right at the base of the Atlas Tower. Our goal of $170,000 will allow us to build a beautiful distillery. With $150,000 going directly to the build out and the remaining $20,000 being used to put a deposit on our still, fermenters, and other equipment.Once our campaign goal has been met, we will raise the remaining capital needed for the still bottles, barrels, and licenses through a traditional bank.  We need your help to get to there! Will I really be helping Atlas?Absolutely! - We can't thank you enough for investing in Atlas Distilling Co. When we open our doors and you crack open a bottle of corn spirits that YOU made possible, you can be assured you didn't just help Atlas, but Clinton and Michigan as well.  Atlas is about friends starting a business in the community they love and ensuring the community continues to grow for the next generation.Your contributions will have a direct impact on us, the community, and you, when you taste that perfect handcrafted Atlas cocktail. Proudly made right here in Clinton, Michigan.How risky is whiskey? Whiskey sales have been increasing year after year, quickly becoming scarce in some parts of the world. The supply for craft bourbon in particular can't keep up with the demand.  We may be local, but the demand is global."Whiskey in particular, the highest-priced products are flying off the shelves the fastest," Distilled Spirits Council spokesman Frank Coleman told The Associated Press. It's the sixth straight year that spirits have increased their market share in the overall alcohol industry relative to beer. " - Fortune MagazineUS whiskeys are also setting the export pace, accounting for 70 percent of the $1.4 billion in domestic distilled spirits shipped overseas last year.A study backed by the American Craft Spirits Association reported the craft industry achieved $2.4 billion in retail sales in 2015, growing at a compound annual growth rate of 27.4%.In 2015 the market share for craft spirits reached 2.2% in volume, up sharply from 0.8% in 2010How can we make this happen?The amount of support our community has given us already has been incredible. The buzz around town has us more motivated than ever. You can help us out by sharing this campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and e-mail. Send it to your mom, your best friend, your 3rd cousin in Oklahoma! #atlasdistillingcoThe more we spread the word, the sooner you will be enjoying Atlas Distilling Co's handcrafted spirits!Thanks, Ethan, Ryan, Yuri, Jenna, & Jade

story:
Most hangover relief products currently on the market need to taken before, during, or just after drinking, which when you think about it, is just ridiculous. Not everyone plans for a hangover, and besides, the morning after is when you really need a remedy! Our kit is the only one which can be taken the night before or the morning after and tastes like an orange Julius to boot.  

The pharmacist-created Sunday Morning Hangover Helper takes a 4-pronged approach to helping your body detoxifying and really shake the effects of a wild night out. Try it today, and be the Sunday Morning Hangover Hero you deserve!

 

Sunday Mornings hangover helper can be used in two ways:

Option I.

 

 

Option II.

 

 

We gave our product to beta testers across this nation and here's their response to our product!

 

"It really helps!"  -George, Photographer

" I can get back to working out after a night of drinking"  -Rachel, Journalist

"My go-to product whenever I have a hangover" -Roxy, Fitness Model

"My Sunday Mornings are perfect" -Macy,  Artist

"Ready to keep going" -Nadia, Yoga Instructor

"I love the product!! It was as if I didn't drink the night before." -Vincent E.
 
"Best hangover cure I've ever tried. Makes me feel like I'm 20 again." -Shlomi R.
 
"I used their remedy and was alert all day. I was able to play sports, and function perfectly the next day. Thanks for the extra energy." -Julian P.
 
"I've seriously have tried every hangover remedy out there and have been disappointed UNTIL I tried this one......let me tell you, it's incredible." -Samantha O.
 
 
 

 

 

 

 

 

 
 

The Sunday Morning Hangover Helper uses a 4 Pronged approach to helping you recover from a Hangover.

 

Dihydromyricetin (DHM) and Artichoke extract

Artichoke extract: Artichoke is used to stimulate the flow of bile from the liver, and this is thought to help reduce the symptoms of heartburn and alcohol hangover. Dihydromyricetin also known as Ampelopsin which naturally occurs in Asian plant species such as Ampelopsis grossedentata (Moyeam tree) has been used in traditional Asian medicines for years as a tea to cure hangovers and liver disease.

 

Essential Vitamins and Minerals

The B-complex vitamins, Vitamin C and some electrolytes are especially vulnerable and are destroyed by alcohol. 

These vitamins are essential to our physical and mental well being and are included in Sunday Mornings Hangover Helper kit in reasonable doses.  Sulbutiamine is an advanced form of vitamin B1 (thiamine)  which is absorbed in the body more readily allowing replenishment to brain cells.  

 

Electrolytes

Our product includes an electrolyte balance recommended by the world health organization for re-hydration therapy!  Again, in reasonable doses. 


 

White willow bark extract and Caffeine

White Willow Bark Extract and Caffeine help soothe headaches. Willow Bark is Nature’s Aspirin

Our kit includes the same amount of Caffeine as a cup of coffee, not too much. Caffeine helps with headaches and a natural diuretic to flush out toxins after re-hydrating. 



 

 

Consult your physician before using our product if you are allergic to Aspirin or taking blood thinner medications 

OUR PRODUCT IS COMPOUNDED AND PACKAGED IN THE USA IN FACILITIES WHO FOLLOW FDA RECOMMENDED GOOD MANUFACTURING PRACTICES (GMP)

 

 
Dr.Eric Wood a Naturopathic physician talks about the ingredients in the hangover helper

 

My budget for the Hangover Helper was exhausted during the thorough research and development process, and while I was able to have a limited run to gather feedback and suggestions from users, larger scale production is much too expensive for me to handle on my own. Thus, this campaign.

Getting Hangover Helper into stores across the country means being first able to produce enough of the product, hire distributors, establish shipping routes, and build a team to oversee all the things that I can’t. Your contributions are what will make all of this a reality, and get this show on the road.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Want to stay at a beautiful hotel in Mexico? By supporting our campaign, you can get the change to have a hangover worthy experience at the Mexico Palace Mayan Rivera. From stunning oceanfront beaches to giant swimming pools, plus an award-winning golf course, and striking eco-flora, there’s so much to do with no hangover to nurse.

*Airfare, minimal resort fees and, local taxes are not included. US and Canada Residents only. 

 

Other Ways to Help

Even if you can’t donate, you can still help get Hangover Helper in stores and right at your fingertips if you ever need it. Please share our campaign via email, social media, and even word of mouth to anyone who might be interested. Let’s get the ball rolling. Cheers in advance!

 

 

* These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease

 

Special Thank You to our video production partners for doing a bang up job!

story:
We are Zippr Energy, creator and producer of the Zippr Energy tablets.  We make a caffeinated tablet that bestows energy helping a multitude of people in many ways.  The tablet is a zesty orange flavor.  We have more caffeine than a Red Bull energy drink and slightly less than a Monster drink.  Like those we provide 5 hours of energy.  The Zippr Energy tablet will not give the user jitters or the dreaded crash if used without additional caffeine.    There are four tablets to a Zippr packet.

Our Zippr Energy tablet is chewable or dissolves in your mouth. No water needed.  The advantages over an energy drink or shot are twofold: 

1. The Zippr Energy is easily portable.  Can be carried anywhere in a pocket or purse. 

2. It is less expensive, usually $4.00 per packet of four.  A comparable energy drink or shot will cost over $10 for the equivalent four portions.  People who purchase the Zippr Energy 30 tablet bottle will save more.

There is no other five-hour energy product that is simpler to carry and use.  There is also no other five-hour energy product that is as jitter and crash free(if not consumed with additional caffeine).  

Zippr Energy tablets are manufactured in a NSF certified clean room factory and made with the highest quality natural ingredients including:

                  B6 and B12 vitamins

                  Natural Caffeine

                  L-Taurine

                  Green Tea

                  Ginseng.

                  Only 5 calories!

  The Zippr Energy tablet provides personal energy in four important ways.

  1. Increases Alertness, avoids being drowsy.
  2. Focus, maintain attention. 
  3. Retain, elevate memory ability.
  4. Endurance, stay on task longer.

Athletes of course can benefit from Zippr Energy.  As the product increases endurance and quickness.  Zippr wants to be there for them.  Athletes can utilize the benefits in Olympic and in the USA Nation Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) events.

Zippr Energy can assist many people to perform their jobs and tasks.  First Responders; including forest wild fire fighters, hospital emergency room residents, military engaged in action or on guard duty, single working Mom’s, truck and highway drivers.  The list goes on.

Zippr Energy was founded by Steve Whittaker and Richard Dunikoski.  We believe Zippr Energy tablets can make a positive difference in people’s lives.  We want to thank all of the people and companies that have helped Zippr create our tablets.  Most of all  Good Health Manufacturing of Chandler, Arizona.

Funding

Zippr Energy is seeking to raise $20,000.  The funds will be used for additional equipment, and start a social media marketing campaign.

Forest Fire Fighter’s, Hot Shots

We would like to offer contributor’s the chance to have Zippr Energy Tablets donated to active forest fighters.  While fighting a forest fire many fighters spend 12-14 or more hours in one shift.  They become exhausted.  Zippr is not a cure for their exhaustion, but an aide to endure.  If you wish with your contribution you can have Zippr tablets provided for free to forest fighters.  Zippr will have them delivered to the base camp, available free to all.

Rewards Delivery:  The contributions for Hot Shot’s deployed will start immediately.  For the contributors please expect delivery in approximately 90 days.

In Addition:  Zippr Energy will also provide free of charge the Zippr Energy tablets to as many Disaster Relief workers as we can.  Hurricanes, tornados, earthquakes, and flooding all require people to assist those that need help.  Zippr’s emphasis will be on forests fire fighters, because they receive very low pay, but will help all that is possible.

story:
Short Summary

Pure Roasters are a 2 person team based in Dumbarton, Scotland.  We've been blending ethical coffee beans for the last year and have established a good name in the coffee world.

Due to our continued popularity we have been growing fast.  To accommodate this new business we want to move into a coffee manufacturing plant and introduce some new more experimental coffees to the Scottish market.

This is where we need you!  We have spent every penny we have in getting new roasting equipment built while keeping up with rising operating expenses due to increased sales.  A good problem to have, but a problem nonetheless...

 

This campaign will raise the small amount of up-front investment needed to add to our range of blends by introducing flavour fusions e.g Whisky barrel, Scottish Heather, lavender and vanilla.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need £10k to order the additional beans, grinding machinery, infusion elements and packaging.

In return for your investment we will provide you with exclusive access to our new blends and a 4 tier reward system:

£10 - We will send you a personalised thank you note and a 250g bag of the latest blend.

£20 - We will send you a personalised thank you note and a 1Kg bag of the latest blend.

£100 - You will receive 6 months of our coffee subscription service 1Kg package inc T-shirt

£1000 - If you are kind enough to invest £1000 you have naming rights over one of our micro batch blends, 1 year of 1kg per month coffee subscription and every piece of merch we release in the next year.  You may also visit the new roastery to see your blend being made and take bags home as gifts for family and friends. 

If we don't reach the entire goal within the short 1 week time-frame we will still use funds to assist in our roastery move and will honour the tier system with currently available blends.

The Impact

We have come on leaps and bounds since operating a small cafe in Dumbarton.  We used the time well to find out what customers want in a cup of coffee.

We intend to grow our team up to 15 staff by end of year 3.  Your investment will help us achieve this.  Our monthly sales are already above £10k per month and we have over 250 regular coffee subscribers.

Aside from the funny names, our coffee really does make a difference to the farmers who produce it.  We only ever use ethically sourced beans and make sure the farmers are paid well.

Your money isn't just going to a promising Scottish company and creating jobs in an area that needs the work.  You are also helping to eradicate commodity (slave trade) coffee from the world market.

Our new premises should create a small amount of tourism too, with visitors dropping by to sample the freshest coffee Scotland has to offer.

Risks & Challenges

As with any business we will likely face adversity on our journey.  Fear not!  Don and I (Robert) have a solid track record of being creative in challenging situations and making negatives turn to positives.

We seen our strongest growth ever during lock-down for example.  By pivoting quickly from events to online marketing we were able to continue to grow with no slow-down in sales whatsoever.

It's likely that moving premises while sales are still rising will put a serious strain on cash-flow. We have applied for Scottish Edge funding as well as a Scottish government loan as back-up to working capital.

It may also be tough to build a brand with so many high quality competitors.  We will continue to compete in this area by standing out as the specialty coffee brand for the average person on the street.  Wee have engaged the services of a marketing agency to help us scale our marketing in line  with customer demand.

As the working environment changes for everyone, we plan to stay flexible and open minded with a focus on serving our local community and remaining ethical at the same time as producing a healthy balance sheet.

Other Ways You Can Help

We get it, not everyone is flush with cash right now.  Don't feel bad if you can't invest in our campaign.  We really appreciate all the support so far.  Sharing our campaign, mentioning our name or even leaving us a review on how you think our coffee tastes are all really helpful to us and we appreciate your time just as much.

 

Thank you for reading,

Robert & Don

Team Roaster

We have come on leaps and bounds since operating a small cafe in Dumbarton.  We used the time well to find out what customers want in a cup of coffee.
We intend to grow our team up to 15 staff by end of year 3.  Your investment will help us achieve this.  Our monthly sales are already above £10k per month and we have over 250 regular coffee subscribers.
Aside from the funny names, our coffee really does make a difference to the farmers who produce it.  We only ever use ethically sourced beans and make sure the farmers are paid well.
Your money isn't just going to a promising Scottish company and creating jobs in an area that needs the work.  You are also helping to eradicate commodity (slave trade) coffee from the world market.
Our new premises should create a small amount of tourism too, with visitors dropping by to sample the freshest coffee Scotland has to offer.

Risks & Challenges
As with any business we will likely face adversity on our journey.  Fear not!  Don and I (Robert) have a solid track record of being creative in challenging situations and making negatives turn to positives.
We seen our strongest growth ever during lock-down for example.  By pivoting quickly from events to online marketing we were able to continue to grow with no slow-down in sales whatsoever.
It's likely that moving premises while sales are still rising will put a serious strain on cash-flow. We have applied for Scottish Edge funding as well as a Scottish government loan as back-up to working capital.
It may also be tough to build a brand with so many high quality competitors.  We will continue to compete in this area by standing out as the specialty coffee brand for the average person on the street.  Wee have engaged the services of a marketing agency to help us scale our marketing in line  with customer demand.
As the working environment changes for everyone, we plan to stay flexible and open minded with a focus on serving our local community and remaining ethical at the same time as producing a healthy balance sheet.

Other Ways You Can Help
We get it, not everyone is flush with cash right now.  Don't feel bad if you can't invest in our campaign.  We really appreciate all the support so far.  Sharing our campaign, mentioning our name or even leaving us a review on how you think our coffee tastes are all really helpful to us and we appreciate your time just as much.
 
Thank you for reading,
Robert & Don
Team Roaster

story:
Short Summary

In Little Rock, only 1 out of 2 Black households are able to seek and sustain a thriving life defined by economic wholeness. Between disinvestment and lack of resources in Black communities, many of Little Rock's hardest workers are faced with grim choices for survival and little room to dream.

*WellBrewed Coffee Co will change that.*

Our plan is to start a Black-owned, mobile coffee company.

But, more importantly, our purpose is to do coffee with consciousness by driving resources and investments to people in the places that have been historically overlooked and trapped by economic inequities. That's right. A portion of the proceeds from our coffee sales will be dedicated to Black leaders and entrepreneurs committed to social change. That's why our tagline is "Brewing real D.R.I.P." Because we are re-defining the concept of drip as a movement with and for the betterment of Black lives and communities.

Supporting our campaign would not only give us the capacity to diversify the coffee scene in Little Rock but would also help us make room to begin addressing the wealth gap which continues to stifle the Black community at-large. 

What We Need & What You Get

To get our coffee truck up and running, we need at least $20,000! We know that the ask is sizable - but we are believing God for abundance. Our lives have been immeasurably enhanced by the generosity of our village. In many ways, our own dreams have taken shape because of the various investments of encouragement we have received over the years. And, now - as we see more and more Black death plastered on the news and small screens, the time is now to invest in Black life.  

We've done our research and hope to purchase the following with the funds raised:

  • A trailer, which will serve as the foundation for our mobile operation ~$2,500 
  • Coffee equipment, such as an espresso machine, grinder, etc. ~$4,500
  • Coffee truck retrofitting/building the mobile operation >=$10,000
  • Purchase of supplies & permits ~$3,000

By donating, we are happy to offer you several personalized perks, such as free coffee, swag items, and more. Click on the perks to see more details!

The Impact

Our vision is to find out how much good can come from a well brewed cup of coffee. To do that, we have an intentional model for social impact. Our recipe for impact has three ingredients: Rise. Grind. And Shine.

  • To Rise is to become conscious of solutions inviting your participation
  • To Grind is to engage in the cultivation of your gifts 
  • To Shine is to serve your community

Practically, that means our mobile coffee experience will include coffee sleeves with calls to action concerning pressing social issues, events connecting folks with other community leaders and business owners, and, finally, curating opportunities for pouring assets and the necessary change into our city.

Risks & Challenges

We are not strangers to hard work. We are young professionals, pastors, and people with diverse passions and gifts. But this coffee company will take our hustle to a new level. On top of that, a startup on the heels of a global pandemic will certainly present various challenges.

Challenges like:

  • Ensuring safe operational measures, including social distancing, when serving customers
  • Selecting ethically, locally, and (hopefully) Black-owned products, vendors, and contractors
  • Overcoming the hardships of entrepreneurship in an unstable economy

But, we've calculated the risks. And have decided that the reward of pouring into our communities is well worth taking our chances. So, regardless of the difficulties - we are betting on Black. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

So, what will it take for us to get there? 

Well, we need people like you - coffee drinkers with consciousness - to connect with us. Join your drip with our drip. Be a part of this family. This movement. This roast to get you woke.

With your support, we hope to begin operation by no later than Spring 2021.

In the meantime, we’re asking you to donate (if you are able), tell all your family and friends, and share this campaign on all your social media channels. And while you’re at it, follow us on Facebook and Instagram @wellbrewedcoffeeco.

Thank you so much! We can't wait to rise, grind, and shine with you!

story:
Hello, my name is Albert Mackoty. I’m an immigrant from Sierra Leone, West Africa. I grew up in communities where everyone depends on the environment for good nourishing food. The good thing is, the food I grew up with is all-natural, organic, GMO free, chemical free etc.

My wife and I started this Chiiri yogurt project 3 years ago in a quest to find the perfect dairy option for our picky son led us back to our roots.  With research and experimentation, Chiiri yogurt is now available in few stores in Abbotsford and Surrey.

Albert at a Chriiri Yogurt demo/tasting at Save-On-Foods, Abbotsford

A Thousand Years in the Making

Chiiri Yogurt has a storied history dating back more than 1000 years, when ancient inhabitants of the Sahel region in Africa hawk fermented milk products in characteristic beautifully decorated calabashes balanced on their heads. In West Africa, where is it known as Latchiiri or Bacee -a mildly sour-tasting yogurt is Africa’s heritage, and is still considered the best of all dairy products currently available.  Nothing tastes quite like it. It is made from fermenting milk into yoghurt and eaten with millet, sorghum, corn or couscous, either in the same bowl or separately. It is very satiating and keeps you feeling full and energized for the whole day. The yogurt is served only on special occasions and to VIP guests. This is very special!

Why We Need Your Help

Currently, we’ve launched Chiiri in one Save-On-Foods store through their amazing BC Local program to assist small local entrepreneurs. We want to scale up the recipe so we can make Chiiri available in a grocery store near you. But that is just the first step in a largely uphill battle to be able to share Chiiri on a wider scale on grocery store shelves. 

How the Big Supermarket Game Works 

Despite a lot of excitement and interest about Chiiri, the grocery game is largely a PAY to PLAY game, and an expensive one too. There are two primary barriers that make it extremely hard for new entrants like us: Slotting Fees, and Category Captains.

Slotting fees are fees that most large grocery chains in North America charge in exchange for a new product to have shelf space in their stores. These fees have been known to run anywhere from $25k for regional placement up to several million for national placement.

Category captains are a common practice also used by these chains whereby they allow the leading sellers of a particular category, e.g. yogurt, ice cream, etc. to decide where all of the other products should go on the shelf. In practice, this gives them the advantage of being able to place competitor products in hard to access or little noticed areas of a shelf, for instance behind a hinge in the freezer aisle. 80-90% of new products fail within a relatively short period of time (FTC Staff Report, 2001). 

This article and short video from Vox (The hidden war over grocery shelf space) provides a good illustration of how these practices can pose enormous barriers to entry for a new product like Chiiri, and the consequence is that consumer choice is significantly reduced.

Fortunately, there is still a way for new players to enter the market. This requires a grassroots effort like Save-On-Foods’ amazing “Local Program.” Save-On-Foods have given us a chance at proving ourselves at the local level, and eventually to a regional level, if merited, brought to the national level, and potentially even across the border in USA and Mexico! Ultimately, if there are enough people demanding our product, we will be able to allocate some of the funds raised towards the most critical aspects of getting Chiiri onto store shelves. 

Our hometown of Abbotsford and the province of BC is a particularly favorable place for a new food startup to thrive, and we believe we can get to the top with your support. Together, we can overcome!

Support us now and reach out to at least five other people you know will support us. Together, we can inspire a better world through food.

 

Our Goals for this Campaign Project

Goal 1 - Head Above Water: $15,000

Bringing a new product to the market is a daunting task. The $15,000 goal will help us to:  

  • Scale up the recipe for efficient Chiiri production.
  • Contract a co-packer for Chiiri production.
  • Complete payment for the product branding.

 

Goal 2 - Impact Maker: $100,000

If we achieve the $100,000 Stretch Goal# 2, we will able to:

  • Meet all certification requirements for Organic, Gluten-Free, and Non-GMO.
  • Add more unique flavours including Coconut, Mango, Lemon, Black Cherry, Raspberry, Peach.

Goal 3 - Go Nuts (Dream Maker): $300,000

If we achieve the $300,000 Stretch Goal# 3, we will able to:

  • Lease a production facility.
  • Purchase or lease production equipment to efficiently produce Chiiri and reduce cost for our customers.
  • Get listed on national and international grocery store accounts.

Thank you for your generous support. Thank you for believing in us. Many hands does make the heavy work light. We will keep you up-to-date with this on-going story. Please keep checking this project for updates.

Complete payment for the product branding.

story:
Short Summary

  • The goal of our campaign is to raise awareness about our food and salad-growing products so more families will have access to nourishing, healthy foods at a price they can afford.
  • We want you to try our products. We hope you’ll be so impressed with them that you’ll tell your friends and relatives about us.
  • We’ll use your contribution to expand our marketing campaign for all our products, and expand our outreach to schools in the Mid-Atlantic region.
  • Contribute to our campaign and get a tasty perk while helping us grow our company and the school salad gardens we support.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We're trying to raise $25,000 to help us encourage more people try our products. The funds will allow us to market our products, build 4 new school salad gardens, and pay for the perks we’re offering to those who contribute to the campaign.
  • Depending on your contribution, you can choose from a tasty array of our food products, or get your very own "Grow Fresh Salad" container garden kit.
  • The funds we raise will go toward expanding our production capacity and our marketing efforts so we can help serve you better in the future. Your support will also help more schools grow a fresh salad for their students.

The Impact

  • We've learned a lot over the past 3 years, as we (and energetic 3rd graders) established a salad garden at a school near Washington D.C. We’re now in the process of building gardens at 4 more schools. The students learn that gardening is fun and interesting, while also learning how to grow food, and how to make the healthy salads that are featured each week in their school lunch program.
  • Order a salad garden for your home, and we'll match your pledge by building a similar garden at a school. 

Risks & Challenges

  • Everyone knows that the food business is complicated and challenging. We’ve been at this a long time, and we’ve learned a lot along the way. With your help, we can flourish and help you do the same.
  • We prepare our food products in a licensed, commercial kitchen in Pennsylvania. We’ve worked for years to develop the right recipes, featuring the best and freshest ingredients that our region offers. Now, we’re ready to bring our Easy Meals to your table at a reasonable price.
  • We’ve also been growing vegetables for decades and have been exploring ways to make gardening easier and more enjoyable. Our instant salad garden is the result of years of playing in dirt! It is specifically designed to enhance your life, fit your schedule, and improve your diet—all with very little work on your part. The extra bonus? Our school program helps young students achieve the same results.
  • We can ship our products directly to your home or office. To save money, we'll set you up with a group-buying discount program that delivers multiple orders to a convenient pickup location. This approach saves you money and cuts down on transport costs and emissions.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Contribute to our campaign.
  • Ask your family, friends, co-workers, and anyone else you know, to visit our campaign and make a pledge.
  • Let us know about a school that might be interested in our salad garden program. We’ll take it from there.

Thanks for your interest and your support!

Thanks for your interest and your support!

story:
Short Summary

Uncle Ted's Chilli Jam is a jam like nothing on the market. Our Chilli Jam is a freshly made product giving a spicy Indian taste to many dishes. We at Uncle Ted's believe in "Farm-to-Table" where we find local farmers in the Catskill's area of New York and Pennsylvania to grow our fresh ingredients on a seasonal basis.  Since our jam ages well over time, we hope to make smaller batches at different heat levels to keep the freshness and quality to the highest standard.

                                         

Our short story is about a family who many years ago took a leap of faith and crossed the oceans to find a better life. After 30 years two family members found themselves to be such foodies. After spending many days and nights only talking about food and the places they had cooked, recipes where exchanged between them. With books that could have been written by them, one took the chance of making Chilli Jam for his new friends and family. Seeing the response was far greater than he could have imagined, he moved to the countryside and with his farming ideas started making and designing the product. With the drive to eat freshly made foods, he would like to bring this to the market for all to try and share. With your help he would be able to open the business and sell the product at local farmers markets and online to people around the United States.

Where are we now:

After a year of testing and coming up with different levels of heat, we have a 10oz jar with a great label and design. We have proved that we can make Chilli Jam safe for storage in a jar until opened. Last summer 100 jars where made and sealed to be given out for outside judgment.  With no surprise the response was overwhelming, with most people coming back for more or asking for orders so they could give out as gifts.

We want to open the company and get testing from the FDA at Cornell University so we can sell in a retail setting. Since we believe in staying local and giving back, we have found two shared kitchens that can be rented for us to produce and package the product safely to all FDA standards and start making small batches.

Please come join us on our journey in bringing our product from our table to yours by placing a pre-order or just by funding us.

 

Be mindful and always eat fresh food.

                                                                                  

We are looking for funding in two ways.

You can pre-order jars to be shipped once the FDA approval is made. All pre-orders will be shipped in the first batch made in 2018 with a shipping date of August.

Or make a pledge into our dream and story with no reward.

 

                                                                                                                 

Chilli Jam made with Indian imagination

Used as a spread or dip for any dish

Made from fresh ingredients

Our pledge to our customers is making Chilli Jam in small batches from local fresh ingredients so we can give you the best quality. Each year we will take steps towards having our own farm, so we can produce most of our ingredients in house.       

 

                                Pre-Ordering

$12 Single jar of Uncle Teds Chilli Jam at the level of heat that is just right for you. Shipping not included.

$36 For our family set, 3 bottles from level I to Level II. This set is designed for everyone in mind no matter how much heat you can handle. Shipping not included.

$48 For all four levels we make. With each level increasing until you get to the top level of the Chilli Jam. Shipping not included.

                                                                                  

                                                                Make A Pledge to our funding

Open pledge without a reward.

$200 A personal thank you letter and thank you on our website with a delivered of a family pack, a sticker.

$500 A personal thank you letter and thank you on our website with a delivered of all four levels, a sticker.

$1000 A personal thank you letter and thank you on our website with a delivered of all four levels, a sticker and plus extras.

 

Your goal of $10,000 and with our goal being made, we will buy a small amount of equipment for our production. Since we are using a shared kitchen to make Chilli Jam we are able to keep equipment start up to its lowest. Our biggest cost out of the funding will go to FDA testing at Cornell University. Cornell University offers the Scheduled Process testing that is required to prove Chilli Jam is storage safe and approved for consumption. The final step will be to receive our C-20 license from Pennsylvania and New York State Department of Agriculture and Markets. Pre-ordering will give us a chance to make a total of 1200 jars in 2018.

 

“The discovery of a new dish does more for the happiness of the human race than the discovery of a star.”
                           ― Jean Anthelme Brillat-Savarin

               

      2018 Schedule

February-April

Indiegogo funding                                                                        

FDA Approval with C-20 License                                  

Design our website and food blog

May-August

Produce a total of 1200 jars of Chilli Jam. Each level will increase in heat until you get to level IIII with this level being very hot for most of our customers.

Farmer Markets

Callicoon Farmers Market in Callicoon, New York.

Narrowsburg Farmers Market in Narrowsburg, New York

Main Street Farmers Market in Honesdale, Pennsylvania

Coming soon our online store

 

“Pull up a chair. Take a taste. Come join us. Life is so endlessly delicious.”
― Ruth Reichl

With books that could have been written by them, one took the chance of making Chilli Jam for his new friends and family. Seeing the response was far greater than he could have imagined, he moved to the countryside and with his farming ideas started making and designing the product. With the drive to eat freshly made foods, he would like to bring this to the market for all to try and share. With your help he would be able to open the business and sell the product at local farmers markets and online to people around the United States.
Where are we now:
After a year of testing and coming up with different levels of heat, we have a 10oz jar with a great label and design. We have proved that we can make Chilli Jam safe for storage in a jar until opened. Last summer 100 jars where made and sealed to be given out for outside judgment.  With no surprise the response was overwhelming, with most people coming back for more or asking for orders so they could give out as gifts.
We want to open the company and get testing from the FDA at Cornell University so we can sell in a retail setting. Since we believe in staying local and giving back, we have found two shared kitchens that can be rented for us to produce and package the product safely to all FDA standards and start making small batches.
Please come join us on our journey in bringing our product from our table to yours by placing a pre-order or just by funding us.
 
Be mindful and always eat fresh food.
                                                                                   
We are looking for funding in two ways.
You can pre-order jars to be shipped once the FDA approval is made. All pre-orders will be shipped in the first batch made in 2018 with a shipping date of August.
Or make a pledge into our dream and story with no reward.                                                                                                                   
Chilli Jam made with Indian imagination
Used as a spread or dip for any dish
Made from fresh ingredients
Our pledge to our customers is making Chilli Jam in small batches from local fresh ingredients so we can give you the best quality. Each year we will take steps towards having our own farm, so we can produce most of our ingredients in house.       
 

                                Pre-Ordering
$12 Single jar of Uncle Teds Chilli Jam at the level of heat that is just right for you. Shipping not included.
$36 For our family set, 3 bottles from level I to Level II. This set is designed for everyone in mind no matter how much heat you can handle. Shipping not included.
$48 For all four levels we make. With each level increasing until you get to the top level of the Chilli Jam. Shipping not included.
                                                                                   
                                                                Make A Pledge to our funding
Open pledge without a reward.
$200 A personal thank you letter and thank you on our website with a delivered of a family pack, a sticker.
$500 A personal thank you letter and thank you on our website with a delivered of all four levels, a sticker.
$1000 A personal thank you letter and thank you on our website with a delivered of all four levels, a sticker and plus extras.
 
Your goal of $10,000 and with our goal being made, we will buy a small amount of equipment for our production. Since we are using a shared kitchen to make Chilli Jam we are able to keep equipment start up to its lowest. Our biggest cost out of the funding will go to FDA testing at Cornell University. Cornell University offers the Scheduled Process testing that is required to prove Chilli Jam is storage safe and approved for consumption. The final step will be to receive our C-20 license from Pennsylvania and New York State Department of Agriculture and Markets. Pre-ordering will give us a chance to make a total of 1200 jars in 2018.
 
“The discovery of a new dish does more for the happiness of the human race than the discovery of a star.”                            ― Jean Anthelme Brillat-Savarin

               
      2018 Schedule
February-April
Indiegogo funding                                                                        
FDA Approval with C-20 License                                  
Design our website and food blog
May-August
Produce a total of 1200 jars of Chilli Jam. Each level will increase in heat until you get to level IIII with this level being very hot for most of our customers.
Farmer Markets
Callicoon Farmers Market in Callicoon, New York.
Narrowsburg Farmers Market in Narrowsburg, New York
Main Street Farmers Market in Honesdale, Pennsylvania
Coming soon our online store
 
“Pull up a chair. Take a taste. Come join us. Life is so endlessly delicious.” ― Ruth Reichl

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I’m Brittany, former co-owner and creator of Everyday Gourmet Cafe and Badass Power Cookie.  I am passionate about food and it’s important to me that I don’t harm anything in the process.  Being a working mom has had its highs and lows, so starting small to have more flexibility is gonna be my jam.

What We Need & What You Get

Luckily this is a small start up with minimal overhead, so here’s what’s needed:

  • $2,000 for a pre-owned cart and kitchen supplies and $500 for goods.
  • With your contribution, you will receive a free item when the stand is up and running at a festival.
  • If the funding isn’t fully met, the project is still a go, but wil take a little longer.  I’d like to start up this summer as soon as possible!

The Impact

Plant based meat is the future.  The taste and texture has come a long way to satisfy even an avid animal meat eater.  What you put on your plate impacts animal and human lives, the environment and your health:

  • With your contribution, you are helping make plant based food more accessible at Rochester (and surrounding areas) festivals.
  • I have some pretty great taste buds, so I know what to bring to the table.  Really satisfying comfort food is on the menu.

Risks & Challenges

There are always some risks and obstacles on the way to achieving a goal but here is a list of items that need to be accomplished:

  • Getting a good deal on a pre-owned hot dog cart.
  • Obtaining the necessary licenses.
  • Start up funds.
  • But that’s it!  Because this is a small endeavor, it’s totally do-able.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
How it all began ...

My wife and I are of the belief that having a child does not mean lifestyles have to change. As full-time working parents, we look forward to family time together. Further, we can't wait to introduce the beautiful world we live in to our child.

We enjoy travelling. Different sights, customs and cultures, people and food. However, travelling with a young child has its challenges ... like lugging around an over-sized (and heavy) nappy bag. Despite this, family outings create precious memories. These are priceless moments.

There are many modern day solutions that can make travelling with a baby or toddler easy. However, there was this one thing that we continually struggled with - the infant formula dispenser! 

 

Infant Formula Dispenser ("The Problem")

Infant milk formula has been around for over 120 years. However, its packaging has stayed largely the same. Whereas in the early days one parent or caregiver used to stay home, today many of us lead busy lifestyles that can be described as "on-the-go". 

 

So as to provide babies and toddlers with a milk bottle during an outing, infant formula is usually repackaged in a plastic dispenser that is commonly available off-the-shelf. It has a number of functional limitations, but more concerning, it potentially exposes the child to a number of hygiene risks.

 

Our Objectives 

As parents, we naturally want to give our child the best. As we researched further into the different options for storing and dispensing of infant formula, this led to more questions.  

 

And so, we set out to develop an infant milk formula dispenser that would meet the lifestyle needs of today's parents and caregivers, based on the ethos of For Parents; By Parents. From our research, we also summed up what are important to caregivers in a list of five priorities.

 

PACK ("The Solution")

Over the past two years we have spoken with numerous parents and caregivers in New Zealand, Australia, United States, Singapore and Hong Kong. We consulted with industry experts on consumable products and packaging designers. We also went on a deep dive learning curve to learn about environmentally-friendly packaging materials. 

This led to the development of eight prototypes, incorporating physics theories and aesthetic design to allow for maximal robustness when preparing a milk bottle while on-the-go. Each version was subsequently put through rigorous testing for functionality and ease-of-use. 

The end result is truly rewarding. The process was less so ... (see below for a laugh!).

We wanted a product that not only addressed the needs of today's parents and caregivers, but one that provided 'convenience' and 'peace of mind'. With approximately 250 babies born per minute around the world each day, PACK provides an effective and practical solution to bulky nappy bags.

 

Proof of Concept

The uniqueness of PACK was validated with the award of two patents for dispenser and method of use in New Zealand and Australia. 

 

PACK was also selected as a Top 6 finalist at Innovate 2017.

How it Works

Step 1: Fill your own infant milk formula. 

(PACK can hold up to 7 scoops of infant formula. This equates to around 350ml of formula).  NB: Scoop size varies from different brands of infant formula.   

 

Step 2: Tear to create outlet.

 

 
Step 3: Dispense in milk bottle.
 
 
 
NB: Please note that the GIFs here were filmed using a prototype. 

 

We NEED your Support

We truly believe PACK is a product that will bring convenience to parents and caregivers, and more importantly, ensure that infant formula is hygienically repackaged for consumption when feeding a child while on-the-go.

Your pledge will go towards the manufacture of two high precision laser-cut moulds, required for an accelerated production run, and an education campaign on the importance of infant food packaging.

Thank you for your support.

 

 

Risks and Challenges

Setting up a business has had its crazy moments (i.e., regulatory compliance, patent applications, working with limited resources etc). However, over the past two years our extensive research and engagement with industry experts and caregivers have helped to mitigate a number of business risks. 

While we are now at production ready stage, we recognise the need to continue working hard and making improvements to our product. 

 

Can You Support our Campaign?

If you like what we have to offer, please support us by purchasing one of the exciting perks we have lined up. This could be for a family member, a colleague, friend, or even yourself.

Additionally, we would be grateful if you could share our campaign with your network.

Thank you. 

For Parents; By Parents.
