story:
ABOUT STRIPED LION DISTILLING

Our company was founded by a family of rum aficionados. Kevin and Erin have been married for more than 15 years and have been collecting varieties of rum for more than a dozen years.  After tasting aged rum on a trip to Bermuda in 2006, we began slowly tasting and collecting rums of different varieties and styles, from different regions of the world.  Our collection has grown to include more than 300 different rum expressions!  Kevin’s sister Kanesha is also a rum enthusiast and has partnered in the effort.

We had been playing with the idea of “moving to an island so we can grow sugar cane and make rum” for several years because there was no provision in our home state for creating distilled spirits as a small-scale business.  Legal craft distilling is a relatively new but growing industry in our home state of New Jersey.  With our love of rum in its many iterations and our backgrounds in science and technology, the decision was made to pursue this business.  We got to work developing recipes, attending distillery production and management courses, finding our location, and purchasing equipment.

We have been developing this project for more than three years.  The process for opening a distillery is long and tedious due to the regulatory requirements for the distilled spirits industry.  Distilled spirits production is a highly regulated industry, and every detail is important.  We have already received our federal permit, and the application for our state license is in process.  We have been working on renovating our distilling space, and we are currently working on the construction needed to make our tasting room area both functional and beautiful.

 

Our distillery will be one of the very few United States distilleries (if not the only) that is both a minority- and a women-owned business.  We’ll be making the majority of our rum varieties on site and will be personally selecting a blend of international rums, creating a proprietary aged spirit for our patrons to enjoy while we wait for our house-made spirits to age to our liking.

 

OUR VISION

We love rum and can appreciate its multitude of expressions and varieties.  As our collection and our knowledge of rum has grown, we have discovered that rum is generally a misunderstood spirit.  We’re going to change that!  Rum has many faces, with some that are best enjoyed alone to others that are enjoyed more commonly in mixed drinks.  Its versatility as compared to other distilled spirits is unparalleled.  We will be creating many different expressions of rum, so we can educate our visitors on the different ways that rum can be enjoyed. 

Woodbury is a small city in New Jersey in the Philadelphia metropolitan area and is the county seat of Gloucester County.  Many years ago, it was a bustling city with a busy downtown area.  Over time, the downtown area became less busy but is now in the process of re-establishing a successful business corridor.  This is a local community, and our distillery will be part of the trending redevelopment process.

 

WHAT WE NEED

While we have initiated our state license application, the license cannot be processed without a certificate of occupancy, which is contingent upon installation of a fire protection system in our building.  We want our employees and visitors to know that they are safe.  The fire protection system is quite expensive, so this fundraising effort is to purchase items for the tasting room and lounge areas.  This will allow funds that were earmarked for those items to go toward the fire protection system.  You can contribute toward the spaces you’ll be enjoying – and get some great perks in the process to show your support!

 

Here’s how the funds will be used: 

WHAT YOU GET

While there will be limited-time perks added throughout the campaign, here are some of the awesome perks you’ll be able to get with your contribution:

$10 - Come On By:  Thank you so much for contributing to our campaign!  If you provide a mailing address, you will get a personalized thank you note that can be redeemed for a one-time discount in our retail store when you come to visit!

$25 - Show of Support: Choose this perk, and you'll get a branded shot glass and a car cling, not to mention a personalized thank you note!

$50 - Shaken or Stirred: How do you like your favorite cocktail?  You'll get a cocktail shaker with our logo, a shot glass, a bar spoon, and a few of our favorite recipes, so you can recreate them at home!

 

$50 - "Mane" Supporter: You will get an EXCLUSIVE tee shirt, available only through our crowdfunding campaign.  Wear your tee shirt on a visit to the distillery for a special surprise!

$50 - Name on the Wall: Choose this perk, and you'll have your name added to our tasting room wall!  We are commissioning a wall wrap with the names of our supporters, to be a permanent addition to our tasting room wall.  When you come by, you can find your name and point it out to all of your friends so they'll know YOU helped make this happen!

$75 - Get Your Swag On: Having trouble deciding?  With this perk, you'll get an exclusive tee shirt AND will get your name on the tasting room wall.  When you come by, you can find your name and point it out to all of your friends so they'll know YOU helped make this happen!

$100 - There's MY Name: Your name will appear on our tasting room wall feature with PREMIUM placement.  With a larger 48 pt bold font, your name will be easier to find.  When you come by, you can find your name and point it out to all of your friends so they'll know YOU helped make this happen!

$99 - Lioness: Selecting this perk will score you a V-neck Ladies' Tee in black or white, a black Tank Top, and a sophisticated coupe glass.  

$99 - King of the Jungle : Show your support by choosing this perk, which includes a Men's Tee in black or white, a flask, and a soft , adjustable chino baseball cap.

 

$100 - Gimme A Taste:  Grab this perk for a voucher to be used for any of our cocktail tasting events.  You'll also get an exclusive glass when you attend your event. *Restricted to guests 21 years of age and older*

$750 - Celebration Time: With this perk, you will receive 4 vouchers good for admission to our VIP Events (you may redeem multiple vouchers for one event).  You will also be recognized on our PREMIUM level wall feature and will receive  a PREMIUM flask set.  You'll be placed on our VIP mailing list to receive invitations to exclusive events and  you will be among the first to know of new releases!

$1000 - The ULTIMATE Perk: Do you want it ALL?  Well, then this perk's for you!  You'll receive 4 vouchers good for admission to our VIP Events (you may redeem multiple vouchers for one event), and 2 vouchers for admission to our cocktail tastings.  You'll also be recognized on our PREMIUM level wall feature and will receive 2 tee shirts, a baseball cap, 2 cocktail glasses, a cockail kit, and  a PREMIUM flask set.  Of course, you will also be added to our VIP mailing list and will receive a thank you note!

We also have special LIMITED TIME or LIMITED QUANTITY perks, including an opportunity to put your name on the back of a chair or a bar stool!

 

WHAT ARE THE RISKS AND CHALLENGES?

Our timeline for opening is dependent on our licensing – we cannot make a drop of liquor without BOTH the federal and the state licenses.  The licensure is, in turn, dependent upon us having our fire protection system installed.  There may be a shift in the timeline for fulfillment for some of the perks if we have further delays in obtaining this system.

We have developed an extensive network of experienced distillers, rum enthusiasts, and distilling equipment specialists in an effort to minimize potential startup challenges. 

Our advisory panel includes several bartenders and distilled spirit sales professionals.  Their guidance will help us ensure that we maximize sales avenues and opportunities.

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

  • PARTICIPATE in our crowdfunding efforts!  Your support will help us get our doors open, so we can share our passion for rum with you.
  • CONNECT WITH US!  Sign up for our mailing list, follow us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter
  • SHARE THIS WITH YOUR SOCIAL MEDIA NETWORK!  Do you know someone who might like to contribute?  Do you have friends and family who would love to learn more about rum?  Do you know someone who may live in the area and who needs to know about this project?  Share this information with them!  Let them become part of the process!!
  • Most of all, COME VISIT US WHEN WE OPEN!  We’d love to see you, and we can’t wait for you to share in the fruits of our efforts!

CONNECT WITH US!  Sign up for our mailing list, follow us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter
SHARE THIS WITH YOUR SOCIAL MEDIA NETWORK!  Do you know someone who might like to contribute?  Do you have friends and family who would love to learn more about rum?  Do you know someone who may live in the area and who needs to know about this project?  Share this information with them!  Let them become part of the process!!
Most of all, COME VISIT US WHEN WE OPEN!  We’d love to see you, and we can’t wait for you to share in the fruits of our efforts!

story:
The beer scene is amazing, but some people have been left out... until now!

Here at Anything But Beer we brew gluten free & vegan ales and ciders from locally sourced fruits and vegetables. We want everyone to feel included in the craft beverage scene, including those who dislike the taste of traditional beers and those with dietary restrictions. Our products bring everyone together over craft beverages, creating lasting connections within the community, which is what we're all about! 

 

 

DOESN'T TASTE LIKE BEER

We work with fruits and veggies, instead of grains, so our brews don't taste like traditional beers. We like to have fun and produce a wide range of flavor profiles like blueberry cardamom, ginger chai, and spiced sweet potato. They are unlike anything else out there and live at the crossroads of ciders, wines, and beers.

 

GLUTEN FREE & VEGAN

We run a grain free and vegan brewing facility in order to meet the needs of those in community with dietary restrictions who would feel restricted in they're involvement in the craft beer scene. And we keep our finger on the pulse of dietary needs so that we can continue to brew products that meet consumer needs.

 

 

MORE ROOM AT THE TABLE

The craft brew industry is all about bringing people together and that's our aim in everything we do. Anything But Beer is meant to live beside beer, not replace it. It's an alternative option for those who dislike or cannot drink traditional beers, which welcomes them to enjoy time spent at brewery taprooms, craft beer bars, bottle shops and more! This allows more friends to come together over a variety of craft beverages, despite their preferences and dietary needs. 

Great things happen when you're with great people, which is why we brew! So when friends share life's moments, it can be done over a beer or an Anything But Beer! Cheers to that!

 

 

 

WHAT WE'VE DONE SO FAR

In just over a year we’ve brewed 16,000 pints of Anything But Beer, have been available in 70 venues throughout Central New York and served at over 150 events!

 

IT TAKES A COMMUNITY

Starting something new and reaching the people who need us is quite the undertaking! And although our in-house team is small, the community around us is big! And we're so grateful for the support! 

 

 

TAPROOM IN SYRACUSE, NY

We aim to provide greater access to our products by opening up a taproom, which we are pleased to announce will be coming to the beautiful downtown Syracuse neighborhood of Hanover Square in the early summer of 2019! Not only will we offer an inclusive beverage menu, but a food menu as well with gluten free, vegan, paleo options and more! We can’t wait to have everyone there!

 

EXPANDED BREWERY & DISTRIBUTION

Additionally, we’ll be expanding our brewery, which will make room for the creation of more fun flavors and allow us to brew enough for those in other regions as well, such as Buffalo, Albany, and New York City.

 

 

We’re excited to be building something great and you can get involved! Join our email mailing list to follow along on this journey. Gain access to limited edition product, merchandise, and experiences by donating to our Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign. And share this video with the people in your life!

We’re Anything But Beer and we want everyone to feel included in their community! Because together, anything is possible.

story:
The Beauty of Whiskey

In 2015, we embarked on a journey to combine our love of art , America, and quality spirits. We created an Award-Winning straight bourbon and spent 3 years developing a unique bottle that envelops art, culture and premium bourbon.

We tasted bourbon from all over the country and studied the artistic and cultural values in sculpting a representative image of a proud and strong woman.

Fred Minnick,  world renowned whiskey judge - “I like that (American Woman Whiskey)…very approachable…it’s a good whiskey.”

Help us realize something unique. The process is underway with 30% of the funds allocated in order to move into full scale production. Initial funds have gone towards the costs of bottle and label design, patent submissions, TTB fees, website design, preliminary marketing research and  bourbon formulation. We’re not looking for venture capital at this stage, we want to engage whiskey lovers like you to help us launch American Woman Whiskey® in early 2020.

Distilled in America

 

The Idea

In contemplating the perfect American whiskey experience, a small-town physician from a midwestern city, a west coast artist and a passionate whiskey maker from Colorado joined forces and created what some may consider a bold work of art. A work to be appreciated for its beauty, strength and enduring spirit.

The Design

We combined three great things: Art. Whiskey. America. In 2015, the doctor commissioned the artist to create a sophisticated and elegant sculpture that held all the simple, yet complex, elements of beauty taken from every culture in this land of diversity. The result was a proud and enduring rendition of a woman with a strong forward gaze, so unique as to win a United States Design Patent in April, 2018. After the bottle was tested and retested for strength and function, a long and difficult task given the complex shape and contour, the creation of the perfect whiskey was finalized.  Result:  Award-winning American bourbon in a stunning bottle.

Patent Drawings

USPTO Registered Mark

U.S. Design Patent

Award-Winning Bourbon

 

Her Virtues

The straight bourbon, strong in heartland corn and a touch of malted barley, is crafted with pure mountain water and aged in a dry, alpine ecosphere. New oak barrels with four different char levels were used for a unique aging process.

We used thirty gallon barrels to hone the aging process and intensify the flavors.

The meticulous handling of the barrels with tight temperature control and systematic rotation shows in the final outcome.

Meet the Makers

 

Risks & Challenges

Yes. There are risks and challenges, and we are fully aware of them. How do we ensure that our whiskey will have the necessary quality to do well on the market? We will by aging only the most premium bourbon under meticulous conditions and quality control.  By relying on the expert distiller to make sure it is consistently premium bourbon, we can achieve that goal. 

Also, we will be bottling in early 2020 at best. The market could change, taxes could increase, tariffs could become a factor, but these are factors we can't control. And who would ever give up a dream based on future scenarios one cannot control?  One of our key strengths is that we have a US patented design on a bottle unique in a crowded market.  And, we have a tested straight American bourbon to complete the package. Any bold concept such this unique bottle has risk in the marketplace, but we are promoting the love of good whiskey in a tribute to art, whiskey and the strength of women not only in America but around the world. 

What We Need 

  • $100K to secure and age 63 barrels of our premium straight bourbon at 90 proof.
  • $10K to manufacture our custom bottles in high quality flint glass which includes a wood top cork, tin capsule and gold fleck custom label.
  • $5K to obtain and maintain any patents as well as any legal fees associated with production.  We have plans for 1-2 more spirits including tequila and rum for which we need to secure trademarks and design associated labels for those spirits.
  • $28K for pre-launch marketing to include, social media, print, billboard, radio, and any other needed venue.  This will be essential for a brand such as AWW since it will disruptive in a very competitive market.
  • $15K after marketing and distribution costs.  

Stretch Goals

If we meet our Goal of $158,000.00 we have a stretch goal of $500,000.00.

This extra funding will go toward a multi-pronged marketing strategy to prepare for multi-state and international distribution.  As our first launch will be limited to one or two states, the ultimate goal is worldwide distribution.

Join the Launch

As we launch our funding campaign, contributions will be used for the next 12-24 months to secure long term spirit production, finalize bottle details, marketing and distribution launch and any additional legal and patent fees. With 30% of funds already invested, we are ready to move forward and raise the remaining 70% to fulfill American Woman Whiskey.

story:
Who we are and why we would love your help! 

We are a navy veteran owned and operated coffee company whose mission it is to provide good delicious coffee to those who are on a mission of their own.  After serving 5 years in the United States Navy the main thing that kept me going was coffee. I want to give back to the military community and the veterans. Our coffee is roasted in small batches and roasted and packaged with the utmost care. With your help we will be able to kickstart our humble beginnings that hope to one day have a greater impact on any and all communities who love coffee as much as we do.  

What We Need & What You Get

To fund our startup our goal for this is to reach $3,000 for expenses including green coffee beans and shipping and a larger coffee roaster. 

All of our perks will include samples of our small batch coffee beans and discounts for later purchases when you find the coffee you like. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you've read this far and for some reason aren't able to contribute, don't worry. I appreciate it none the less. If you believe in me as much as I do I would very much appreciate if you could help get the word out and help our caffeinated dreams become a reality for us and those would love a good cup of joe.

story:
Coming home

Long time Seattle resident, Evan Leichtling, started cooking at the age of 17, and spent over 10 years in some of the best kitchens of Seattle - sous chef to John Sundstrom at Lark, chef de cuisine of La Bête, Harvest Vine, the list is long.

Evan moved to Europe in 2014 to try his hand in European kitchens and found himself in Paris by 2015. He quickly became the chef of Dune in Paris' 11th arrondissement, developing his signature style of cooking seasonal food, informed and influenced by the various techniques he has learned over the span of his now 15 year career in kitchens.

Evan returned to Seattle in early 2019, along with his partner in business and in life, Meghna Prakash, seeking to put his mark on the growing food scene and open his own restaurant. Meghna is Indian born and raised, and lived in Paris for 10 years, nursing a growing interest in natural wine. She has been getting up to speed on the city's thirst for good wine by working with some of the best distributors in Seattle. You may recognize them both from Fowl & Offal, the pop-up concept that they've been running for about 6 months now, introducing Seattle diners to unique proteins and focused on working with local farmers.

Having successfully found the smallest space that Columbia City has to offer, Evan and Meghna plan to keep Off Alley a local, neighborhood spot, for the casual diner and wine enthusiast. They need your help in this becoming a reality!

What's Needed 

Opening the doors of a restaurant is no easy task. Evan and Meghna have chosen to remain independent and have made it this far with the incredible support of their families. However, as they say, it takes a village, and they need your help in crossing the finish line.

Be part of the story

By participating in this fund raising effort, not only do you get access to unique benefits, but also get to be an integral part of making Off Alley a reality in a historical restaurant space that has been a part of Columbia City for over 70 years!

story:
About Me...

I live in Wellington, Shropshire, The Town at the bottom of The Wrekin hill. I have, despite my efforts, not achieved any thing in life. My background is in Hospitality, Catering, Retail and Management. I would like to do this for Mom & Dad, to see me, successful at some thing and working and earning. 19 years ago I had a mental break down. I was in hospital  for approximately 4 months. I am now recovered, taking my medication daily.

Short Summary...

  • Come from a background in Hospitality, Catering, Retail and Management.
  • I am looking to raise £1,000 to be able to do a Chocolate making course here in Britain.
  • I want to have my own chocolate and sugar candy making business here in Wellington (Shropshire). This, for me would be stupendous, when I have acheived the funding and learning.

What Is Needed & What You Get...

I need £1,000 to pay for a course to learn how to make chocolate from scratch!

£1,000 will enable me to study the art of chocolate making here in Britain. Future earnings from being a master Chocolatier is awesome!

  • Perks for donating are boxes of home made chocolate and sugar candy
  • If I don't reach my goal I shall be unable to do the course. If more funding than asked for is raised I shall put the extra money toward future training and toward my Chocolate and Sugar Candy making and retail business.

The Impact

  • The world needs Chocolate! Men need Boxes of Chocolate and Sugar Candy to say sorry! 
  • Women love Chocolate! We all enjoy Chocolate! What would we do on Valentines with out Chocolate and Flowers Or Chocolate Eggs at Easter?
  • I have a background in Catering so I already have some of the skills
  • I Shall only use fair trade Cocoa and Sugar from sustainable sources.

Risks & Challenges

Risks & Challenges there is only one risk, not getting the funding to do the course.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
The Chocolate Reward awaits!

story:
Clique ici pour la version française

 

Producida en Bélgica, un país con una tradición cervecera muy importante, recientemente considerada como patrimonio de la humanidad. Elaborada con productos locales y naturales (BIO) en la cervecería La Lesse ubicada en las Ardenas de Bélgica.

La brasserie La Lesse fue creada bajo la fórmula de cooperativa, es decir, a diferencia de una empresa, el capital de una cooperativa pertenece a los trabajadores y a las personas que desean ser parte de esta cooperativa, fomentando el consumo local, de circuito corto y de productos ecológicos.

La Revolucionaria es una cerveza con corazón mexicano, creada para los paladares más exigentes y con ganas de revolucionar la forma de disfrutar la cerveza y de beber responsablemente ya que al consumirla, no solo ayudas a disminuir la emisión de CO2, colaboras también en la creación de empleo de la localidad, contribuyes al consumo de productos naturales, ecológicos y de calidad, estás apoyando a proyectos con fines sociales, éticos y justos, en resumen, ¡al beberla estás mejorando al mundo!

Al ser una cerveza social, la Revolucionaria buscará patrocinar actividades y proyectos de artistas o emprendedores mexicanos que viven fuera del país.

 

¿Por qué apoyar este financiamiento participativo?

Porque es una cerveza local, pensada para la comunidad mexicana, una receta creada con ingredientes locales y bio en una cooperativa con finalidad social.

A corto plazo: esta cerveza pretende apoyar, financiar y ayudar a difundir proyectos locales de los mexicanos que viven en Bélgica, y a mediano plazo: también se contempla un apoyo en general para proyectos sociales de la comunidad de mexicanos en Europa.

La primera etapa de este proyecto es para la consolidación y distribución de una cerveza creada para la comunidad mexicana, una cerveza ligera, ideal para acompañar a los tacos, tostadas, sopes, flautas, etc… Si esta primera etapa se concluye exitosamente, la segunda etapa será también abierta a la participación de la comunidad de mexicanos en Europa, para diseñar la etiqueta y la receta de la siguiente cerveza La Revolucionaria.

Al apoyar esta iniciativa, estarás contribuyendo al lanzamiento de una serie de recetas para la elaboración de cervezas con productos como el cacao, café, ajonjolí, especias autóctonas, etc. Ya que estos ingredientes son representativos y producidos en México, se buscará esta materia prima en cooperativas mexicanas y se apoyarán directamente a través de la producción de estas cervezas.

 

Consumiendo esta cerveza contribuyes a:

  • Crear empleo local
  • Impulsar un proyecto social, comprometido con el medio ambiente
  • Apoyar a emprendedores y artistas mexicanos
  • Consumir productos respetuosos del medio ambiente
  • Fomentar el consumo de productos locales y de calidad
  • Reactivar la economía localizada
  • Respaldar a una cooperativa comprometida con la ética

 

Si este crowdfunding llega a la meta, podremos continuar y comenzar con la segunda etapa, esto quiere decir: hacer una segunda receta con materia prima proveniente de México y así estarás apoyando directamente a productores mexicanos, estimulando la economía localizada, permitirás que sea creada una bebida bajo la colaboración de maestros cerveceros mexicanos y belgas, con lo mejor de las dos culturas.

 

El dinero recaudado servirá para:

  • Impresión de la etiqueta
  • Distribución
  • Certificación BIO
  • Gastos de comunicación
  • Gastos de la plataforma Indiegogo
  • Recompensas
  • Iniciar la segunda fase del proyecto
  • Consolidar y registrar la marca “La Revolucionaria”
  • Comenzar a apoyar a proyectos sociales, culturales y de ddhh

 

Gracias infinitas por apoyar a este proyecto!

 

 

 

La Revolucionaria est une bière blanche, légère et rafraîchissante, avec une légère touche citronnée, produite en Belgique, un pays à forte tradition brassicole, récemment considérée comme Patrimoine Culturel Immatériel de l'UNESCO sous le titre de : La culture de la bière en Belgique. Élaborée avec des produits locaux et naturels (bio), au sein de la brasserie de la Lesse, dans la région des Ardennes belges.

La brasserie de la Lesse est une coopérative à finalité sociale, c’est à dire que, contrairement aux autres entreprises, le capital social de la coopérative appartient aux travailleurs et aux personnes désireuses de faire partie du projet, stimulant la consommation de biens locaux, le circuit court et les produits bio.

La Revolucionaria est une bière au coeur mexicain, créée pour les plus fins gourmets et voulant révolutionner la façon de déguster une bière, en buvant de façon responsable vu qu'en la buvant plutôt qu’une autre, vous contribuez non seulement à diminuer les émissions de CO2, mais vous collaborez également à la création de l’emploi local, vous consommez des produits de qualité, naturels et bio, tout en soutenant des projets sociaux, éthiques et justes, en d’autres mots, vous contribuez à un monde meilleur en la buvant!

L’objectif que nous nous sommes fixés pour la première étape du projet, est de lancer cette recette déjà créée. Dans la seconde étape, nous partirons à la recherche de collaborations avec des maîtres brasseurs mexicains, afin d’être reproduites dans le continent européen et asiatique, en important du Mexique les matières premières nécessaires pour la production de ces recettes (comme par exemple: le maïs, le cacao, café, sésame, épices autochtones,...)

Etant une bière sociale, la Revolucionaria cherchera à soutenir des activités et projets d’artistes ou d’entrepreneurs mexicains qui vivent à l’étranger.

 

Pourquoi soutenir ce financement participatif?

Parce que c’est une bière locale, pensée pour la communauté mexicaine, c’est une recette réalisée à base de produits locaux et bio, dans une coopérative à finalité sociale.

La première étape de ce projet est de consolider et distribuer une bière créée pour la communauté mexicaine, une bière légère, idéale pour accompagner les tacos, les tostadas, les sopes, et les flautas,... de la cuisine traditionnelle mexicaine. Si cette première étape se termine avec succès, la seconde étape s’ouvrira à la participation de la communauté de mexicains en Europe, afin de créer l’étiquette et la recette de la prochaine bière La Revolucionaria.

En soutenant financièrement cette initiative, vous contribuerez au lancement d’une série de recettes afin d’élaborer des bières à base de produits comme le cacao, le café, le sésame et les épices autochtones,... Vu que ces ingrédients sont typiquement cultivés au Mexique, l’on recherchera des coopératives mexicaines qui les produisent et elles seront soutenues directement grâce à la production de ces bières.

Cette bière souhaite soutenir, financer et aider à diffuser des projets locaux de mexicains vivant en Belgique, mais également prévoit d’offrir un soutien en général à des projets sociaux de la communauté de mexicains en Europe et principalement, vu qu’elle est produite avec différentes valeurs sociales et protégeant l’environnement; dans la seconde recette, ces mêmes valeurs seront recherchées chez les producteurs des denrées mexicaines afin de produire davantage de recettes en Europe ayant un impact économique positif direct auprès des fournisseurs mexicains.

 

En buvant cette bière, tu contribueras à:

  • Créer de l’emploi localement
  • Promouvoir un projet engagé au niveau social et environnemental
  • Soutenir des entrepreneurs et artistes mexicains
  • Consommer des produits respectueux de l’environnement
  • Favoriser la consommation de produits locaux et de qualité
  • Réactiver l'économie localement
  • Donner votre soutien à une coopérative engagée au niveau éthique

 

Si ce crowdfunding arrive à son objectif, nous pourrions continuer le projet et entamer la seconde étape, c’est à dire: élaborer une seconde recette avec de la matière première provenant du Mexique et ainsi soutenir directement les producteurs mexicains, en stimulant l’économie locale, permettant la création d’une bière fruit de la collaboration entre maîtres brasseurs belges et mexicains, alliant le meilleur des deux cultures.

 

L’argent récolté servira à:

  • L’impression de l’étiquette
  • La distribution de la bière
  • La certification BIO
  • Frais de communication
  • Frais de la plateforme Indiegogo
  • Les différentes récompenses
  • Démarrer la seconde phase du projet
  • Consolider et enregistrer la marque “La Revolucionaria”
  • Commencer à soutenir des projets sociaux, culturels et de Droits de l’Homme

 

Merci infiniment d’avoir soutenu ce projet!
story_txt:
Clique ici pour la version française  Producida en Bélgica, un país con una tradición cervecera muy importante, recientemente considerada como patrimonio de la humanidad. Elaborada con productos locales y naturales (BIO) en la cervecería La Lesse ubicada en las Ardenas de Bélgica.La brasserie La Lesse fue creada bajo la fórmula de cooperativa, es decir, a diferencia de una empresa, el capital de una cooperativa pertenece a los trabajadores y a las personas que desean ser parte de esta cooperativa, fomentando el consumo local, de circuito corto y de productos ecológicos.La Revolucionaria es una cerveza con corazón mexicano, creada para los paladares más exigentes y con ganas de revolucionar la forma de disfrutar la cerveza y de beber responsablemente ya que al consumirla, no solo ayudas a disminuir la emisión de CO2, colaboras también en la creación de empleo de la localidad, contribuyes al consumo de productos naturales, ecológicos y de calidad, estás apoyando a proyectos con fines sociales, éticos y justos, en resumen, ¡al beberla estás mejorando al mundo!Al ser una cerveza social, la Revolucionaria buscará patrocinar actividades y proyectos de artistas o emprendedores mexicanos que viven fuera del país. ¿Por qué apoyar este financiamiento participativo?Porque es una cerveza local, pensada para la comunidad mexicana, una receta creada con ingredientes locales y bio en una cooperativa con finalidad social.A corto plazo: esta cerveza pretende apoyar, financiar y ayudar a difundir proyectos locales de los mexicanos que viven en Bélgica, y a mediano plazo: también se contempla un apoyo en general para proyectos sociales de la comunidad de mexicanos en Europa.La primera etapa de este proyecto es para la consolidación y distribución de una cerveza creada para la comunidad mexicana, una cerveza ligera, ideal para acompañar a los tacos, tostadas, sopes, flautas, etc… Si esta primera etapa se concluye exitosamente, la segunda etapa será también abierta a la participación de la comunidad de mexicanos en Europa, para diseñar la etiqueta y la receta de la siguiente cerveza La Revolucionaria.Al apoyar esta iniciativa, estarás contribuyendo al lanzamiento de una serie de recetas para la elaboración de cervezas con productos como el cacao, café, ajonjolí, especias autóctonas, etc. Ya que estos ingredientes son representativos y producidos en México, se buscará esta materia prima en cooperativas mexicanas y se apoyarán directamente a través de la producción de estas cervezas. Consumiendo esta cerveza contribuyes a:
Crear empleo local
Impulsar un proyecto social, comprometido con el medio ambiente
Apoyar a emprendedores y artistas mexicanos
Consumir productos respetuosos del medio ambiente
Fomentar el consumo de productos locales y de calidad
Reactivar la economía localizada
Respaldar a una cooperativa comprometida con la ética
 Si este crowdfunding llega a la meta, podremos continuar y comenzar con la segunda etapa, esto quiere decir: hacer una segunda receta con materia prima proveniente de México y así estarás apoyando directamente a productores mexicanos, estimulando la economía localizada, permitirás que sea creada una bebida bajo la colaboración de maestros cerveceros mexicanos y belgas, con lo mejor de las dos culturas. El dinero recaudado servirá para:
Impresión de la etiqueta
Distribución
Certificación BIO
Gastos de comunicación
Gastos de la plataforma Indiegogo
Recompensas
Iniciar la segunda fase del proyecto
Consolidar y registrar la marca “La Revolucionaria”
Comenzar a apoyar a proyectos sociales, culturales y de ddhh

story:
Every year thousands of men and women risk their lives to try to illegally immigrate to the United States of America. The reasons are many and complex, but  the most important are the lack of sufficient income to support a family and the lack of access to quality education. This is a reality for the countries of the Central American region, such as Honduras, but with the combined effort of all of us, it is possible to reverse this trend. It's a trend that has only been aggravated in recent years because now all those children, left behind by their parents, have started to take this dangerous journey-- making a bad problem even worse.

Most of these people are hardworking people, like the small coffee farmers, and just need a little help to be able to support themselves.

Please join us and give us your support by contributing to this campaign and sharing it with all your friends.

story:
December 17, 2009, my father, Mackie Bigby  was called to Heaven after a 5 year battle with cancer. Ninety days prior, he initiated a dialogue to prepare me for the years without him. He touched on topics such as winterizing the house, spring clean up, and of course, the care of his precious lawn. Not lost was the responsibility that he was bestowing: the care of his beloved wife and his youngest son. He warned that it would be difficult but that it would be the most rewarding undertaking of my life. He said the smiles and joy that you can place on them, will be your way to honor me. He was absolutely correct in stating that at times it would be difficult. What better way to honor my father than for our "family" to create and share Devil's Reef Cinnamon Spiced Rum with you! 

In a world where the locked up dreamer stuck in a 9am-5pm constantly tries to find the balance between success and relaxation, Devil's Reef Cinnamon Spiced Rum, offers a pathway to paradise. Devil's Reef was born out of the search for an answer to an oversaturated vodka market that failed to represent the passion, individuality, and importance of taste while transporting the mind and body to a state of calm and relaxation. 

We are two Long Island guys that created this brand at Mackie's Long Island kitchen table and had it bottled in New York. We have completed all of the heavy lifting to get the liquid in the bottle and the bottle to the shelf. We are looking for our campaign to assist with purchasing, advertising, promoting, and marketing Devil's Reef. We must court our distribution partner as well as the bars, restaurants, and stores that we want to carry our brand. These relationships are critical to the success of any brand. The funds raised will guarantee us the opportunity to solicit the key retailers and on premise accounts in our marketplaces. It will provide flexibility to develop incentive programs for all of our partners.  In store sampling, promotional models, drink vessels, bar mats, bar caddies, branded clothing, etc... will all be provided with your assistance.

One of the major risks in launching an alcoholic beverage brand is finding a distributor that will bring your product to the consumer.  In the three tiered alcoholic beverage market, the consumer (you) and the producer (me) must be linked by a distributor.  We have crossed that bridge. Devil's Reef is distributed by nationally licensed beverage alcohol importer, distributor, and service provider MHW Limited, headquartered in Manhasset, NY.  With over 81 years of experience in alcohol distribution, Devil's Reef is part of a proven legacy of exceptional and timely service  that meets the needs of consumers nationally. 

Your investment will help more than words can say. YOU will be directly involved in the success of Devil's Reef Cinnamon Spiced Rum. Best thing is... you will be able to responsibly sample the goods that you are supporting. We've come a long way on our own, but now we need you to blow it up! In the short term, we are looking to touch EVERY licensee in New York. That's 8000 establishments with a liquor license; stores, bars, and restaurants.

Lastly, we have intensely battled over what to offer as PERKS for the varied amounts of donations. We decided that it is important to achieve the goal. By offering GEAR as the PERK, we can ensure that the cost of the PERK does not become a barrier to achieving the GOAL. Also, the invite to a Devil's Reef Cinnamon Spiced Rum event provides us with an intimate setting to TRULY thank you for your support. Please help us honor our Dad over a glass of Devil's Reef.Thank you in advance for your support.

campaign_city: Long Island, New York, United States

story:
About this Campaign

Hey y'all,
My name is Joshua Eilts and I am the creator of Tasting Notes.  I've always been passionate about good coffee and the idea of a coffee shop that had live music benefiting independent artists.  This is the first step in that dream.  I've spent an ample amount of time explaining to people how to achieve a good cup of coffee, but it's always started with one thing: fresh roasted beans.  I want to offer great coffee to everyone while also connecting people with new musical experiences.  I don't think roasting coffee in my popcorn popper is going to work for the masses, and yes...that's a thing.  I am looking at investing in a proper roaster that allows me to tweak my roasts, be more consistent, and pump out larger quantities to my customers.  However, I need a little help getting off the ground.

What We Need & What You Get

I'm not asking for a free handout, and all of the contributions will be pre-purchasing some great coffee, at a discounted rate.  All of the initial contributions will be going toward a few very important things

  • The Roaster:  The Huky 500T will be the roaster of choice.  Hand built by Mr. Li out of Taiwan, the Huky 500 is a solid drum roaster that uses propane as its heat source.  This will be paired with Artisan roasting software in order to get a calculated, consistent, repeatable roast.
  • Beans!  I am going to offer two origins of beans at launch.  Most likely an Ethiopian that will be roasted lighter to highlight more fruity notes and a bean from another country that focuses on chocolate and nutty tasting notes.  Soon, we will offer exotic roasts at a slightly premium price.
  • Administrative costs.  TastingNotesCoffee.com is LIVE!  Head on over to check it out.  Bags, labels, logos, permits all come at a cost.  Most of these have already been purchased, but some of the initial wave of funds will go towards future fees as well.

Check out our PERKS!

  • All of our contributors will enjoy a bag of freshly roasted beans aimed at a delivery date in December 2017.  My goal is to have the roaster and first wave of beans purchased after the first 30 days of this campaign while the remainder of the funds will go towards new beans and administrative costs.

What if we don't reach our goal in 60 days?

  • It might take a little longer than our anticipated December launch.  Most importantly, if you contribute you WILL receive your perk.  If we don't reach our goal in 60 days look out for a launch in 2018.

The Impact

Without you, this may not be possible.  Give us a shot.  The lowest perk we offer is for a bag of our beans at a discounted rate.  The more you give, the more you save in the long run.

 

Risks & Challenges

As with any company, some of the risks we face are customer acquisition, and cost to sustain the business.  This has all been evaluated and figured into the campaign.  I've been passionate about coffee for many years now, and that's not going to change overnight.  I'm pretty sure every Christmas when asked "What do you want?" from family and friends, my replies have always been something coffee related.  I will always be roasting, and therefore, Tasting Notes will always be here, shipping great quality coffee to your doorstep.  If the customer base dies down, the few that remain will get to enjoy some great beans, and have opportunities to try rare exotics in the future.

Other Ways You Can Help

So maybe funds are tight right now, or even worse...you don't drink coffee.  First off, I have to wonder, maybe you've just never had a GOOD cup of coffee.  Nonetheless, you can share this campaign.  Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat, I know you have some kind of social media presence.  Share this campaign so that the coffee lovers in your life can experience a cup of coffee brewed with Tasting Notes beans.  The second way you can help is to help out an artist that you know and love by sending them over to http://tastingnotescoffee.com/artists/ to fill out our submission form.  If we get enough submissions, we can create a larger playlist, and possibly highlight more than one artist a month.

Other Ways You Can HelpSo maybe funds are tight right now, or even worse...you don't drink coffee.  First off, I have to wonder, maybe you've just never had a GOOD cup of coffee.  Nonetheless, you can share this campaign.  Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat, I know you have some kind of social media presence.  Share this campaign so that the coffee lovers in your life can experience a cup of coffee brewed with Tasting Notes beans.  The second way you can help is to help out an artist that you know and love by sending them over to http://tastingnotescoffee.com/artists/ to fill out our submission form.  If we get enough submissions, we can create a larger playlist, and possibly highlight more than one artist a month.

story:
Stuffed Bananas!

 Stuffed with your choice of peanut butter, almond butter, Nutella, honey, protein, frosting.    The Options are ENDLESS!

  • My Banana Buddy comes complete with the corer, an injector, a cleaning brush, and a carrying case. 
  • Manufactured from food-safe, BPA-free plastics. 
  • Dishwasher safe and no sharp edges or small parts. 

Pre-order My Banana Buddy now for only a $20 donation!!

______________________________________________________________________________________

 

3-Easy Steps

 

Step 1: Core an unpeeled banana.

Simply slide the banana down the coring guide, placing a perfectly symmetrical core down the center of the banana.  

 

Step 2:  Remove the banana   

Hold the coring guide and remove the cored banana. The banana core remains in the stainless steel coring tube.   

 

   Step 3: Inject your favorite filling 

Use the Banana Buddy injector to fill the cored banana with your favorite filling. No need to cut or peel the banana. 

 

Step 4: Enjoy your healthy snack

The filled banana is a great on-the-go snack or can be placed in the refrigerator or freezer and enjoyed at a later time.

__________________________________________________________________________

 

The History Of My Banana Buddy

One day I was sitting in my house and I was in the mood for a mid-day snack. As an avid fitness fanatic and health-conscious eater, I decided a banana with almond butter would be a good option. As I used a knife to place the almond butter on the banana (like I have always done), the banana broke for the thousandth time and fell on the floor. Of course, that was my last banana and it was about 15 degrees outside, so running to the store was not an option. I thought to myself ‘life would be so much better if I could get that almond butter inside the banana’. I immediately went to my computer to try and order something and quickly realized nothing existed to core and fill a banana………… And My Banana Buddy was born! 

- Sam Proffitt, creator of My Banana Buddy

 

Timeline of Events

Key Points:

  • Patent pending

  • Proof of concept completed

  • Trademark submitted

  • Packaging layout and design completed

  • Samples obtained and selected from all manufactures

  • Manufactured and packaged in the United States

______________________________________________________________________________________

 

FUNDING REQUEST

Banana Buddy is currently seeking $10,000 to help cover half of the cost of manufacturing. The funds will be used to help pay for the cost of creating the injection molds that will be used in the manufacturing process. Once the funding goal is achieved, completed units will arrive within 60-days and will be immediately shipped to our supporters.

story:
*** Visit our website for extended perks offerings at www.deepwaterfarms.com *** 

 

Our mission is to bring the farm closer

to the people and the people closer to their food. 

 

The Deepwater Story

The farm was founded in 2015 by Paul Shumlich and Kevin Daniels, local graduates from Mount Royal University and the University of Calgary. The farm that started in a garage grew into a 3,000 sq. ft. prototype farm and now we're about to open the doors to our brand new, 10,000 sq. ft. commercial farm.

 

Nutritious Vegetables 

By supporting our campaign, you are freeing Calgary from its dependence on foreign farmers. We will be able to supply Calgarians with fresh, local vegetables all year-round! Right now we are growing kale, arugula, mustard, watercress and red pac choi. Soon, we'll be able to grow a whole lot more!

 

Fresh Fish

Finally, Calgarians will be able to buy fresh seafood! We are raising one of the world's most nutritious fish (barramundi) and we will be expanding our farm to offer a fish to every Calgarian who wants one. 

 

What is Aquaponics?

 

Our Farms

 

Featured In

                 

 

Timeline

- 2013 (Idea started)

- 2014 (Backyard project built)

- 2015 (Deepwater Farms was established. Aquaponics research)

- 2016 (Built pilot farm. Research-focused)

- 2017 (Continued to expand into the farm)

- 2018 (First produce sale to Ten Foot Henry. First fish sale to Shokunin. Official launch of our new farm) 

- 2019 (Completion of the new farm. Food for everyone in Calgary!) 

 

Risks & Challenges

We believe in transparency and farming is not without its risks. Crops can fail and fish can die. Growing indoors means a large amount of energy is consumed to run grow lights.

Fortunately, we have the resources to overcome these challenges. We are investing in the most efficient lightings systems ever invented and we use cutting edge seeding and harvesting technologies imported from the Netherlands to make the farm on of the fastest, most efficient and most effective in the world.

We are not trying to change the world alone, we are working with some of the best minds in the business, universities, and government organizations who can help us push the technology forward.

 

Our Team

    Paul, Co-Founder and CEO

   Kevin, Co-Founder and COO

   Reid, President

   Grant, Marketing and Sales Manager 

   Omi, Business Development Manager

   Ben, Aquaculture Manager ("The Fish Guy")

   Gloria, Professional Accountant

   Kem, the Harvester 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to pre-sell $50,000 worth of our products to get the ball rolling in Calgary. This will prove that Calgarians want better food, fresher food, and that we can grow it for them.

With $50,000 we will be able to scale up our vegetable production and provide 2,500 lbs of produce and 250 fresh-caught barramundi every single week.

Calgarians will be getting more nutrition from better tasting food. That's something worth getting behind.

 

    The Impact

    By supporting our campaign, you are freeing Calgary from its dependence on foreign farmers. You will know where and how your food is being grown, ensuring you are consuming the freshest, highest quality and sustainable local produce. From the farm to the table in 24 hours.

    We will be able to supply more Calgarians with fresh, local food all year-round!

     

    Spread the word!

    Your friends and family are probably just as interested in Deepwater Farms as you are. Let's share this campaign to get the word out. Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

     

    Thank you for your support!

story:
Short Summary

Mi Sueno Catering is a small family-run business that has been serving healthy, nutritional meals for over 10 years. Due to the Covid-19 pandemic and Washington States lockdowns, it crippled our infrastructure, the commercial kitchens that we used closed, and our products became limited. And even in these dire circumstances we continued to find ways to feed those in need, those that were homebound and unable to leave due to the crisis, our veterans and senior citizens!

Realizing how difficult this has been to them and to us we have decided to open our own small commercial kitchen so that we are in control of our time and impact to the community. So that we may continue these services and offer support to more families that are in a similar situation. Please consider suporting our campaign, so that we can continue to grow and expand our services, and hopefully soon we will see you again! 

What We Need & What You Get

As things are slowly opening up we continue to provide much needed meals and support to our most vulnerable. With your help and support we can open our own commercial kitchen and expand our services. We have obtained a beautiful space on the Kitsap Penninsula so that we may stay local and strengthen our infrastructure by maintaining our support of local farmers and businesses. We are hoping to raise $25,000 so that we may purchase much needed equipment such as:

  • Commercial Hood w/Suppression Unit
  • Commercial Stove
  • Setup Fees/Permits

As a thank you for your support, we are offering you some ¨awesome perks¨, yummy food, gift certificates, merchandise, ¨How to" videos on how to make some latin faves, group meals, and more! 

The Impact

By supporting Mi Sueno Catering, you are:

  • Helping a Hispanic/Woman owned local business
  • Allowing us to expand our offerings to reach low-income families
  • Helping other small startup businesses by providing acces to the commercial kitchen
  • Creating more jobs in our community

Risks & Challenges

The pandemic showed us how vulnerable our catering business is by creating some difficult challenges: state closures, closed kitchens, limited supplies. Due to these challenges it has pushed us to strengthen our business model. Having our own commercial kitchen will allow us to keep our doors open and continue to provide healthy meals to our communities, it will create more jobs and maintain support of our local economy. In addition, by re-structuring our model we have begun offering grab and go meals, pop up sites, and delivery this will allow us to sustain operations if more difficulties arise.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know how difficult this last year has been and we also know that many, if not ALL of us will be recovering from the impact for quite some time. If you are not able to contribute, thatś ok! What we would love is for you to SHARE this campaign. Help us SPREAD the word about our yummy food, about our cause! Food is our passion, its our love language, its what keeps us connected even in difficult times. Help us continue our passion, for everyone should have a dream and Mi Sueno is mine:)

story:
Damit es weitergehen kann,

benötigt ALI COLA deinen SUPPORT.

 

 

 

Ein tägliches, trinkbares Manifest für mehr Respekt und Toleranz. Statt der üblichen Cola in schwarz, gibt es ALI COLA in sechs verschiedenen Hautfarben.

Der Geschmack: immer derselbe. Außen verschieden, innen gleich. Genau wie wir Menschen.

Trinkst du ALI COLA mit geöffneten Augen, wirst du Unterschiede schmecken. Dein Gehirn hat Vorurteile, es beurteilt nach Farben. Das sollte es nicht tun, weil es nicht wichtig ist. 

 

 

 

Wie machen wir ALI COLA bunt?

Farbe 6/6 (dunkelste Cola) hat die Farbe von normaler Cola. Dank des Farbstoffes. In den anderen Farben ist einfach weniger drin. Und in Farbe 1/6 (hellste Cola) ist gar kein Farbstoff drin.

 

 

Design

Da die Designidee der Hautfarben im Vordergrund steht, ist die Verpackung auf ein Minimum reduziert. Keine großen Etiketten, nur ein weißes Halsetikette ohne Schnörkel.

Und in Farbe 1/6 (hellste Cola) ist gar kein Farbstoff drin.  DesignDa die Designidee der Hautfarben im Vordergrund steht, ist die Verpackung auf ein Minimum reduziert. Keine großen Etiketten, nur ein weißes Halsetikette ohne Schnörkel.

story:
PRODUCT DELIVERY

You will see in the timing of the 'Perks' that product is mostly scheduled for the end of March 2017. However, our first production run is expected to be completed by mid December. Be an early contributor and receive your product first.
(E-holiday card is listed in the Perks area)

 

OUR STORY

Have you ever been confused by what wine should go with what food? Or perhaps, you’ve been heckled for drinking ‘a patio wine’? Let’s face it, wine and spirits can be intimidating, particularly in the presence of others who appear to know what they are doing. If understanding every grape, region and wine maker is your thing, good for you. However, if you just want to enjoy what you’re drinking, we say good for you too! That’s what lead us to develop Boakquet™. There is a growing trend that says, “Go ahead, drink a Merlot in your sweats and pony tail.” Today, potato chips and wine is just fine. Boakquet’s easy going attitude is all about experimenting, getting creative and being inclusive. It’s also about personalizing all of life’s special moments. So, if it’s a Sunday afternoon or an engagement celebration, Boakquet™ adds a unique flavour to your story.

HOW WE GOT HERE

In our early development we experimented with several concepts in an effort to produce an exceptional product. It turns out we produced the only product in its class. An Oaking, Infusion, and Filtration system with specific attention to oak transfer processes.

In our oak transfer developments we looked at an all stainless steel bottle vs. an all oak bottle. We found that an all oak bottle was susceptible to splitting, and limited the ability for cross transfer processes with wines and spirits. For this reason we engineered a stainless steel vessel which proved to be for more effective and cost efficient for the consumer. The choice to produce a stainless steel bottle also allowed us to produce a stunning bottle that is durable, and that anyone would be proud to present. 

One of our key advantages is our ability to provide the fastest oak transfer process available by using simple math. A liquid to surface ratio that results in the ability to provide much faster oak transfers vs. an all wood bottle. The result is oak transfer in as little as 3 hours. Fact is, our patent pending design offers 200% more oak surface area than an all wooden bottle. Other advantages include the flexibility to interchange dowels for multiple spirits or wines, and the ability to provide infusion and filtration technologies.

 

WHAT IS BOAKQUET™?

Boakquet™, the world’s only oaking, infusion, and filtration vessel, adding flare and creativity to any social drink with friends and guests. Whether it’s a movie night in, or a special occasion out, Boakquet’s food grade, stainless steel contemporary design, looks amazing in any circumstance.

Boakquet™ consists of 5 components:
The cap, body, oak dowel, infuser, base, and filter.


Boakquet™ is easy to use and designed for fast results. The White American Oak dowel, cut from oak barrel staves, is ribbed and cored out for maximum surface area. The infuser is constructed from food grade stainless steel and effortlessly screws into the base holding all your favorite fresh fruits, herbs, and spices.

Boakquet™ comes with simple care instructions and all the freedom in the world to get creative! Of course, for those who prefer some guidance, we’ve got you covered! You’ll find recipes on our website, ready to begin your oaking and infusion journey.

Quality and standardization are of utmost importance. We have been sure to follow the industry's 'best practices'. All our oak is sourced from the northern US regions. The oak is air dried for 2 years and is toasted to a choice of 3 toasting levels, light, medium or dark… each offering aroma and flavors ranging from oak, honey, sweet, caramel, chocolate, toasted and other notes. (Boakquet™ includes the medium oak dowel). *Other dowels will be available in early 2017.


FILTER YOUR SPIRITS

For those of you who love your spirits, whether its gin, vodka, tequila, scotch or any other liquor, we’ve got that covered as well. Boakquet’s Filtration System offers the ability to remove impurities which results in an exceptionally smooth finish . The two piece system allows you to use the funnel as a stand alone for all your wine and spirits. 

All spirits undergo some level of filtration, yet we rarely acknowledge its significance.  Carbon filtration works by absorption and activated carbon filtering has the largest impact on spirits.  That is why we have developed our very own activated carbon filter and funnel system for you to enjoy in your home. Enjoy spirits as they were meant to be.

*The patent pending filter above is our initial prototype. We have
been in the process of refining this to ensure the quality mirrors
the bottle design. The filter will be sold as an accessory.

 

 

A PROVEN CONCEPT THAT'S READY FOR MARKET

Boakquet™ has been developed and tested for over a year and is now ready for launch in both retail and promotional spaces.



Despite its pre-launch status, early market interest has been incredible. This includes foreign territorial rights arrangements, promotional distributorship arrangements, private label opportunities, major sports licensing interest, as well as both large brand brick-and-mortar, as well as smaller specialty retail.
 

BOAKQUET HAS BEEN MENTIONED IN THE NEWS AND
IN INDUSTRY PUBLICATIONS INCLUDING:

 


MARKETING / TRADESHOW 


PACKAGING

WHAT IS OAKING?

Most people have long symbolized the Oak Barrel with wine. In part, this is a tradition that dates back thousands of years, where barrels were used to transport beer and wine. (But not for the reasons you might think.) At the time, wine was actually safer to drink than water. The wine from an oak barrel also provided needed calories to malnourished troops. However, it didn't take long for people to realize that oak barrels imparted pleasant qualities into the wine. This is standard practice today and is referred to as 'Oak Transfer'.  Since oak is naturally porous, as time passes, the oak transfer results in concentrations of favorable aromatics and flavor.
 


WHAT IS TOASTING?

Toasting is the process of heating the dowel to desired charring levels. Each level of toasting enhances wine and spirits with complex flavor profiles and pleasant aromas. Toasting breaks down the molecular structure of oak, pyrolyzing the lignins, hemicellulose and cellulose. The benefit of our toasting processes offer superior flavor and aroma that are customized to meet your personal tastes.

 

WHY WHITE AMERICAN OAK?

We use the finest White American Oak in our vessel. Why? The simple answer is…White Oak has been proven as the wood of choice for the best wine and spirits in our region. The binding of the grains in the oak is tighter than most other than trees which provides exceptional flavor and compliments many wines. However, we will be producing French Oak dowels to provide additional selection. *Other dowels will be available in early 2017.
 

INFUSION

Infuse your spirits with herbs fruits and spices.

Infusions are done by soaking ingredients in order to impart their flavor on the alcohol you have chosen. Simply place your fresh ingredients in the Infuser designed to work with your Boakquet™. After the infusion period (hours to weeks depending on infusion and preference), simply poor your new beverage into a glass and enjoy. The Boakquet system automatically filters out particulates making the process even easier.

There are no rules for home infusions. That’s what makes it so much fun! You learn through experimentation while using your imagination. You can help speed up the learning process by reading some tips and tricks available at Boakquet.com, or by having fun and creating your own infusion recipes.


PERKS

The following are the perks available for participating in Boakquet's crowdfunding campaign. Please see the Perks at the top right of our campaign site for additional details or clarification.





REFUNDS

Indiegogo's refund policies can be reviewed by visiting: https://goo.gl/1uIwJX

In general backers can request a refund while the campaign is in progress. For campaigns in InDemand, backers can request a refund from Indiegogo within 10 days of the transaction.

Following the closure of our crowdfunding campaign, there will be no cash refunds provided. All products are guaranteed for one year and will be replaced should there be an issue. Please have your proof of funding available at the time of the replacement request.

We found that an all oak bottle was susceptible to splitting, and limited the ability for cross transfer processes with wines and spirits. For this reason we engineered a stainless steel vessel which proved to be for more effective and cost efficient for the consumer. The choice to produce a stainless steel bottle also allowed us to produce a stunning bottle that is durable, and that anyone would be proud to present. One of our key advantages is our ability to provide the fastest oak transfer process available by using simple math. A liquid to surface ratio that results in the ability to provide much faster oak transfers vs. an all wood bottle. The result is oak transfer in as little as 3 hours. Fact is, our patent pending design offers 200% more oak surface area than an all wooden bottle. Other advantages include the flexibility to interchange dowels for multiple spirits or wines, and the ability to provide infusion and filtration technologies. WHAT IS BOAKQUET™?Boakquet™, the world’s only oaking, infusion, and filtration vessel, adding flare and creativity to any social drink with friends and guests. Whether it’s a movie night in, or a special occasion out, Boakquet’s food grade, stainless steel contemporary design, looks amazing in any circumstance.Boakquet™ consists of 5 components:The cap, body, oak dowel, infuser, base, and filter.Boakquet™ is easy to use and designed for fast results. The White American Oak dowel, cut from oak barrel staves, is ribbed and cored out for maximum surface area. The infuser is constructed from food grade stainless steel and effortlessly screws into the base holding all your favorite fresh fruits, herbs, and spices.Boakquet™ comes with simple care instructions and all the freedom in the world to get creative! Of course, for those who prefer some guidance, we’ve got you covered! You’ll find recipes on our website, ready to begin your oaking and infusion journey.Quality and standardization are of utmost importance. We have been sure to follow the industry's 'best practices'. All our oak is sourced from the northern US regions. The oak is air dried for 2 years and is toasted to a choice of 3 toasting levels, light, medium or dark… each offering aroma and flavors ranging from oak, honey, sweet, caramel, chocolate, toasted and other notes. (Boakquet™ includes the medium oak dowel). *Other dowels will be available in early 2017.FILTER YOUR SPIRITSFor those of you who love your spirits, whether its gin, vodka, tequila, scotch or any other liquor, we’ve got that covered as well. Boakquet’s Filtration System offers the ability to remove impurities which results in an exceptionally smooth finish . The two piece system allows you to use the funnel as a stand alone for all your wine and spirits. All spirits undergo some level of filtration, yet we rarely acknowledge its significance.  Carbon filtration works by absorption and activated carbon filtering has the largest impact on spirits.  That is why we have developed our very own activated carbon filter and funnel system for you to enjoy in your home. Enjoy spirits as they were meant to be.*The patent pending filter above is our initial prototype. We havebeen in the process of refining this to ensure the quality mirrorsthe bottle design. The filter will be sold as an accessory.  A PROVEN CONCEPT THAT'S READY FOR MARKETBoakquet™ has been developed and tested for over a year and is now ready for launch in both retail and promotional spaces.Despite its pre-launch status, early market interest has been incredible. This includes foreign territorial rights arrangements, promotional distributorship arrangements, private label opportunities, major sports licensing interest, as well as both large brand brick-and-mortar, as well as smaller specialty retail. BOAKQUET HAS BEEN MENTIONED IN THE NEWS ANDIN INDUSTRY PUBLICATIONS INCLUDING: MARKETING / TRADESHOW PACKAGINGWHAT IS OAKING?Most people have long symbolized the Oak Barrel with wine. In part, this is a tradition that dates back thousands of years, where barrels were used to transport beer and wine. (But not for the reasons you might think.) At the time, wine was actually safer to drink than water. The wine from an oak barrel also provided needed calories to malnourished troops. However, it didn't take long for people to realize that oak barrels imparted pleasant qualities into the wine. This is standard practice today and is referred to as 'Oak Transfer'.  Since oak is naturally porous, as time passes, the oak transfer results in concentrations of favorable aromatics and flavor. WHAT IS TOASTING?Toasting is the process of heating the dowel to desired charring levels. Each level of toasting enhances wine and spirits with complex flavor profiles and pleasant aromas. Toasting breaks down the molecular structure of oak, pyrolyzing the lignins, hemicellulose and cellulose. The benefit of our toasting processes offer superior flavor and aroma that are customized to meet your personal tastes. WHY WHITE AMERICAN OAK?We use the finest White American Oak in our vessel. Why? The simple answer is…White Oak has been proven as the wood of choice for the best wine and spirits in our region. The binding of the grains in the oak is tighter than most other than trees which provides exceptional flavor and compliments many wines. However, we will be producing French Oak dowels to provide additional selection. *Other dowels will be available in early 2017. INFUSIONInfuse your spirits with herbs fruits and spices.Infusions are done by soaking ingredients in order to impart their flavor on the alcohol you have chosen. Simply place your fresh ingredients in the Infuser designed to work with your Boakquet™. After the infusion period (hours to weeks depending on infusion and preference), simply poor your new beverage into a glass and enjoy. The Boakquet system automatically filters out particulates making the process even easier.There are no rules for home infusions. That’s what makes it so much fun! You learn through experimentation while using your imagination. You can help speed up the learning process by reading some tips and tricks available at Boakquet.com, or by having fun and creating your own infusion recipes.PERKSThe following are the perks available for participating in Boakquet's crowdfunding campaign. Please see the Perks at the top right of our campaign site for additional details or clarification.REFUNDSIndiegogo's refund policies can be reviewed by visiting: https://goo.gl/1uIwJXIn general backers can request a refund while the campaign is in progress. For campaigns in InDemand, backers can request a refund from Indiegogo within 10 days of the transaction.Following the closure of our crowdfunding campaign, there will be no cash refunds provided. All products are guaranteed for one year and will be replaced should there be an issue. Please have your proof of funding available at the time of the replacement request.

story:
Background. 

We met in London and fell in love over all of the amazing international food the city has to offer. We realized although cuisines around the world vary greatly, wine enhances any meal. You can take the simplest meal and turn it into one to remember by pairing it with a bottle of wine. Aside from trying out many great restaurants around London, we love to cook Californian cuisine - lots of fresh fruits and vegetables with seafood and poultry. We realized that this "farm to fork" food goes especially well with German Riesling. 

Thus the inspiration for Nackt ("naked"). German wine with a Californian twist started in London. 
We Need Your Help.

We are delighted to share with you our first wine - a 2014 Riesling. In order to make this happen however, we need your help. 

We invested our own money to cover the grapes to make 1000L of wine and basic production costs, but we still need to raise £2000 so you can enjoy our wine. We need funds to help us finance: 

  • Bottles, caps, labels, and packaging
  • Bottling 
  • Labeling 
  • Transportation 
What You Get in Return.
Other than feeling great for helping to make our business come to fruition, we are offering you extra perks if you help us out.  
  • £25: a set of custom wineglass charms. 
  • £50: a custom reusable wine bag. 
  • £100: A fine box of German chocolates - because who doesn't like chocolate with his wine? 
  • £250: A bottle of our wine along with that fine box of German chocolates. 
  • £500: Come help us harvest our 2015 vintage in Germany.
  • £750: Come help us harvest our 2015 vintage in Germany and bring a guest with you for the weekend!
**Special deal for London locals: Contribute £50 and receive a limited, first edition bottle of Nackt Wein. 

Other Ways You Can Help.

We understand that you may not be able to help us out financially but help us spread the word to others who might be interested. And when our wine comes to life, we hope you will enjoy a glass (or bottle) or two. 

-Emilie & Daniel 
San Francisco, USA & Landau, Germany
living in London

story:
Nunu Chocolates creates handmade confections in Brooklyn where people sit with a glass of wine, Frozen Hot Chocolate, latte, or craft beer and watch chocolates being made on site. Our chocolate is single origin and sustainably farmed. We subscribe to the simple philosophy that the world is a better place when chocolate is involved.

 

And now we’d like to slightly modify that statement: The world (Trade Center) is a better place when chocolate is involved. We were extremely honored when they approached us about this almost 5 years ago as one of the first prospective tenants to be a part of their vision. This is a deeply personal project for me (Nunu co-owner Andy Laird). I worked for the 9/11 Fund helping survivors and victims’ families in the physical and psychological recovery. Having the chance to bring our small chocolatey contribution to the revitalization of the area is a big deal all around.

 

We started Nunu Chocolates just over 10 years ago wanting to offer something more than the usual concert shirt, album, and poster on the merchandise table while my band was touring all over the country. So my wife Justine and I started making chocolates.  Well, we started making lots of mistakes. But then we started making chocolates that we brought around to local shops in Brooklyn and asked if they wanted to sell them. Many of them said “Yes!”. So then we really freaked out because that meant we had to make more. Along the way, we had to figure out how to slowly turn a passion into a viable business which eventually grew to have employees, wholesale accounts, online customers in Florida, Arizona and other really hot places where chocolate melts, holiday markets, and two storefronts in Brooklyn.

 

The WTC project is an extraordinary opportunity. We have put literally everything we have into making it happen, but despite that we’re just short. With 3 to 4 weeks of work remaining on the space, we need the funds to see us through and we turn to you, our community, to help us open our doors. Hope to see you on the inside.

story:
We are in the homestretch of our renovations and need your help to re-open in August!  

Oh, beloved friends!
We miss you and we need some help in the final push to get our doors open again!  We closed back in March with dreams of a quick six-week renovation. The best laid plans, as they say, often go awry. We have faced some setbacks that have chewed up and spit out our timeline and our budget, but this has not dampened our determination to get Dulce Vegan back open and better than ever.


Who we are:
If you don’t know us, Dulce Vegan began as a small, wholesale, plant-based, organic baking business in 2006.  We rented and moved through a variety of kitchen spaces while the business grew and changed. The years of farmer’s markets and late night baking for restaurants and cafes paid off, and in the summer of 2011 Dulce Vegan Bakery and Café opened its brick and mortar location in the vibrant Kirkwood neighborhood of Atlanta.  

Our Story:
When we first opened four years ago we did the very best we could with a very small budget.  At the time, our no-frills furnishings met our needs and did the job.  Now, as a much busier cafe, we needed to make some changes and update some of our equipment to help us run things more smoothly and have the ability to offer more of the things you love. We also wanted to offer all of our amazing and loyal customers a fresh and welcoming space that they could enjoy just as much as the food and the sweets.



We are passionate about good food, good coffee and the kind of sweets that you dream about the next day, and our renovation will make it possible for us to bring the quality of our food and our service to the next level.  With respect to the food, we will feature a refined menu with more gluten free and soy free options.  On the coffee front, we are crafting a new drink menu that includes all of your old favorites alongside an expanded list of house-made syrups and drink specials.  Last but not least, our front counter and kitchen redesign will increase our capacity to make sweets, specialty cakes, and wedding cakes for all of your vegan bakery needs.  More cinnamon rolls you say?  No problem!

During our renovation we were not able to create any more square footage, but we are making space by being smart about how we design the new kitchen.  Now, on busy days, we will be able to keep up with the demands of a full cafe in a much more efficient (and thus speedy) manner. It’s a win-win!


How you can help:
Your support will allow us to speed things along and open back up already! We are in the home stretch, and the end is in sight. We just need a little help from our community to get our doors open again by late August. Can’t donate? That’s okay!

*Use the IndieGoGo Share tools to share our campaign with friends and family who you think might donate to our project.

*Let everyone know that Dulce Vegan is re-opening and will be better than ever!
Like our Facebook page and follow us on Twitter and Instagram (and share the campaign.)

*Stop by for a treat (or three) when we re-open!



How We Will Use the Funds:

We will use this money to get the last of our much needed equipment and decor in place, including:

*A new bakery case;
*Two new coolers and freezer for the kitchen;
*A new water boiler.  
(As many of you know, our old water boiler was a bit possessed, and used to just turn on whenever it liked, which is not a good thing for a piece of equipment that dispenses near-boiling water!)



Risks & Challenges: 

While the renovations are drawing to a close, we’re still up against the possibility of setbacks like delays in construction, holdups with permits and licensing, unexpected building issues and the list goes on. We’ve persevered thus far, and want you to know that we’re committed to opening no matter what’s standing in our way.

Love,
 Howell and Idalys
Dulce Vegan Bakery & Café
