story:
Eda Rhyne is more than just a cool sounding concept for a local distillery. We are very confident in our process and our products. The creation of Eda Rhyne Distillery is rooted in family tradition and connection to the land. From the mountains, down the foothills, into the piedmont and stretching to the coast, our family history informs our process and products. 

Originally from the Piedmont, Founder and Master Distiller Rett Murphy has been a farmer in Western North Carolina for fourteen years, driven by a passion for feeding people through sustainable farming techniques that combine creativity, science and hard work. 

Rett brings this same vision to Eda Rhyne Distillery where creative use of local flavors and ingredients marry with a scientific process of distillation that uses the latest innovations in distilling and farming techniques to help minimize our environmental impact. 

One of Rett’s inspirations to pursue a life based in agriculture comes from his great grandmother Alma Pinnix, a brilliant business woman and avid gardener. 

Alma loved gardening so much that she outgrew her own property and soon started sowing seeds into unused public land around Greensboro, NC.  She planted gardens along roadsides, abandoned buildings and forgotten spaces; Alma would drive from plot to plot with the trunk of her Cadillac overflowing with manure, practicing what is now know as guerrilla gardening.

Her vision and commitment eventually earned her the recognition and help of the city of Greensboro and now many of those original gardens are still maintained by the city, who named a popular street after her. Alma Pinnix passed away while raking leaves in 1981.  

Rett’s great grandmother’s love of plants and community was one of the inspirations for him to start Aardvark Farms with his partner, Kathryn, in Burnsville, NC. Eda Rhyne is partnering with Aardvark Farms, as well as other NC farmers, to make our dream of a farm to flask distillery a reality. 

Owner/Distiller Chris Bower’s passion for spirits also comes from tradition and a knowledge of the land. With a cast of family characters that include moonshiners, bootleggers, and generations of hard working mountain folk, Chris brings a rich Western North Carolina identity to the soul of Eda Rhyne. 

Some of Chris’ fondest childhood memories are of hiking in the Blue Ridge as his Pappy taught him how to use the medicinal plants they would pass. This was the start of what Chris calls his “matter of fact” herbalism, informed by Appalachian folk medicine. It is from these influences that Chris has created Eda Rhyne’s Appalachian Fernet and Forrest Floor Amaro. A truly Western North Carolina interpretation of traditional European herbal liquors. 

As Chris grew older, stories of a more illicit family tradition piqued his interest in the history and the process of “the ancient art of the hills”. After extensive research, Bower gained an understanding of many of the secret subtleties of whiskey making in the lost coves and difficult terrain of the mountains.

Chris is not the only member of the Eda Rhyne team that has a family history populated by proud, self-sufficient outlaws. Owner/Distiller Pierce Harmon’s ancestors were rum runner’s around Wilmington and the Cape Fear River basin. Pierce’s ties are not only coastal, as the other side of his family were bootleggers in the foothills of North Carolina supplying the Statesville area with spirits during prohibition. 

Today Pierce is an owner/contractor at River Birch Builders and is supervising the construction and build-out of Eda Rhyne Distillery. This work includes the distillery floor as well as a tasting room where patrons will be able to taste our hand crafted spirits during a guided tour of the facility. 

Running the daily operations at the distillery is owner/distiller Andrew Bertone. Andy’s interest in spirits, specifically whiskey, began in Lexington, Kentucky where he worked as a helicopter mechanic for the United States Marine Corps. Andy uses his love of whiskey and the technical abilities he learned during his service to maintain the distilling equipment with precision, insuring our products are of the highest quality. It is this high quality and distinctively North Carolina identity that makes Eda Rhyne unique. It is our attention to the process from grain to glass that will make Eda Rhyne exceptional.

We will be bottling a Rye Whiskey that embodies the spirit of North Carolina. We are currently working with Carolina Ground and Riverbend Malt House to source heirloom grains and malt that captures long-lost local flavors.

Our Pinnix Gin will be a juniper forward New American style. The botanical make up will be made from local ingredients, some grown on Owner/Distiller Rett Murphy’s Aardvark Farm, others responsibly wild crafted from the mountains surrounding Asheville.

Eda Rhyne’s Appalachian Fernet is made from a secret recipe that combines over fifty different alpine herbs and medicinal plants from Western North Carolina to create an evocative interpretation of this classic Italian digestif. Bold, balanced and smooth, its perfect at the bar, the dinner table or the camp site.

Finally, our Forest Floor Amaro combines the earthy bitterness of roots and bark with the fresh fragrance of wild flowers to create this captivating bitter. Eda Rhyne’s Forest Floor Amaro is distinctive and refreshing much like the mountains that inspired its recipe. The folk medicinal qualities and angelic flavors it captures are sure to keep your spirits high and your body happy.

Now we need your support to help us achieve our vision. And this campaign is the perfect way to do it. If you pitch in financially, we have a collection of really cool perks! If you can’t donate money, please help spread the word by sharing our campaign with your friends. Every little bit helps!

Your backing will help us build on the work we have already completed and allow us to start production. Your investment will allow Eda Rhyne Distillery to secure the following:

 - Updated Mash Tun

 - Jacketed Fermenters

 - Chiller System

 - Grist Hydrator

 - Bottles

 - Labels

 - Hoses

 - Blending & Mixing Vats

 - Barrels

 - Bottling Equipment

 - Grains/Malt/Ingredients

 - Wild Crafted Ingredients

 - Marketing Materials

 - Tasting Room Construction

 - Complete the Build Out

 - General Overhead and Expenses 

Thank you for helping us share a taste of our region with the rest of the world through Eda Rhyne Distillery!

Bold, balanced and smooth, its perfect at the bar, the dinner table or the camp site.Finally, our Forest Floor Amaro combines the earthy bitterness of roots and bark with the fresh fragrance of wild flowers to create this captivating bitter. Eda Rhyne’s Forest Floor Amaro is distinctive and refreshing much like the mountains that inspired its recipe. The folk medicinal qualities and angelic flavors it captures are sure to keep your spirits high and your body happy.Now we need your support to help us achieve our vision. And this campaign is the perfect way to do it. If you pitch in financially, we have a collection of really cool perks! If you can’t donate money, please help spread the word by sharing our campaign with your friends. Every little bit helps!Your backing will help us build on the work we have already completed and allow us to start production. Your investment will allow Eda Rhyne Distillery to secure the following: - Updated Mash Tun - Jacketed Fermenters - Chiller System - Grist Hydrator - Bottles - Labels - Hoses - Blending & Mixing Vats - Barrels - Bottling Equipment - Grains/Malt/Ingredients - Wild Crafted Ingredients - Marketing Materials - Tasting Room Construction - Complete the Build Out - General Overhead and Expenses Thank you for helping us share a taste of our region with the rest of the world through Eda Rhyne Distillery!

story:
Short Summary:

Curators Reserve is a Craft Spirits Distillery based in Gold Coast, Australia with a passion to curate & handcrafted Sophisticated Artisan Spirits.

It has been a dream of mine to combine my years of Distilling Industry interests gained while attending multiple international courses and exploring many major & Craft Spirits Distilleries (36 plus - I like to research) plus a Masters of Science.  Now is the perfect time to launch & open Curators Reserve Craft Distillery on the Gold Coast as the Craft Distillery scene in Australia is so HOT right now, as has been the trend across the US, Canada & UK.


Organic ingredients are our focus in order to curate a diverse & exciting product portfolio. Sri Lankan Cinnamon, Japanese Mountain Pepper, Australian Lemon Myrtle, Albanian Juniper,  Peruvian Cacao, Ecuadorian Cardamom & Ethiopian Arabica Coffee are just a handful of the meticulously sourced ingredients.

 

Maturation barrels are en-route with Port Barrels from Portugal, Sherry Casks sourced from Spain, Heavy Char Bourbon & New American Oak from the USA & French Oak wine barrels from some of Australia's most prestigious & awarded wineries. Rum, Whiskey & Brandy in Australia has to wait a precious 2 years before we can release for sale - while we ever so patiently wait (& count sleeps), our focus is firmly on our amazing range of creative Vodka, Gin, Moonshine, Cocktail Bitters & Liqueurs.



We are humbled & excited that there is already demand from Europe & Asia for the Curators Reserve product range and Export market contract distilling opportunities.
  

Welcome to our IndieGoGo Crowdfunding Campaign!  Don't forget to check out the Perks so we can all enjoy tasting the success when this dream becomes reality! Please follow us here, on Facebook & Instagram for this journey as you are now a member of the exclusive Curators Reserve Cru!  

Thank you for your time & cheers.

Steve Magarry
Curators Reserve - Founder

What We Need & What You Get:

We are going to need $100,000 to get these coveted spirits & liqueurs into the market place.  
The recipes are written, tested & approved by some pretty tough critics (family, you know who you are!).  This Crowd Campaign page will be updated regularly to provide you all with exclusive updates - special release details & much more.

So now we need a couple more things.  First & foremost our Twin-Kettle Distillation equipment specifically designed for handling Double-Distilled Spirit production of barrel aged Rum, Whiskey/ Brandy & or further distillation for Vodka. We just love our herbs, spices & all things botancial so our custom 'Carter-Head ' Distillation chamber is perfect for delicate Vapour-infusion of flavours into Gin, Moonshine & Liqueurs. We are getting thirsty-  just thinking about it!


If you can help us out we are offering some pretty sensational perks in price ranges to suit everyone - a BIG Thank You, FAB Merch, Join the Curators Reserve CRU, VIP Tasting Events, and of course vouchers for product by the bottle or even the whole barrel!!!

The Impact

How great if the feeling when you can support a local business, family member or friend start their new business venture???  I know we love to do it when ever possible and know there are other wonderful people out there that feel the same!  After all, life is TOO short for burnt toast, substandard drinks or not following your dreams.

Risks & Challenges

We cannot wait to get fermenting, distilling, bottle filling & barrel ageing!  Just a reminder - this is not an equity or shareholder investment - it is simply an opportunity for us to connect with you on a platform that you can support Curators Reserve, score exclusive Merch & access to the products.

We all know there is only ever one Batch #1 - this is the time to get your numbered bottle/s while they are available.  Once sold, they will be just entries in the Curators Reserve history books.  Think 18th (here in Australia), 21st & other milestone birthdays, gifts for new parents, graduation, new job, wedding, anniversary.......  the list of reasons to buy a bottle from the first batch are endless!  Don't miss out!!

We can't wait to launch the Curators Reserve Distillery product range & look forward to getting it into your hands (& across your tastebuds) as soon as we can.  Join us for the journey & check out the Campaign Perks today.

Other Ways You Can Help

We value & are grateful for any support you can offer during our campaign.  If it's not the time for a $$ purchase/donation,  please share our story & campaign page as often as possible!  Here are the links to our FB & Insta Campaign Pages.  Please use #curatorsreservecru whenever you can!!!

FB: @curatorsreservecrowdcampaign

Insta: @curatorsreservecrowdcampaign / @curatorsreserve

www.curatorsreserve.com

distillery@curatorsreserve.com

story:
THE IDEA

Hear me out: vegan, organic, bicycle-delivered donuts straight to your door. Interested? That’s my passion! I want to bring vegan organic donuts to Tallahassee. I believe we are capable of creating the city we want to live in, and I want to live in a city with a vibrate, fun, and environmentally conscious food scene. I want to live in a city where I can visit a local store or market and find Dandelion Donuts! Organic vegan donuts in fun flavors delivered via bike and served with completely compostable packaging. Featuring vibrate, fun and exciting flavors like pistachio and rose, seasonal fruit fritters, and key lime custard filled.

THE OPERATION

Dandelion Donuts will be operated out of everyone's favorite local restaurant, Sweet Pea Cafe. Sweet Pea Cafe has been an established and successful vegan restaurant for more than 6 years.  Donuts will be made 3 days a week and delivered to cafes, hotels, small businesses and individuals via a cargo bike. We’ll also be set up at events and markets around town, like the Saturday French Town Farmers Market.

 

Funds raised here will go towards buying our fancy donut frying robot, licensing costs, compostable packaging, bulk ingredients and signage. See below for a complete breakdown of costs and where funds will go:

MY BACKGROUND

My name is Marina Mertz. I’ve owned and operated Anhaica Bag Works, a successful, small bicycle bag company based in Tallahassee, FL for more than 4 years. I have worked as a baker for a local catering business and private wedding cakes. 

WHY VEGAN?  

It’s a really simple choice when it comes to donuts- there are no drawbacks. Its extremely  hard to tell the difference between a donut made with dairy and eggs and a vegan donut made with without. You eliminate 2 common food allergies. Plant based diets are also more sustainable, requiring less land and resources than dairy and egg farming.

 

WHY ORGANIC?  

Organic farming uses less energy, emits less greenhouse gasses, nitrous oxide and ammonia.

 

WHY BICYCLE DELIVERY?  

As you can probably tell, we are those tree huggers your momma warned you about. We just want to cut all sorts of carbon emissions! Cars are a huge source of personal pollutants and by using our electric assist cargo bike for deliveries we not only can cut down on our own carbon emissions but we can also be a positive model in our community for alternative transportation. Also have you ever ridden a bike? It’s fun as heck!

 

WHY COMPOSTABLE PACKAGING?

Zero waste is a philosophy that encourages circular life cycles so that no products are sent to landfills. This lifestyle isn’t easy in the world we live in today with unlimited free plastic packaging, although a growing movement of people are living in a zero waste way,  I really believe it is going to take producers of goods to really make a huge impact. All of our packaging will consist of recycled material when possible and be fully compostable, we also encourage you to refuse the packaging and bring your own re-usable container and we do wholesale deliveries using re-usable containers as well.

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

As with all food based businesses, licences and production can hit some speed bumps. I am working in partnership with the French Town Food Incubator to help me identify and meet these challenges. If not able to raise complete funds, I will use the partial funds to buy the donut fryer and start with a smaller scale operation selling donuts to Sweet Pea Cafe and at the farmer's market  and slowly grow to selling wholesale donuts (plan b).  

If you are not able to financially contribute, don’t worry there are plenty of ways to help! Share this campaign with your friends via social media, ask your favorite cafe to become a seller of Dandelion Donuts, mention it to your boss that you would prefer dandies at your monthly meeting or even come pick up a few flyers to distribute!

 

Cost Break- Down

Donut Robot- $1,200

Licensing - $1,060

Rent for 3 months - $1,200

Website and Bookkeeping for 3 months - $150

Packaging ( boxes, stamp, bags) - $185

Bulk Ingredients - $800

Storage Bins- $200

Donut Cambros - $200

story:
Who are we?

 

We are Farmer Girl

 

Farmer Girl is a food enterprise comprised of a small restaurant in Lyons, Colorado that focuses on organic, local and sustainable foods.  Our goal is to make this cooking approachable, affordable and delicious.  Farmer Girl has been in existence since 2014, first operating as a food truck and is owned by Chef Tim Payne.  Tim has been cooking local and organic foods in Boulder County since 2007 and co-owned the restaurant Terroir in Longmont for five years. Farmer Girl in Lyons has been open since February 2016.  During this time we have contributed thousands of dollars in purchases with our local and organic farms, ranches, dairies, distillers, breweries and wineries.

Why are we doing this?

Our current location, serves the Lyons community as well as the influx of vacationers that come to Lyons and nearby Estes Park and Rocky Mountain National Park. While we do serve some residents in nearby Longmont we strongly feel to adequately serve ALL of the residents in Longmont as well as nearby cities such as Lafayette, Niwot, Erie, etc. a second location in Longmont will expand our service area and offer an unique dining experience that is exclusively dedicated to local, organic and sustainable foods to their residents.  Currently, there are very few if any dining options that have this commitment to this goal.

Our New Location

Our new location in Longmont will be in a new building located in south Longmont in the Prospect Neighborhood.  This location is conveniently located to our local farms we have been using for nearly 10 years as well as convenient to the service area referenced above.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our Goal is to raise $50,000 to be used towards the opening our new location.

What are we using the funds raised for?

Funds we are able to raise will be used for the following purposes:

  1. purchase of necessary kitchen and bar equipment
  2. purchase of necessary dining room amenities such as tables, chairs, etc.
  3. obtaining necessary licenses and permits to open for business

Perks for Contributing

$50 level-Free attendance at one of our monthly Beer Pairing Dinners currently hosted at our Lyons location

$100 Level-Free attendance for 2 at one our  Sunday Night Wine Club dinners currently hosted at our Lyons location.

$250 Level-Free attendance for 4 at one of this summers Farm Dinners hosted at our network of local farms.

$500 Level-Farmer Girl hat or t-shirt, free attendance for 2 at one of our Sunday Night Wine Club, free attendance for 2 at one of our monthly beer pairing dinners, free attendance for 2 at one of our Farm Dinners.

$1000 Level-Farmer Girl hat, Farmer Girl t-shirt, Dinner for 8 at Farmer Girl's new Longmont location.

$5000 Level-Chef Tim will prepare a private dinner for up to 10 either in your home, at our garden at Lone Hawk Electric Gardens, or at the new Longmont Farmer Girl Location.

What Happens If Our Funding Goal Is Not Reached?

We are using flexible funding which means we get to keep what is raised regardless of whether our goal is reached.  So any money you donate will get to us and will be used towards the opening of our second location and for the purposes listed above (equipment, furniture, etc.).

The Impact

We fill very strongly that in order for the local foods movement to march forward and be successful, it needs entities like us to be available and convenient to the public.  By having our second location, we will reach more people and thus be able to contribute more of our food purchases towards the local organic community.  As we succeed and grow our ability to purchase more from our local farmer partners will grow as well.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Of course you can contribute, knowing  your contribution will help us in our goal to bring our type of food to this community.  If you can not contribute, please help us spread the word about what we are doing with friends, co-workers, and acquaintances through conversation, facebook, twitter, etc.  Just getting the word out about what we are doing will help us along towards our goal.  You may also share this campaign through Indiegogo's sharing feature.

story:
Beer that Benefits

I'd like to take credit for the idea, but that honor goes to my best friend from high school, Jimmy T.  My name is Tom Costa and I'm the founder and President of Dr. Jekyll's.  Sitting in my backyard barbecuing and having a cold one some 10 years ago, my buddy turned to me and said, "you know, everyone drinks beer, what if you could get an added health benefit from it, kinda like Vitaminwater?"  The comment made sense coming from Jimmy, as other than being an overzealous beer drinker, he also was an all natural bodybuilder (the two don't normally go together),  nutrition expert and scientist at GlaxoSmithKline.  I replied, "great idea, if only I had the time and a few million bucks." Back then, I had 18 years of brewing under my belt, both as an avid home brewer and as an apprentice on a commercial brewery. So, not only did I see the value in the idea, but I also knew the challenges. It's one thing to have an idea...another to actually execute it.

Jimmy T & I doing what we like to do best - fishin' and drinking Dr. Jekyll's beer

Fast forward to today. Jimmy's idea is now a reality.  Dr. Jekyll's "beer with benefits" is sold in major retail chains in California to include Whole Foods, BevMo, Total Wine, Bristol Farms, Cost Plus World Market and Raley's. 

 

So what makes us different?  

We are the world's first and only organic, non-GMO, vegan craft beer that is brewed with super foods that targets different areas of the body using patented technology.  No other beer company in the world can do this! We can brew with ingredients only other beer companies can dream of.  Any essential oil or substance that cannot mix in water or alcohol, Dr. Jekyll's can  brew with using its patented nano-encapsulation technology. Science!!  And it's natural and organic compliant. So there!  For example, our delicious Irish Red Ale is brewed with heart healthy super foods like flaxseed and algal oil (DHA, ALA, EPA Omega 3). Well, try mixing flaxseed oil in beer....it doesn't mix and floats to the top.  We can do this. Pretty cool stuff, and the bioavailability of these nano-encapsulates is 500% greater than if you were to take a vitamin or gel cap.

We've been on the market for 2 1/2 years now and we've proven the concept, that being "beer with benefits." Its now time to build our own brewery and tasting room... and you can help! 

There is no other craft beer like us in the world, and we have very, very big ambitions!

We like to say we are beer that benefits.  We benefit the body and the soul by brewing with organic, non GMO, vegan ingredients and super foods that are good for the body. We benefit society by giving back 1% of proceeds to charities. Each beer has a tied in charity. And we benefit the environment with our eco friendly packaging. The silk screen labels we use contain no heavy metals and are good for the environment, since we are helping save our forests.

Our Story

Dr. Jekyll’s was conceived in the heart of an old constable station turned brewery in Brattleboro, Vermont, by three longtime friends, united by their love of great beer and active, healthy lifestyles: Tom Costa, an avid home brewer and former paratrooper; his childhood friend Jimmy T, a scientist and all natural bodybuilder; and Ray McNeill, an award-winning master brewer.

After Ray suffered a serious health setback, these friends were inspired to craft beers that not only tasted great, but had something special about them, something with a greater purpose... and so was born, Dr. Jekyll’s…the world’s first and only, organic, non GMO, vegan, craft beer with health benefits.

 

As Traditional As It Gets

Did you know...?

The Egyptians, who invented beer, brewed with herbs, spices and other botanicals specifically for medicinal reasons, so there you have it!  Dr. Jekyll’s beer is actually more authentic and traditional than beer brewed in accordance with the German Reinheitsgebot of 1516.  "It was an important source of protein, minerals and vitamins and was so valuable, that beer jars were often used as a measurement of value, and was used in medicine." source Wikipedia.

Yep, that's right, so any of you self anointed beer "experts" take note. Dr. Jekyll's is as real and traditional as it gets.  Organic is traditional?  You bettcha!  Back in the day, the Germans, Brits, Egyptians...whoever back then...didn't get on their soapbox yelling their beer was organic and pesticide free, non GMO (WTF is that?) or vegan...because it was NATURALLY, for cryin' out loud!!  Try this experiment...go to your local home brew store, buy non organic (pesticide laden) hops and malt, then buy some organic hops and malt, place both in separate pint glasses, steep with boiling hot water until it cools, and watch as the film on the surface of the pesticide laden crap forms....yummy....yep, have another pint of poison!

If you're gonna drink beer or anything for that matter, why not try and reduce the risk of damage and disease to your body by drinking organic and non GMO?  You might just add a few more beer drinking years to your life!

 

Yeah...but does it taste good?

Damn straight it does!  Our Spiced IPA, Dr. Jekyll's Bio Beer, won a Silver Medal at the Los Angeles International Beer Competition and our Kölsch, Dr. Jekyll's Beer Belly, won a Gold Medal at the same competition.

We've also had wonderful write-ups by critics and beer lovers.  We are different, and folks dig us. We've also been featured in Fortune magazine, Men's Fitness, Shape, Beer Connoisseur, Beverage Daily, Tasting Panel, LA Weekly, and many others, as well as being on CBS KTLA recently (see video below)

 

Veteran Owned and Operated

I have to be honest, I did not start the company with this in mind, that being veteran owned and operated, it kind of just happened, and now it's an important part of who we are as a company.  As for myself, I entered the military after graduating from West Point in 1987. I served with the famed 2nd Battalion 505th Parachute Infantry Regiment, 82nd Airborne Division. Was mildly "high speed" earning my Ranger tab and becoming a Jumpmaster. But we have other "bad asses" on board, Marines who served in Iraq and Afghanistan, Army aviators, Navy guys and even an IED sniffing German Shepherd named Misty (okay, that's our dog, who was a rescue, but like to think she was a high speed Special Ops dog that went AWOL).

We even have Capt. Dale Dye on board. This guy is the bomb.  You will know him from movies like Platoon, Saving Private Ryan, Band of Brothers and The Pacific. In fact, we have some cool PERKS that are tied into his upcoming movie No Better Place To Die which is in development. It's a World War II flick about my regiment, the paratroopers of the 2/505 Parachute Infantry Regiment and how they essentially saved D-Day!  It's very cool, and you have an opportunity to party with Dale and the cast, which will include some A-list actors.

 

Speaking of celebrities, Jorja Fox of CSI and ER fame, recently joined the Dr. Jekyll's team as an investor and is looking forward to being active with the company. She's a super cool, beer loving chick and a big animal rights advocate...as we all are at Dr. Jekyll's. In fact, we are ensuring any charities we donate to do not do animal testing.

 

Big "HUUUGE" Plans

I'm not going to bore you with our "big plans" but I will say this, Dr. Jekyll's has "big plans." I couldn't resist.  On a serious note, Dr. Jekyll's hopes to be a household name in the U.S. and even internationally someday, as the Dr. Jekyll's brand has wide appeal, since it is so incredibly unique, and frankly, it's where the market is heading...alcoholic libations with added health benefits.  Think Vitaminwater but for beer. And not just beer, but hard cider and nonalcoholic beer.  No one will be able to brew and infuse superfoods into beer, hard cider and nonalcoholic beer like Dr. Jekyll's because of our patented technology.  We have already been approached by parties and breweries oversees to license our brand and technology.  This is where I insert the video from Weird Science and Blinded me with Science!

 

 

Use of Funds

So let's face it, $100,000 is not going to cover all the costs associated with our brewery and tasting room.  It will be quite a a bit more. But...it will help us get things rolling, and we hope to exceed that number with all your donations.

The money will help to cover equipment down payments, a lease deposit, architectural designs, legal, leasehold improvements and project management.

We are also raising money the old fashion way, pimping my wife out. Just checking to see if anyone is still reading this far down. The old fashion way is through lenders and friends and family investors.

This gives you a chance to get some cool stuff and be a part of making this dream come alive.

If you cannot donate, please at least pass on as every share, like and reach around helps! By the way, did I say we all at Dr. Jekyll's have a sense of humor and like to have fun!

 

 

Risks & Challenges

So with everything in life, there are risks and challenges.

Here is the deal. Even if we are not able to open this brewery and tasting room, you will still receive ALL perks that do not have an asterisk by it. If it does, that means you will only get that perk if the brewery and tasting room come to fruition, or in the case of the perks associated with the movie No Better Place To Die, you will only get that perk if the movie is made. Check out the you tube video on it. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-2f68xdXYrg

story_txt:
Beer that Benefits
I'd like to take credit for the idea, but that honor goes to my best friend from high school, Jimmy T.  My name is Tom Costa and I'm the founder and President of Dr. Jekyll's.  Sitting in my backyard barbecuing and having a cold one some 10 years ago, my buddy turned to me and said, "you know, everyone drinks beer, what if you could get an added health benefit from it, kinda like Vitaminwater?"  The comment made sense coming from Jimmy, as other than being an overzealous beer drinker, he also was an all natural bodybuilder (the two don't normally go together),  nutrition expert and scientist at GlaxoSmithKline.  I replied, "great idea, if only I had the time and a few million bucks." Back then, I had 18 years of brewing under my belt, both as an avid home brewer and as an apprentice on a commercial brewery. So, not only did I see the value in the idea, but I also knew the challenges. It's one thing to have an idea...another to actually execute it.

Jimmy T & I doing what we like to do best - fishin' and drinking Dr. Jekyll's beer
Fast forward to today. Jimmy's idea is now a reality.  Dr. Jekyll's "beer with benefits" is sold in major retail chains in California to include Whole Foods, BevMo, Total Wine, Bristol Farms, Cost Plus World Market and Raley's. 
 

So what makes us different?  
We are the world's first and only organic, non-GMO, vegan craft beer that is brewed with super foods that targets different areas of the body using patented technology.  No other beer company in the world can do this! We can brew with ingredients only other beer companies can dream of.  Any essential oil or substance that cannot mix in water or alcohol, Dr. Jekyll's can  brew with using its patented nano-encapsulation technology. Science!!  And it's natural and organic compliant. So there!  For example, our delicious Irish Red Ale is brewed with heart healthy super foods like flaxseed and algal oil (DHA, ALA, EPA Omega 3). Well, try mixing flaxseed oil in beer....it doesn't mix and floats to the top.  We can do this. Pretty cool stuff, and the bioavailability of these nano-encapsulates is 500% greater than if you were to take a vitamin or gel cap.
We've been on the market for 2 1/2 years now and we've proven the concept, that being "beer with benefits." Its now time to build our own brewery and tasting room... and you can help! 
There is no other craft beer like us in the world, and we have very, very big ambitions!

We like to say we are beer that benefits.  We benefit the body and the soul by brewing with organic, non GMO, vegan ingredients and super foods that are good for the body. We benefit society by giving back 1% of proceeds to charities. Each beer has a tied in charity. And we benefit the environment with our eco friendly packaging. The silk screen labels we use contain no heavy metals and are good for the environment, since we are helping save our forests.

Our Story
Dr. Jekyll’s was conceived in the heart of an old constable station turned brewery in Brattleboro, Vermont, by three longtime friends, united by their love of great beer and active, healthy lifestyles: Tom Costa, an avid home brewer and former paratrooper; his childhood friend Jimmy T, a scientist and all natural bodybuilder; and Ray McNeill, an award-winning master brewer.
After Ray suffered a serious health setback, these friends were inspired to craft beers that not only tasted great, but had something special about them, something with a greater purpose... and so was born, Dr. Jekyll’s…the world’s first and only, organic, non GMO, vegan, craft beer with health benefits.
 

As Traditional As It Gets
Did you know...?
The Egyptians, who invented beer, brewed with herbs, spices and other botanicals specifically for medicinal reasons, so there you have it!  Dr. Jekyll’s beer is actually more authentic and traditional than beer brewed in accordance with the German Reinheitsgebot of 1516.  "It was an important source of protein, minerals and vitamins and was so valuable, that beer jars were often used as a measurement of value, and was used in medicine." source Wikipedia.
Yep, that's right, so any of you self anointed beer "experts" take note. Dr. Jekyll's is as real and traditional as it gets.  Organic is traditional?  You bettcha!  Back in the day, the Germans, Brits, Egyptians...whoever back then...didn't get on their soapbox yelling their beer was organic and pesticide free, non GMO (WTF is that?) or vegan...because it was NATURALLY, for cryin' out loud!!  Try this experiment...go to your local home brew store, buy non organic (pesticide laden) hops and malt, then buy some organic hops and malt, place both in separate pint glasses, steep with boiling hot water until it cools, and watch as the film on the surface of the pesticide laden crap forms....yummy....yep, have another pint of poison!
If you're gonna drink beer or anything for that matter, why not try and reduce the risk of damage and disease to your body by drinking organic and non GMO?  You might just add a few more beer drinking years to your life!

 
Yeah...but does it taste good?
Damn straight it does!  Our Spiced IPA, Dr. Jekyll's Bio Beer, won a Silver Medal at the Los Angeles International Beer Competition and our Kölsch, Dr. Jekyll's Beer Belly, won a Gold Medal at the same competition.

We've also had wonderful write-ups by critics and beer lovers.  We are different, and folks dig us. We've also been featured in Fortune magazine, Men's Fitness, Shape, Beer Connoisseur, Beverage Daily, Tasting Panel, LA Weekly, and many others, as well as being on CBS KTLA recently (see video below)



 
Veteran Owned and Operated
I have to be honest, I did not start the company with this in mind, that being veteran owned and operated, it kind of just happened, and now it's an important part of who we are as a company.  As for myself, I entered the military after graduating from West Point in 1987. I served with the famed 2nd Battalion 505th Parachute Infantry Regiment, 82nd Airborne Division. Was mildly "high speed" earning my Ranger tab and becoming a Jumpmaster. But we have other "bad asses" on board, Marines who served in Iraq and Afghanistan, Army aviators, Navy guys and even an IED sniffing German Shepherd named Misty (okay, that's our dog, who was a rescue, but like to think she was a high speed Special Ops dog that went AWOL).


We even have Capt. Dale Dye on board. This guy is the bomb.  You will know him from movies like Platoon, Saving Private Ryan, Band of Brothers and The Pacific. In fact, we have some cool PERKS that are tied into his upcoming movie No Better Place To Die which is in development. It's a World War II flick about my regiment, the paratroopers of the 2/505 Parachute Infantry Regiment and how they essentially saved D-Day!  It's very cool, and you have an opportunity to party with Dale and the cast, which will include some A-list actors.

story:
Good Morning America (GMA)  recently aired a segment about why turmeric happens to be the hottest health and beauty food on the planet! ARYA was featured on Dr. Karima Hirani's desk during the interview. 

Scientists are still researching the benefits of turmeric but the truth is very little of the bioactive compound, curcumin, is absorbed by the body when turmeric roots or pills are ingested. You can crush up turmeric root, add black pepper and different kinds of oil, and add it to all your meals and drinks and still reap very little benefit! Plus, too much turmeric can add a bitter taste to  food and drinks. Or be like poor Rey (Daisy Ridley) and apply on your face, may the Force be with you!

ARYA solves all these problems with a highly absorbed, water soluble curcumin that can be blended into beverages and food without leaving any turmeric aftertaste! One ARYA can contains the equivalent of 1-4 tablespoon of turmeric in terms of curcumin that is absorbed by the body. No other turmeric or curcumin product comes close! Our unique formulation is backed by scientific publications including peer reviewed cancer journals.

We are raising funds to launch a new line of ARYA Sparkling Water. ARYA Sparkling Water tastes just like any sparkling water. ARYA will be available in 3 flavors: Lemon, Lime & Mixed Berry.

To fund the launch of the new ARYA Sparkling Water, we are offering our existing ARYA Blends at a FANTASTIC VALUE (LIMITED TIME ONLY):

RADIANCE (seen on GMA video clip)

ENERGY

IMMUNITY

PURE SPARKLING WATER

MANGO GUMMY CHEWS

 

Please see the PERKS section for details. Check out the PHOTOS to get full ingredient list. Visit www.aryaforlife.com for more info.

Thanks!

story:
Who we are and more about Cupffee

Hi Indiegogo people. We, the Cupffee team, are a group of enthusiasts, experimentators and innovators looking for a change! All started several years ago. It came to our mind what would be to eat your cup after drinking your coffee?! We started experimenting with different moulds and recipes. And finally the wafer cup for coffee was born!

The wafer cup is made mainly from natural grain products. It is nature frinedly, fUntastically delicious and crispy and is suitable not only for coffee but for all kinds of hot and cold drinks and for every other thing your imagination can create! Cupffee’s thermal and moisture resistance is achieved without any icings or coatings and the cup doesn’t change the taste of the beverage it contains. Along with Cupffee and for hygienic reasons as well, goes a stylish label which makes possible to take your cup without directly touching it and what is more the label separates Cupffee from the surface it is placed on. On the label you can find our logo of course, recommended time of use which is about 40 min and a place for advertisement.

Cupffee can be eaten after usage or if thrown away it will completely decompose in several weeks. But if you try it once you will never going to throw it away after you have finished your coffee! We believe that Cupffee will make every sip you take of your coffee even more enjoyable than before!

Cupffee has a patent and is Copyright protected!  

By official data, the average daily consumption of hot drinks amounts to 2.5 billion cups, of which almost one third are sold in disposable cups and the tendency, is for that share to increase due to the busier everyday life. Respectively that means generation of hundreds of tons of non-degradable refuse and clearing of millions of trees. Cupffee is an alternative to traditional disposable cups and porcelain cups for hot and cold drinks.

We hope this campaigne will give our product the chance to reach more people around the world and to help us develop our product and machine further. 

If you help us achieve our goal we will be able to improve and upgrade the current machine we use for the production of Cupffee and get a packaging machine for our product as well.

 

Milestones in raising funds

Achieving the 50 000$ goal will give us the opportunity to improve, upgrade and significantly raise the capacity of the production machine and purchase a flowpack packaging machine because up to now we do the packaging by hand.

 

If fortunately we manage to raise 100 000$ we will be able to start producing stirrers and Cupffee cups with different tastes and if our campaign reaches 500 000$ that will ensure the capability to make different cup sizes suitable for cappuccino, late, shwartz etc and also to purchase a whole production line which will immensely increase our production capacity and thus allowing our product to reach more people around the world!

By claming one of our perks you will get the chance to be one of the first to drink crisply your coffee in Cupffee! Don’t miss it!

If you can’t afford to contribute but find the idea interesting, innovative, really eco-friendly and full of potential or simply just cool we would be very grateful if you can spread the word among your friends and relatives via Indiegogo share tools and social networks. Sincere crispy thanks in advance!

 

Timeline

2002 - the idea for Cupffee was born.

2005 - first attempts and many failures.

2009 - we started building the first prototype of the machine for Cupffee production.

2010 - we managed to make the first Cupffee cup.

2013 - we created the second prototype of the machine for Cupffee production.

2014 - Cupffee Ltd. was established.

2015 - Cupffee is patented and obtains a Copyright.

2016 - we built the third machine with our hands which we called the "machine gun" and made an official presentation of our product in front of the world.

2017 - we started the Indiegogo campaign. 

2018 - Raising the capacity of the machine, creating new cup sizes and stirrers.

2019 - Finally the world will be different with CUPFFEE ;-).

 

FAQs

 

Does the product contain gluten?

Yes it does. 

Does the product contain GMO?

The product is GMO free.

Will there be other products?

Yes, there will be cups of different sizes and stirrers as well.

What is the sell-by date of the product?

It is best before 6 months from the date of production.

Do you ship internationally?

Yes we ship worldwide.

What are the shipment options?

One is cheaper which means the shipment will be delivered more slowly and there is no tracking number.

story:
Our Campaign

My name is Peter Townsend, My native Jamaican family has had a background in the sugar industry in Jamaica dating back to 1893. Using my history I wanted to expand on my parents legacy by creating a product from their endeavours using the sugar produced in the Caribbean to create a modern twist on an old world spirit bringing it to the 21st century consumer.

In 2010 I started researching the world of rum and after working with an award winning master distiller, came up with the perfect blend of spices, fruits and botanicals. The signature edition rum was born and introduced to the world at the International food and drink expo at the excel in London 2015.  The response was phenomenal and within 8 weeks had won it's first global industry award.  

In the last 12 months we've taken this brand on the road in the UK and attended food and drink festivals sharing our brand with consumers and the feedback has been positive and energetic.

Last week Morant Bay won another award in the Global Spirit Masters for the Rum & Cachaça Masters category. This win is timely as our rum celebrates it's second anniversary since it's launch.

Morant Bay are official sponsors of the UK Rum Festival which is the first traveling Rum festival to be launched in the UK.  We'll keep you updated on the event dates and locations  for the rest of 2017 if you can come along and support us!!   

Why This Campaign Is So Important and How You Can Help

The importance of this campaign would aid us in better integrating our brand as a major contender within the spiced rum spirit category.  Your contributions will allow us to be able to better market the rum, extend our range of products and  help us build better website solutions and immerse the company into the world of social media, so that we can share this great rum with everyone and make this product a global phenomenon! 

At Morant Bay, the magnitude of your investment will be able to help me fulfill my promise to my parents and carry on their legacy, giving our company the ability and resources to enable us to grow and advance our products. The time is now for British rum and we're pretty excited to tell and  promote that story, we want our product to become a household name for the future. 

What We Need & What You Get

Your support is paramount for the success of our projection goal of £100,000.

Your funds will go towards:

  • sales and marketing in the UK and abroad - £25,000
  • UK and International Trade Events - £20,000
  • Website Optimisation capability - £5,000
  • Research and Development on new product lines - £25,000
  • Upgrade Social media platforms - £5,000
  • Create point of Sale materials - £5,000
  • Create first edition Barrel aged range  - £15,000

If we're unsuccessful at reaching our full goal, our focus will be on the Sales and Marketing in the UK and website optimisation.

Therefore we wanted to offer you different perks and rewards so that all backers, regardless of your participation, can receive a little something from Morant Bay, as our way of thanking you for your generosity (see the rewards from the list on the right).

Thank you

By contributing to Morant Bay's campaign, you'll become a part of history in the making by supporting the first British spiced red rum ever made.

So join our family, watch us grow and grow with us.  

 

Risks & Challenges

The alcohol and spirits sector of the global drinks industry is an extremely competitive market. Everyday new spirit brands enter the market and new Craft Beverage initiatives are growing continuously. In this challenging business environment, there is a strong need for a clear brand message and a WHY that connects to the consumers. We believe our brand has the right value, story, and conditions to become a global success!

The need for our high quality product in the global spiced rum sector is of great importance to our long term levels of success.

Without the ability to tap into the best distribution networks, any new brand would have difficulties reaching their target market, even with an exceptionally high premium quality brand. This is the reason for us at Morant Bay to put all of our efforts from this campaign in to developing the best possible distribution network links globally.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to help but are unable to contribute to the campaign, there are other ways you can help us, share this link with as many people as possible and help us achieve our goals.

Why do we send vouchers?

Morant Bay are not allowed to directly offer alcoholic beverages to our backers,  but we can offer you a voucher that allows a physical delivery of the alcoholic beverage either in the UK or International. 

Due to strict federal law in the USA we're prohibited from distributing alcohol in certain states.

In the last 12 months we've taken this brand on the road in the UK and attended food and drink festivals sharing our brand with consumers and the feedback has been positive and energetic.
Last week Morant Bay won another award in the Global Spirit Masters for the Rum & Cachaça Masters category. This win is timely as our rum celebrates it's second anniversary since it's launch.
Morant Bay are official sponsors of the UK Rum Festival which is the first traveling Rum festival to be launched in the UK.  We'll keep you updated on the event dates and locations  for the rest of 2017 if you can come along and support us!!   
Why This Campaign Is So Important and How You Can Help
The importance of this campaign would aid us in better integrating our brand as a major contender within the spiced rum spirit category.  Your contributions will allow us to be able to better market the rum, extend our range of products and  help us build better website solutions and immerse the company into the world of social media, so that we can share this great rum with everyone and make this product a global phenomenon! 

At Morant Bay, the magnitude of your investment will be able to help me fulfill my promise to my parents and carry on their legacy, giving our company the ability and resources to enable us to grow and advance our products. The time is now for British rum and we're pretty excited to tell and  promote that story, we want our product to become a household name for the future. 
What We Need & What You Get

Your support is paramount for the success of our projection goal of £100,000.
Your funds will go towards:

sales and marketing in the UK and abroad - £25,000
UK and International Trade Events - £20,000
Website Optimisation capability - £5,000
Research and Development on new product lines - £25,000
Upgrade Social media platforms - £5,000
Create point of Sale materials - £5,000
Create first edition Barrel aged range  - £15,000

If we're unsuccessful at reaching our full goal, our focus will be on the Sales and Marketing in the UK and website optimisation.
Therefore we wanted to offer you different perks and rewards so that all backers, regardless of your participation, can receive a little something from Morant Bay, as our way of thanking you for your generosity (see the rewards from the list on the right).
Thank you
By contributing to Morant Bay's campaign, you'll become a part of history in the making by supporting the first British spiced red rum ever made.
So join our family, watch us grow and grow with us.  
 
Risks & Challenges
The alcohol and spirits sector of the global drinks industry is an extremely competitive market. Everyday new spirit brands enter the market and new Craft Beverage initiatives are growing continuously. In this challenging business environment, there is a strong need for a clear brand message and a WHY that connects to the consumers. We believe our brand has the right value, story, and conditions to become a global success!
The need for our high quality product in the global spiced rum sector is of great importance to our long term levels of success.
Without the ability to tap into the best distribution networks, any new brand would have difficulties reaching their target market, even with an exceptionally high premium quality brand. This is the reason for us at Morant Bay to put all of our efforts from this campaign in to developing the best possible distribution network links globally.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you would like to help but are unable to contribute to the campaign, there are other ways you can help us, share this link with as many people as possible and help us achieve our goals.
Why do we send vouchers?
Morant Bay are not allowed to directly offer alcoholic beverages to our backers,  but we can offer you a voucher that allows a physical delivery of the alcoholic beverage either in the UK or International. 
Due to strict federal law in the USA we're prohibited from distributing alcohol in certain states.

story:
How it all started...

When we traveled to Sri Lanka for the first time, we discovered breathtaking landscapes and met wonderful people. But we also discovered tea. And not any tea: Ceylon Tea.

Ceylon Tea is recognized as one of the best tea in the world due to its distinctive taste but also, and very few people know, due to its tea auction. This unique organization enforces that every single tea batch produced is tested, ensuring its quality and consistency in taste unlike other countries.

 

 

The Big Idea

We quickly realized how drinking tea can be beneficial for our health and how little we knew about those benefits. We started digging and found out that specific combinations could create really powerful tea blends that would answer most of our daily challenges.

We identified 3 categories which tackle our major concerns in the modern world: health, relaxation and harmony.

Finally we selected 9 different blends with targeted benefits on the body and mind, distinctive with their colorful and attractive design. They can be drunk hot, cold or iced.

Discover here our the ingredients we have selected for each blend:

Health        |     

  • Good Morning: English Breakfast Tea
  • Go Green: Green Tea Mint
  • Lime Punch: Green Tea Lemon
  • Simple Treat: Jasmine Buds, Green & Black Tea

Relaxation  |     

  • Mister Grey: Intense Earl Grey
  • Sweet Dreams: Chamomile & Honey

Harmony    |     

  • Candy Crush: Black Tea, Strawberry & Flowers
  • Midnight Rendez-Vous: Black Tea, Kiwi, Strawberry & Flowers
  • Sun Kiss: Black Tea, Apple pieces & Flowers

We also ensured that all our teas are from natural ingredients, GMO free, vegan friendly and 100% plastic free.

 

Where do we stand?

Today we are an up and running business with endless opportunities:

  • Retail: we sell to the end consumers via premium groceries and yoga studios 
  • E-Retail: we are present online with selected e-retailers and on our own e-commerce
  • Hospitality: we supply hotels, restaurants and coffee shops
  • Corporate: we provide special rates and corporate gifts

We have also been awarded best boutique brand 2018 by the Women's Health Magazine.

 

Why do we need you?

We have done a great job so far but today we require additional funds to be able to accelerate and enlarge our portfolio. This campaign will allow us mainly to fund the below projects:

  • Produce gift boxes to create tea sets
  • Participate in trade shows to expand our business

 

Why are we a good bet?

Backing up our project is a rather safe bet as we are already up and running. Most of the products are already in stock so you are guaranteed to receive your order! 

Moreover, we are only starting realize the endless benefits tea has on our health and if you are still not convinced, have a look at some key facts below:

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some of you might not be able to contribute financially. But if you believe in our project, there are other ways you can help us:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
ABOUT

Palenque is a company dedicated to providing nutritious gourmet Colombian fusions and ‘home­style’ cooking to the New York metro area. Our food is made with passion &  love! We only use the finest eco­-friendly organic ingredients. Our artisanal AREPAS are inspired by traditional recipes and made with ancient whole grains such as South American quinoa, brown rice, flax, chia and sesame seeds. The desire to share this traditional pre-Columbian gastronomic treasure is aligned with the values of the founders: Viviana Lewis and Nena Sierra  who cook with passion while staying true to the long­standing tradition of AREPA-making.

, 

 

OUR VISION

After 7 years of being part of the NYC street food scene, we want to build a brick and mortar location for our Arepa Factory as well as a Café & Restaurant. By raising $25K in equity, we will be able to finish our project which is about 90% done. 

 

We want to give conscientious eaters the opportunity to eat arepas made with organic, local and quality ingredients – the true definition of “Delicious and Nutritious.” Eventually, we want to expand our franchise to cities like Chicago, Miami, L.A. and San Francisco. We’d also like to distribute our products nationwide. 

One cup of QUINUA contains:  8 grams of protein,  5 grams of fiber, 58% manganese, 28% phosphorus,  19% folate,  18% copper, 15% iron , 13% zinc,  9% potassium, More than 10%  vitamins B1, B2, B6, Small amounts of calcium, vitamin B3 and vitamin E. 

THE SPACE 

We already have a 15-yr. lease on a space of 2,000 sq. ft, divided into 1200 sq. ft for the kitchen Factory, and 800 sq. ft for the Cafe & Restaurant, which seats about 25-30 people. We want people to feel at home with a simple yet beautiful decoration. Our goal is to serve our community by giving them good vibes, good music and, above all, good food.

 

HOW WE PLAN TO SPEND THE MONEY

The funds we raise will help us finish the last part of the construction. Any remaining funds will be used for decoration and operational costs, including labor, marketing and cash flow to break-even. 

SUMMER TIME

We are currently working the summer in our 2 points of sale Rockaway beach and Jacob Riis park and Smorgasburg in Williamsburg and Prospect park  to be ready for the fall and open the Café & Restaurant, Arepa Factory.

 

 

HOW WE MAKE AREPAS  

 

PHILOSOPHY

Our dream is to introduce a healthier version of arepas to the United States. We believe that in a country of immigrants, there should be healthier food options inspired by the food of other countries. We also believe in making food that’s organic, gluten free and delicious. With your help and the support of our community, we will bring this concept to life.

 

Please spread the word in your social media to be able to reach our goal and have you at Palenque Café & Restaurant ! 

Instagram: @palenquefood                     

Facebook: Palenque Colombian food

 

THANKS!!!!

GRACIAS!!!!

story:
Please Share!

Maaji’s Street Kitchen will be an Indian food truck, going to different locations weekly in St. Louis, Missouri. Our food truck will serve traditional Indian recipes made from scratch. When you eat at Maaji’s, you’re more than our guest, you’re our family!

 

Heena was born and raised in New Delhi, India where she learned the art of cooking from her own Maaji (which means mom in Hindi). Growing up in India, food, flavor, family and friends are all part of daily life. Most families prepare all the meals from scratch. Heena has incorporated these lessons into her own dishes using aromatic spices, fresh herbs, and organic ingredients whenever possible. 

The core menu plus specials is set, tested and ready to go.  So that this awesome dream may come a reality, we need to purchase a food truck.  Contributors will receive the following perks for giving:

$5 - Shoutout

Shoutout on our website

$2500 - Work or Home St. Louis Special

Meal Catered by Maaji's Street Kitchen

Catering for up to 30

Shoutout on our website

(Limit 10)

 

The funding we are raising will used towards the following:

 

Purchase Truck

Retrofit for Food Truck

Commercial Kitchen Rental

Opening Inventory, Licenses, and Fees

 

My customers, friends and families have been encouraging me for years to take this step, and now it’s time. This campaign will end after 30 days. Any contribution you give will be appreciated.  You sharing this campaign link with your Facebook friends would be awesome!  Thank you for your support.

For more information on what services we offer check out our website at www.maajisstreetkitchen.com

story:
[Disclaimer: We are French, so you know our English is not perfect :)  if you see any mistakes please send a message at redboxwine at gmail.com Thank you! Merci!]

 

THE CONCEPT

 

   Selection of the best wines  and champagnes directly from France

  3 types of boxes : Premium, Luxury, Diamond

  The Red Magazine 

  Analysis of your tastes

  1 very special box for free/each year !

 VIP online cellar

  Videos

  Accessories

 

Never buy bad wines again !

 

 

A SELECTION OF THE BEST FRENCH WINES BY OUR EXPERT

 

Everyone can buy a bottle of wine but to choose the best one just by reading the label or with your knowledge, it’s not easy.

That’s why we have decided to work with a French expert who can choose THE best bottle, the one you want to taste, the one that you will remember for ever or just the one that you will love (we will learn your preferences each month and adapt your profile).

 

 

 

 

THE RED MAGAZINE

 

Now it’s your turn to impress your friends and family with your knowledge. Learn to savor like a professional, to recognize the flavors, to know how to pair the wine with the right dish, and become an expert on storage temperatures.

Each month the Red magazine will help you learn more and to be a better wine lover.

 

WINES ADAPTED TO YOUR PREFERENCES

 

As the months go by, we will individually adapt the boxes according to your tastes.

We will not just send the same bottles to everyone. If you have a preference for wines from the Bordeaux region or a love for white wines for example, we will listen to you

and send the bottles you need.

If you are just curious, let yourself be guided by our expert.

 

 

A SPECIAL BOX !

 

Once a year you will have the opportunity to ask for a free special box, whether it's on the occasion of your birthday, to celebrate a wedding or a birth,

to celebrate your children's diploma or any other important event in life, we will offer you an assortment of prestigious bottles fitting the occasion of your choice.

 

 

       

TO HAVE THE CHOICE

 

            With our REDBOX you don't have 1 single option but 3!

You can choose between the PREMIUM Box, the LUXURY Box and the DIAMOND (Special Champagne Box).

  (ATTENTION: The images below are illustrations, the real RedBox will be much more stylish!)

 

PREMIUM Box

In this box you will find great bottles. You will enjoy it! If your are a beginner, we will help you discover the range of different wines from France.

If you are a connoisseur you will receive bottles that you will love for sure.

 

LUXURY Box

 

Each month: The perfect combination on your table. Our sommelier will choose for you rare bottles based on your tastes.

You will find bottles from very small producers, award-winning wines and wines served at

the best restaurants.

 

DIAMOND - Special Champagne Box

 

Only few people know that in France there are around 5000 wine makers that can sell real Champagne.

With this box you will discover wonderful bottles with wonderful tastes.

You will discover champagne produced on smaller estates, with more personality and flavors in the mouth than the big brands that everyone knows.

 

STOP BUYING BAD WINES

 

When you are a novice, it is often very difficult to know if you are in front of good wine or not.

Increasing number of fake bottles with names sometimes very similar to the originals.

Thanks to our selection realized directly on the French territory by our expert, we guarantee you a 100% authentic wine.

 

THE ONLINE CAVE

 

A wine you really liked?

We are creating a website with a VIP access just for you to order a wine from your RedBox  you really enjoyed, with a special discount !

 

EXCLUSIVE VIDEO

 

Receive each month an exclusive video based on Red Magazine, allowing you to discover the

pro tasting techniques, the French wine regions and makers, how to serve wine and other secrets.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

       OUR TEAM

 

Thomas

Co-Founder | Professional in Nutrition & Great Wines and Champagnes Lover.

  "My preference: Champagne in particular Dom Pérignon. It has a recognizable taste amongst 1000, it evokes me smoky notes, and leaves me an unforgettable memory, we can feel from the first sip all the work upstream.

It's that kind of experience that I want to make alive with the RedBox. "

 

 

Stephanie

Co-Founder | Digital innovator, Expert in social networks and digital marketing, Polyglot & Great Lover of Wine and Champagnes.

« I love to share what i have learned. Since i'm in France i ate at a lot of restaurants and tasted a lot of different wines and champagnes. Each time it was an amazing experience. The Chefs i have met taught me a lot of interesting things from wine making to wine tasting.

Now i just want to share my knowledge with the world.  »

 

 

Sébastien

Wine expert (also for the former French President) | Wine seller,Gastronome member @ "Les toques Françaises", ancient director of the "Terasse Hotel" in Paris, he studied in one of the most famous Hotel/Cooking school of France.

"No matter the name or the label, the quality, nothing but the quality."

 

      THE OFFERS

It has a recognizable taste amongst 1000, it evokes me smoky notes, and leaves me an unforgettable memory, we can feel from the first sip all the work upstream.It's that kind of experience that I want to make alive with the RedBox. "  StephanieCo-Founder | Digital innovator, Expert in social networks and digital marketing, Polyglot & Great Lover of Wine and Champagnes.« I love to share what i have learned. Since i'm in France i ate at a lot of restaurants and tasted a lot of different wines and champagnes. Each time it was an amazing experience. The Chefs i have met taught me a lot of interesting things from wine making to wine tasting. Now i just want to share my knowledge with the world.  »  SébastienWine expert (also for the former French President) | Wine seller,Gastronome member @ "Les toques Françaises", ancient director of the "Terasse Hotel" in Paris, he studied in one of the most famous Hotel/Cooking school of France."No matter the name or the label, the quality, nothing but the quality."       THE OFFERS

story:
What is Hospitality Gin?

Hospitality Gin is a London Dry gin with a purpose.

We use 100% of our profits support the UK hospitality industry and its employees. We will do this until the COVID-19 pandemic is over.

Why the hospitality industry?

  • The hospitality industry was hit first and hardest by the pandemic
  • It is likely to be the last sector allowed to reopen after the pandemic 
  • Thousands of hospitality workers have already lost their jobs and livelihoods, despite Government support for businesses
  • Many venues are at risk of permanent closure

Your donations will help provide Emergency Grants to those hit hardest, as well as fund mental health hotlines to help people through their darkest times.

Our founder, Tom, has worked in the hospitality industry for his entire working life, and has seen and heard first hand the devastation COVID-19 has had on people's lives. Hospitality Gin is a way to give back, and support those who need it. 

How Will The Profits Be Donated?

100% of profits will be used to support the UK hospitality industry. The main two charities we will be donating to are The Drinks Trust and Hospitality Action, see below for more details. By minimising our overheads  and through the generosity of our partners, we will be donating between £4-6 of every bottle to charity. 

About The Charities

Hospitality Gin supports charities and causes that support the UK hospitality industry, both directly and indirectly. The two largest charities dedicated to hospitality workers are The Drinks Trust and Hospitality Action.

Between them, The Drinks Trust and Hospitality Action have paid over £750,000 of grants to workers who have lost earnings due to the COVID-19 pandemic. They are now shifting to helping members of the drinks industry to live mentally and physically healthy lives through the pandemic and beyond.

About The Gin

We've partnered with Cooper King Distillery in North Yorkshire to create an amazing London Dry gin. Made with honey from their own beehives, a touch of fresh lemon grass and locally grown lavender, it is equally as delicious over ice or in a tall, frosty G&T.

By distilling in state-of-the-art glass vacuum stills, they can ensure that the distillation temperatures are tailored to suit each individual botanical, creating a gin with only the freshest, fullest flavours. Everything is is distilled by hand so the distillers artistry truly shines through.

Cooper King also have environmental credentials to be proud of. They run on 100% green energy and donate a minimum of 1% of all of their sales to environmental charity, the Yorkshire Dales Millennium Trust.

Why Are We Running A Crowdfunding Campaign?

All of the money raised up to our target will go towards paying for our first batch of gin, and making sure that it launches with the biggest splash possible. The more exposure we can get, the more money we can raise for those who need it. 

Currently Tom is funding the entire project himself; he's investing his entire savings to purchase the first batch of gin, meaning there’s little left to do everything else. 

What are the perks? 

  • EARLY BIRD OFFER!! The first 50 people to contribute £30 can claim a voucher at 10% off RRP
  • Contribute £33 to Hospitality Gin and we'll send you a voucher to claim a free bottle when we launch
  • Every backer can opt to receive a handwritten letter of thanks. Your contribution will help us to get the most money possible to those who need it most
  • Contribute £5 or more to suggest ingredients for our range of local gins. There's more on these just below
  • If you're feeling particularly thirsty then a contribution of £180 will get you a voucher for a FULL CASE (that's six bottles!) of Hospitality Gin when we launch. 
  • Want to see where the magic happens? For a contribution of £2,500 you'll get a private tour of Cooper King Distillery for six when the pandemic and lockdown laws allow. You'll stay for two nights in the beautiful nearby Yorkshire countryside, and get a voucher for a bottle gin EACH to claim at the distillery, as well as one of our swanky t-shirts each.
  • A contribution of £7,500 gets you in on designing our first "local" gin. If you're not content with just submitting an an idea, and need to see your idea bottled then this is the perk for you. We'll work with you to create a viable flavour combination before liaising with Cooper King Distillery to start creating your concoction. Once the process is over (possibly after a few attempts) we'll bottle and sell your gin, with your name featuring on the label! You'll leave with a case (six bottles) of your brand new gin, and the satisfaction of knowing that your gin will be enjoyed all over the country, with every bottle supporting UK hospitality.

And if we beat our target? That's where things get exciting! 

We're planning to design and launch a range of "local" gins. These will be gins designed for individual cities or regions, using ingredients that are synonymous with them! For example:

  • Sheffield's gin could include Yorkshire Tea and Henderson's Relish
  • Cornwall? Clotted cream!
  • Scrumpy cider from Bristol 
  • The only limit is what we can distill!

About Tom

Tom has spent his whole working life in the hospitality industry and has recently dedicated his time to advising hospitality workers affected by the COVID-19 pandemic. He has worked tirelessly to ensure that useful information is accessible in an easily digestible format.

By sharing this information with a group of senior hospitality professionals with extensive social networks, tens of thousands hospitality professionals were kept up-to-date on the developing situation and its real world effects. Through this he became aware of how many members of the hospitality industry were left in precarious financial positions through no fault of their own.

Prior to the pandemic, he was working on several projects which have been shelved for the time being, as well as working at FirePit Rocks in Sheffield City Centre. Tom was heavily involved in the developing the concept and brand of FirePit Rocks, and in return they continue to support him.

Tom’s motivation has always been to help those who need it, by freely sharing advice or best practice to those who need it, and in turn helping the local hospitality industry to grow. Now more than ever, we need to pull together to support those who need it most, and that is the rationale for founding Hospitality Gin.

Made by the Hospitality Industry, to support the Hospitality Industry.

What are the Risks & Challenges

Hospitality Gin is a low risk project. Our first order is already with the distillery, so the brand will be launching regardless. We can guarantee that all perks will be fulfilled, even if we don't meet our fundraising target.

Our partners all have a wealth of experience in their fields and have been advising us every step of the way. 

This is a great cause, but I don't like gin...

You can help in other ways! ALL of our profits will be going towards supporting the UK hospitality industry

  • Buy a bottle for a friend who does! They get gin, and you get the warm fuzzy feeling of knowing you've helped someone in need.
  • Contribute without picking a perk, you'll be helping us get money to those who need it most
  • Let your friends who do love gin know about us by sharing our campaign on your social media channels. Indiegogo's share features will do all the hard work for you! 

KEEP UP TO DATE!
