story:
The Khonso Experience is coming to Atlanta. We at Khonso Brewing have been planning for  production, distribution, and growth. If it sounds like a lot of work, that’s because it is!

Khonso was founded by three friends: Kevin Downing, Corby Hannah, and William Teasley. One evening in 2013, Kevin and William were having a dads’ night out drinking imported beer when the idea of launching a brewery was shared, and the seeds of Khonso were planted. Corby and Kevin had already had this conversation during their younger years, and the three men, armed with a homebrew kit, some basic equipment, and their passion for beer, began their brewing journey as Brothers That Brew. Nine years of combined all-grain home brewing experience (nearly 750 gallons brewed), flavor experimentation, and conversations with brewers, locally and across the country, helped Khonso to take root.

Over the past few years, we have had tremendous support from our community and benefited from all the advice that everyone has shared. We are truly grateful for all the people that have been with us on this journey and for those new faces that join. Khonso beer is for all of us.

Now, we’re asking for your help to get us out of the starting blocks. Our strategy will get our beer into the market in 2018 and kick start our plans for a taproom and a microbrewery. Your support will launch Khonso into the Georgia beer market and plant the seeds for it to grow into a destination for you, our community, and beyond. 

What We Need

To date, we’ve contributed over $80,000 in product development, initial brew production, marketing, legal, planning, and permitting/licensing activities. We’re now asking for your support in raising an additional $23,980 to fund 2-3 contract brews and a fermenter. Our first commercial beer will be produced at our contract brewer, Left Nut Brewing, in the Spring of 2018. The beer produced - Peachtree and another of our fan favorite beers - will be available in the Fall of 2018 at Atlanta bars, restaurants, growler shops, and beer festivals.

In exchange for your support, we have some special perks that establish you as a founding member of the Khonso Krew. All of the items have Khonso’s distinct colors, logos, and tagline. All supporters will receive the Welcome Khonso swag that includes key chains, coasters, stickers, and coozies. Additional levels of support include glassware, growlers, baseball caps, t-shirts, polo shirts, and hoodies.

Our higher level of supporters will be inaugural members of Klub Khonso, a limited membership group that has special perks based on the level of support. The Special perks include Invitations to special limited access events, beer festival guest list, Khonso Brewing bomber jacket, picture (or selected image) on a future beer label, or a limited release beer named after you.

Even if the goal is not met, all of the funds received will go to production, marketing, and promotion of Khonso Brewing.

The Impact

The Khonso Experience is about expanding and diversifying the community of beer lovers across all boundaries. We represent beer’s inclusive history that goes back to Mesopotamia and was a daily part of Egyptian life. We recognize all of the contributions to beer up to the present.

For years, as Brothers That Brew, we have shared the beer with everyone regardless of ethnic background, faith, gender, orientation, etc. Our approach to beer is that it is for everyone and to eliminate preconceived notions about beer and beer communities. With over 40 events where we’ve shared our beer with friends old and new, we listened and have crafted a strategy to respond to your suggestions as well as grow the Khonso community.

As we grow, we’ll be adding staff, creating apprenticeships, and locally sourcing ingredients for Khonso beer. We are already exploring sites South and West of downtown Atlanta where we can add economic diversity to those communities and well as career opportunities. As individuals, we have been very active in all of our communities. Locally, Brothers That Brew has supported such non-profit organizations as Park Pride, 21st Century Leaders, the Wylde Center, Frazer Center, St. Jude, and others. Khonso brewing will continue to be an extension of our efforts to improve our communities.

Challenges & Risks

We want to enter the beer market so you and others will have a fresh, high-quality choice of beer to drink, and Atlanta will have another strong local business impacting the community.

The greatest challenge in moving from home brewers to commercial brewers is securing capital and resources (time, human) needed to open our doors. We have not taken this risk lightly as we have families and others that depend on our incomes. With their support, we have made a commitment to open the brewery we have dreamed of. In addition to personal investments, we have enlisted the support of beer industry professionals and business advisers to guide us to our taproom and brewery.

Ultimately, there is the risk of market acceptance. We and many of those that have tasted our beer have enjoyed what we offer but ultimately the consumer will be the judge. That’s why we chose to contract with Left Nut Brewing and have them and other brewers mentor us along the way. Our beer will be on par with other top craft beer in the market and the experience will be beyond the ordinary.

Other Ways To Help

To our fans and supporters, thank you for all you’ve done for us, and thank you for your continued help as we join Georgia’s craft beer scene. With your continued support, Khonso will continue on its path to add a fresh experience on beer to the beer scene in Atlanta, Georgia, and beyond.

Since you’re in a giving mood, you can do one more thing for us - please spread the word about Khonso to anybody you know who loves great beer or anybody who doesn’t love beer, but wants to support a local business. Or, frankly, anybody!

Come taste our beer, rate it on the app Untapped, post pics with it on Instagram, and Twitter and tag us @khonsobrewing. Use #khonsobeer #khonsoexperience #khonsobrewing regularly. And if you try a new beer somewhere that you really like, share it with us as well.

 

CHEERS AND THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

 

KEVIN, CORBY, AND WILLIAM

story:
Summary

I'm Alex Spires.  I have been homebrewing for 12 years now.  There is nothing better than coming up with a new recipe and watching someone enjoy it.  My wife Megan foolishly encourages the hobby.  We like to visit every brewery we can find and look at their brewing process and the different taproom atmospheres.  We have become pretty passionate to the craft.  The more we learn about beer the more we enjoy it.  Spires Social is our way of spreading that passion and bringing the community together.  We want to create a place where anyone can come be a part of something and have a good time - beer seems like a great focal point for that.  Our boys, Will and Riley, are also helping us lead the charge with Yellow Flag Soda.  We've got a plan ahead of us and need some more capital to lock down a location and start construction.

What We Need & What You Get

Building a brewery takes equipment and somewhere to keep it.  We've got a start on the equipment and we're pouring our life savings into the rest.  This campaign will help us secure a location and fill it with shiny stainless steel tanks.  We will be building a 10 bbl (315 gallons) brewhouse and purchasing four 10 bbl fermenters, six serving tanks, and lots of other pieces to help run it.

To help raise the money we need we've got some pretty exciting perks for your contribution.  **Note for local pickup leave the shipping as United States for $0.  To have item shipped, select "Rest of world".

Spires Social vinyl sticker:

Spires Social Beer Pioneer shirt:

Custom Spires Social glass with your name on it:

Spires Social bottle opener:

Risks & Challenges

Every new business and project will have some risks associated.  We will require licenses at a local, state, and federal levels.  We also have some construction and large purchases to make.  We have a solid business plan with contingencies in place to address potential problems.  Alex is a Project Management Professional who has worked the last 9 years as a manufacturing engineer.  Megan has experience managing several medical practices and brings a wealth of knowledge on running a business.  We have also befriended several seasoned industry experts who have offered their guidance through the journey ahead.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't make a contribution at this time, you can really help us out by sharing our campaign. We need to get the word out and you can help. Want to get even more involved? Contact us! We will have several employment opportunities available as we get closer to opening.

story:
Short Story

Hey, I'm Chef Philip from the Philippines! I love cooking with a wide variety of ingredients, techniques, flavors, and textures and I believe cooking brings people together. I worked in the culinary arts field for 15 years in the beautiful city of San Diego, but I recently moved back to my hometown, Ridgecrest, CA, to start my own culinary business. I like to keep things simple, so I opened up Bebe's Lumpia to share my family recipe. Unfortunately we only have a food tent and can only do events like the Ridgecrest Farmer's Market on Saturdays. If we have a food trailer then we can be available more days of the week and work with more business owners and it will be easier to set up on our windy days the wind can go up to 30 mph sometimes . A lot of our guests ask "How about the weekdays" or " Where is your restaurant in town" and I say "We don't have one yet, but soon." That is why we are raising $40,000 for the truck, license, permit, marketing, and all other California fees. With your help we can spend more days sharing our family recipe and kindness as cooking brings people together. Have a beautiful day!  

 

Chef Philip from the Philippines was born in Cebu City, Philippines on September 23, 1985. When he was two years old his family moved to California, United States of America. He grew up in a small town called Ridgecrest; Life there was easy living with a wonderful community. He loved to skateboard and breakdance with friends and family. After high school Chef Philip wondered what he was going to do. He thought about his family and how they love to cook and invite people into their homes. He loved the concept that cooking brings people together, so he moved to San Diego, CA to pursue a career in culinary arts. After graduating from school, he worked with some amazing chefs in restaurants like Bodi in Downtown San Diego and Season 52 in La Jolla. He wanted to do his own thing, now he is building a culinary business in his hometown.

 

  • This campaign is very important because with a food tent we are limited to work with businesses that require high permit fees and strict regulations due to COVID and right now we cant do the farmer market because we don't have a food trailer, but with a food trailer we can bypass the high permit fees, participate in more local events, and work with more business owners to open up our weekly availability. 
  • The magnitude of help from contributors will be bigger than words can describe because it will lead to unlimited opportunities; More capital to achieve our goal leads to more sharing of our family recipes and kindness. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $40,000 for the food truck, license, permit, marketing, and supplies:

  • Food Truck= $35,000
  • License and Permit= $4,000
  • Marketing and Supplies=$1,000

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can always send contributions via Venmo if it is easier!
  • If you can't contribute in these tough times it is understandable, but you can help by using Indiegogo's share tools to spread the word to your friends and family on social media or any other creative way. The more noise we make the better!
  • Just wanted to deeply send the greatest Thank You who help me with this campaign I really couldn't do it without you. Good vibes and Karma to you all.
story_txt:
Short Story
Hey, I'm Chef Philip from the Philippines! I love cooking with a wide variety of ingredients, techniques, flavors, and textures and I believe cooking brings people together. I worked in the culinary arts field for 15 years in the beautiful city of San Diego, but I recently moved back to my hometown, Ridgecrest, CA, to start my own culinary business. I like to keep things simple, so I opened up Bebe's Lumpia to share my family recipe. Unfortunately we only have a food tent and can only do events like the Ridgecrest Farmer's Market on Saturdays. If we have a food trailer then we can be available more days of the week and work with more business owners and it will be easier to set up on our windy days the wind can go up to 30 mph sometimes . A lot of our guests ask "How about the weekdays" or " Where is your restaurant in town" and I say "We don't have one yet, but soon." That is why we are raising $40,000 for the truck, license, permit, marketing, and all other California fees. With your help we can spend more days sharing our family recipe and kindness as cooking brings people together. Have a beautiful day!  
 
Chef Philip from the Philippines was born in Cebu City, Philippines on September 23, 1985. When he was two years old his family moved to California, United States of America. He grew up in a small town called Ridgecrest; Life there was easy living with a wonderful community. He loved to skateboard and breakdance with friends and family. After high school Chef Philip wondered what he was going to do. He thought about his family and how they love to cook and invite people into their homes. He loved the concept that cooking brings people together, so he moved to San Diego, CA to pursue a career in culinary arts. After graduating from school, he worked with some amazing chefs in restaurants like Bodi in Downtown San Diego and Season 52 in La Jolla. He wanted to do his own thing, now he is building a culinary business in his hometown.
 

This campaign is very important because with a food tent we are limited to work with businesses that require high permit fees and strict regulations due to COVID and right now we cant do the farmer market because we don't have a food trailer, but with a food trailer we can bypass the high permit fees, participate in more local events, and work with more business owners to open up our weekly availability. 
The magnitude of help from contributors will be bigger than words can describe because it will lead to unlimited opportunities; More capital to achieve our goal leads to more sharing of our family recipes and kindness. 


What We Need & What You Get
We are raising $40,000 for the food truck, license, permit, marketing, and supplies:

Food Truck= $35,000
License and Permit= $4,000
Marketing and Supplies=$1,000



Other Ways You Can Help

You can always send contributions via Venmo if it is easier!

If you can't contribute in these tough times it is understandable, but you can help by using Indiegogo's share tools to spread the word to your friends and family on social media or any other creative way. The more noise we make the better!
Just wanted to deeply send the greatest Thank You who help me with this campaign I really couldn't do it without you. Good vibes and Karma to you all.

story:
Gc Cutlery - Cutlery and Craftsmanship

My name is Garrett Carper. I am the owner and creator of GC Cutlery here in Port Charlotte Florida. Like a lot of makers i grew up trying to learn how everything works and how I could make it myself. Like tearing apart the toaster just to put it back together. It all started with my father teaching me wood working but I always had a fascination with steel. This entire world as we know it is built on the production of steel. And what was one of the first objects made of steel?

  Thats right a knife.

Knives are one of those items that each and every one of us use everyday. Chopping up a mirepoix for homemade chicken noodle soup, cutting open your amazon package, shaving (because a razor is still a knife), the list goes on. My goal is to be able to provide top quality cutlery, not just for the chef at the 5 star restaurant but the home cook who's kids are screaming they want dinner. You need a knife that will preform the same every time you use it. 

  With your contributions I aim to equip GC Cutlery with the tools and equipment needed to produce the very best cutlery at a price that is attainable for everyone.

 
 
 

 

    

 

 

Funding Goal - $4,700.

Goal breakdown;

  • Coal Ironworks forge press - $3,000.
  • Even Heat Heat Treatment Kiln - $1,200.
  • Refractory materials for production forge $500.

The Coal Ironworks forge press is a 12 ton hydraulic forging press used to move hot steel in a way that no human can do by hand. The use of this tool will cut my production cost in half. The most expensive part of a hand made knife is the hours it takes to make it. It also gives me the ability to make Damascus steel. Damascus steel is a very sought after blade material, not only for its performance but for the sheer beauty of the craftsmanship that goes into making it. The hydraulic press is main item in my goal.

The Even Heat - heat treatment kiln is an integral part of knife making. Heat treating is that act of heating steel up to a specific temperature and cooling rapidly. Steel is made up of different carbides and molecular compounds. When its heated and cooled rapidly it causes the steel to "harden". A knife is only as good as its heat treatment. A properly heat treated knife is something that will last for generations. 

Refractory materials are used to insulate heat. A forge works by taking a heat source and isolating that heat. When the heat is isolated without being able to escape the temperature rises dramatically to the point where steel becomes as malleable as clay. 

 Perks of contributing!

Giving back is important to me! Every contribution will be recognized with the utmost appreciation. There will be different items for different levels of involvement. 

Everyone who donates will be put on an email mailing list, on that you will receive first look at all my new designs. Not only will you have first look but you will be first inline to purchase a new design before it is ever advertised.

Contributions of $100. will receive a hand forged item of their choice (eg. bottle opener, keychain, pendant or a small knife)

Contributions of $500. will receive a custom carbon steel chef knife with handle material of their choosing.

Contributions of $1,000 or more will receive a hand forged Damascus steel chef knife. With your choice of knife style and handle material. Also included custom leather sheath for their knife of choice.


 

Other ways to help!

 I know not everyone can contribute monetarily but theres a lot more to be done. I ask everyone to like and share my social media. @Gc_cutlery on Instagram and Facebook. One share can go a long way. Another way to help is if you have purchased a product from me to write an honest review. The best way to grow a business is word of mouth. 

 

 

  There are always challenges when it comes to starting from the ground up. Ive put countless hours into improving my craft and it is still not perfect. The apprentice aims for perfection but the master knows it will never be achieved. Every time i step into my shop i aim to make the next knife better than the last and learn from my mistakes.  

 

  In the end I truly want to put top quality products in to the hands of everyone. A knife is not just sharp piece of metal. A knife can be a beautiful piece of art or a tool that you can teach your children to use and hand it down for multiple generations. We've all seen Grandpa's pocket knife from 1946 that still works as the day he got it new. Why can't we do that with a chef knife?

story:
This is our continued campaign to raise the funds for Missoula's first Pakistani food truck. Thus far we have been able to raise close to $12,000 (after fees), which would all be used towards the purchase of the food truck. Any additional funds raised through this attempt, would be added to the original amount. As most food trailers start from about $25,000, we hope to raise enough funds to at least acquire the most important and expensive equipment to start operation. 

We have also been in contact with local media outlets, and we hope the exposure from that would help spread the word and get the community to chip in to help bring this dream to fruition. I recently taught an online Zoom class through United We Eat and had some great feedback from the amazing home cooks.  We are hopeful the enthusiasm in the community helps us reach our goal.

Introduction

Hello, my name is Zohair Bajwa. I was born and raised in Lahore, Pakistan, and have been in Missoula since 2006. My friends and family will all tell you how much I enjoy sharing my culture through food – sharing the distinct tastes and smells of home with the people I love. Because of this, I have decided to embark on a new, exciting, and delicious endeavor – bringing the tastes of authentic Pakistani food to the Missoula community.

 

I hope to bring Lahore’s authentic street food to the streets of Missoula and the surrounding area. My wife Megan and I are looking into securing a food trailer in which to prepare and serve up some delicious Pakistani food to tantalize your taste buds and keep you coming back for more. This is where your support and generosity comes in, and please allow me to thank you up front.

 

Community and Food

 

Ever since I came to Missoula in 2006 as a student at the University of Montana, there has always been something missing for me – good curries, and, more specifically, Pakistani food.

 

I was deeply honored to have the chance to cook for my community through the United We Eat (“UWE”) program through Soft Landing Missoula last year. It was such a humbling experience – to see the excitement the Missoula community displayed for authentic Pakistani food. We ended up selling out 150 meals!

https://bit.ly/2YY7Y25

https://bit.ly/2IrA0xs

I plan to bring the same love and passion to my food trailer as I did for the UWE program, and you can expect no compromises when it comes to using authentic spices and recipes, resulting in a whole new world of flavors for you to enjoy.

 

Eventually, once we are up and running and have firm footing in the Missoula food scene, we plan to give back to our Missoula neighbors, either by specials or discounted/free meals for various ones in the community.

 

What Foods to Expect

 

Megan and I have had several conversations about a menu we believe would best bring the tastes of Lahore to the people of Missoula. During our trip home earlier this year, we explored different flavors that we think would work best to introduce to our community here. We will initially be serving:

 

Chicken Karahi: traditionally cooked in a wok with tomatoes and spices, simmered to a thick sauce. Served best with naan and kachumar* (keto-friendly)

Daal: orange lentils perfectly cooked to a stew-like consistency. Prepared with spices and served best over rice or naan (vegan, vegetarian friendly)

Samosa: everyone knows about these delicious, fried concoctions!

Paratha Rolls: a traditional grab-and-go street food from Pakistan. Chicken or vegetables cooked in spices, mixed with kachumar*, mint and tamarind chutneys, wrapped in a crispy paratha (fry bread).

Shakar Qandi: My wife’s favorite snack in Lahore! Sweet potato mixed with freshly squeezed orange and spices. Traditionally served over newspaper (we won’t be doing that here, obviously – hello health code violation), and toothpicks.

*Kachumar: sliced raw onions, raw tomatoes mixed with fresh lemon/lime juice, cilantro, salt and black pepper. A perfect accompaniment to any of the above-listed meals.

Chutneys: Spicy mint chutney and a sweet and tangy tamarind chutney.

 

What You Get for Helping Fund This Project

 

Besides having a local spot where you can try the delicious tastes of traditional and authentic Pakistani food, adding to Missoula’s food and cultural diversity, you can expect the listed rewards.

For any donations received from outside of Missoula area and if you cannot visit us when we're open, we will do our best to get your T-shirts mailed to you as soon we are able to. Also, if and when you're in Missoula, please come say hi and we will take care of you the only way we know- Pakistani hospitality style. For catering donations, we can certainly schedule a date where you will be in Missoula and would like to take advantage of that perk.

 

Risks and Challenges

 

Obviously, there is always a risk of failure, and to be honest, that risk is part of the reason why I have shied away from this endeavor until now. But I believe now is the time to make my dream a reality – now is the time for Missoula to experience authentic Pakistani food that is rich in flavor, made with love, and warms the soul.

 

During these extraordinary times in which we find ourselves, I understand that not everyone is able to contribute financially to this project. However, I would be very thankful for your support, encouragement, and patronage when we do open. I hope the people of Missoula are as excited as Megan and I are for this project, and I hope you will show your support by opening your hearts and your wallets to make this a success and help us add something new to your dining options!

*Photo Courtesy: Sara Diggins @ Montana Kaimin

story:
Proper Cookie Dough | Powered By Plants 

 

Our Goal

No matter your dietary restriction, lifestyle or palate; you can enjoy a Proper Cookie. 12 ounces of ooey-gooey, satiating deliciousness packed with all things good (Antioxidants, Superfoods, fiber, protein and chocolate). Enjoy all 4 flavors of our cookie dough, available in (12 cookies per jar): Chocolate Chipper, Snickerdoodle, Triple Chocolate and Sugar Cookie. 

WHAT IS IN YOUR DOUGH?

We take our ingredients seriously and are working with food scientists and nutritionists to create the perfect plant-based cookie. 

While our dough is currently in research/development and will be a modified version of our current ingredient list, we've decided that these ingredients take top priority:

Organic, Non-Gmo, Allergen Free..Always 

 Sorghum Flour: It contains antioxidants like policosanols and a single serving of sorghum contains 48% of your recommended daily intake of Fiber. 

 Oat Flour: Organic Oat Flour is rich in iron, zinc, and protein. It’s also a treasure chest of minerals and a good source of vitamins B1 and B3.

 Butterfly Pea Flower (dye): It is traditionally used for its anti-aging benefits in Southeast Asia. It is also known as a memory enhancer, rich source of antioxidants and known for eye health and hormonal support. It also contains Proanthocyanidins which enhance the collagen production of skin cells.

Ingredients currently in our dough: Brown/White Rice Flour, Guar Gum, Arrowroot Starch, Tapioca Starch, Coconut oil (refined to have NO ALLERGENS, also no 7S and 11S globulins)* Sustainable Palm Fruit Oil, Sunflower Oil, Baking Powder, Vegan Cane Sugar, Apples, Vanilla Extract and Sea Salt.  

* We WILL NOT use Allergen Free Coconut Oil in Proper 2.0

 

All Natural Plant Based Dyes

Snickerdoodle Cookie Dough

Why We Decided To Go Allergen Free 

#CookiesForAll

Researchers estimate that 32 million Americans have food allergies, including 5.6 million children under age 18. That’s one in 13 children, or roughly two in every classroom.

About 40 percent of children with food allergies are allergic to more than one food.

After years spent in professional kitchens, we learned one thing; Americans are Allergic As Fudge. As we developed the Proper recipe, we noticed interesting things about what was already on the market. A LOT of the cookie doughs were only Bakeable or just edible, maybe Vegan but not Corn Free. And from our own experiences (with family members having food allergies), we knew that if you have one food allergy, you could have several more. It didn't make sense that with so many cookie options, there wasn't one that everyone could eat.

 

Help Us Grow 

The UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and the Paris Agreement were founded in part to target practices that threaten climate stability and ecosystem resilience. Both groups have determined that we require an agricultural revolution that is based in sustainable practices and implementation of system wide innovation.

Proper was created to have an impact on that food system and consumer's relationship with plant-based foods, specifically desserts. Our efforts will need a Kickstart of $10,000 to produce a sustainable recipe that's hard to compete with. WE DO NOT USE ALMONDS IN OUR DOUGH.

The funds will help support our R&D and Commercialization efforts. We want to scale down our recipe and take out ingredients that may be adding too much sugar and sodium to it’s makeup. (see our current ingredient list below)

Our biggest goal with a recipe development lab is to add at least 3g of Fiber and 3g of Protein without affecting the taste that won over our earliest customers. 

Funds will also be used for a logistics consultant to ensure that every order of cookie dough is delivered ice cold to your doorstep, at the lowest cost possible. This'll allow us to offer Nationwide shipping at affordable pricing and aid in our efforts to make Allergen-Free dough accessible for everyone. 

Risks and challenges

There are always risks: miscalculation of costs, production waste, logistics etc. But we are taking measures to minimize these risks. We have a team of individuals helping us source some of the best consultants in logistics, nutrition, and commercialization. We promise to be transparent throughout the campaign to deliver a cookie you'll be satisfied with.

story:
MumbleDrum Bourbon

Is a wine cask finished bourbon, this first go-around we used barrels from an organic estate from Howell Mt, Napa Valley.

Three friends Chuck, Chris and Ian came together from Florida and California to create a whiskey brand that will always be finished in wine barrels from the U.S. and possibly the world later on. This finishing helps to mellow out the whiskey and add new flavors and nuances not found in the standard aging process.

We believe we are filling a need in the fast growing American Whiskey market with this process.

Why are we crowd sourcing?

 Our Bourbon has been in the wine barrels for 1 month now and we can tell we have an amazing product on our hands!
the $10,000 will go to bottling and packaging, along with pounding the pavement sales and marketing. 

Where? How?

 MumbleDrum's first markets will be Florida and California.
  Ian and Chris have lived and worked in the spirit industry of Florida for several years now and have an intimate knowledge of the market and accounts where MumbleDrum will succeed.
Chuck having lived in Sacramento, California most of his life along with a stint in the wine industry knows the area like the back his hand.

Incredible Facts about Bourbon*

  • Drinking Bourbon will give you Six-pack Abs
  • Makes you more attractive to the opposite sex
  • Bourbon is the favorite beverage of Big Foot
  • Can increase longevity
  • Jesus turned water into wine, then wine into bourbon
  • If you drink bourbon while listening to Dark Side of the Moon and watching Alice in Wonderland you will have a very enjoyable experience.
  • Is a natural deodorant
  • has more anti-oxidants than fish oil
  • If you stare into a glass of bourbon long enough, you will see your future self looking back at you.
  • Chuck Norris is the self-appointed bourbon ambassador to  the world.

*none of these "facts" have been proven, and are based purely on the ramblings of a insane man.
story_txt:
MumbleDrum Bourbon
Is a wine cask finished bourbon, this first go-around we used barrels from an organic estate from Howell Mt, Napa Valley. 
Three friends Chuck, Chris and Ian came together from Florida and California to create a whiskey brand that will always be finished in wine barrels from the U.S. and possibly the world later on. This finishing helps to mellow out the whiskey and add new flavors and nuances not found in the standard aging process.
We believe we are filling a need in the fast growing American Whiskey market with this process. story:
The idea behind the creation of this drink is very simple.After being constantly ill with colds on a weekly basis, I've noticed a  cycle, the more medication I took, the worse I felt. My immune system was crashing. I was very close to becoming a diabetic, I was fainting from the rapid change in my blood sugar levels or had moments where I couldn't even keep my eyes open.

After researching for a medications alternatives I've found turmeric and golden milk and I was surprised with the benefits of having it.

Within the first week, I've noticed the changes: my skin was looking healthier and had a glow, my immune system got stronger, and I didn't have a cold since. My stomach was better than ever and, most importantly, my blood sugar levels went from 37 to 32 in just a few weeks. All of that because of the amazing turmeric and ginger.

I started making the drink for friends and colleagues and slowly became an ambassador for it. Some of the people who've tried it said that the taste is very strong and even if it had benefits on their health they wouldn't have it because of the particular turmeric taste. This made me think how can I make this drink better for everyone? I've started experimenting with different fruits and spices, and finally, found a taste that everyone loved and the idea of Pura Vita was born.

This campaign will help us not only to raise the money we need to start manufacturing but will also bring more awareness to the people, help them focus on their health and bring more knowledge about the alternatives to the medications that we all take without even thinking about their side effects.

The biggest challenge is to source high-quality ingredients at reasonable prices as well as establishing  the brand amongst other health drink creators and to become a  part of the portfolio of organic and health-oriented stores, restaurants and coffee shops.

With your help and support, we will be able to start manufacturing the drink and source organic and ethical ingredients for each and every bottle.

At this stage, we have a great manufacturer behind us and we are eager to start working. The funds we raise will be used mostly for manufacturing fees, laboratory tests and supplying the raw materials we need. A small part of the funds will be used for purchasing suitable bottles, caps, and labels for our product. We believe that "a word of mouth"  is the best publicity, that's why the smallest part of the funds will be used for marketing, advertising and campaign fees.

We haven't forgotten about getting you some perks.

We have prepared some perks for all of you, who will support us on this journey.

 

We know that despite the desire, not everyone is able to spend money and back a campaign, but there are other ways of support that we appreciate as well, such as sharing this campaign with friends, family, and co-workers and make more people aware of the benefits of turmeric and ginger.

story:
Short Summary

Michael will set up a 15-barrel system to brew up more of that delicious flagship Pale Ale, followed by a hoppy IPA, and a high-octane European-style Triple ale. The Company plans to add four or five more varieties over time as Happy Hippie Brewing Company grows. Guests will be able to tour the brewery or taste beers in the taproom. 

A unique element to the business is its atmosphere of peace, love and happiness.  Consistent with its name and the culture and time from which it came, HHBC will enable patrons to choose one of 3 fixed charities or 3 rotating local charities to received 10% of the patron’s tab as a donation.  This is also the reasoning behind HHBC’s tag lines, “Making the World a Better Place One Beer at a Time” and “Brew with a Purpose”

 

What We Need & What You Get

Michael is looking to raise $75,000 that will be used to purchase equipment and construction costs for the HHBC.

Perks will include items as simple as stickers, shirts and glassware and as lasting as naming rights to tasting room tables, fermentors and even a brew master experience!

With your help, this dream can become a reality.  It will help build a brewery based on good beer, good times, peace, tolerance, and happiness.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that everyone is not able to contribute financially but you can still help.  Tell your friends, visit our facebook page to get updates.  Just get the word out there and, more importantly, come join us at our tap room when we make this a reality and always ask your favorite pub if they carry our beer.

Peace!

story:
Short Summary

I love cooking. I am a "COOK", not a Chef.

I have been cooking back since my early teens. The passion of creation is what makes me the "COOK" I am.

12 years ago, while owning a small diner in North Carolina, I was introduced and schooled on the Art of making great BBQ. It is about taking the time to make the meat work, and marrying it with a sauce that compliments, NOT covers the taste of the meats.

Ten years later, I am back at it. And using the sauce I developed in North Carolina, my customers in New Mexico have never tasted the blend of ingredients that I am so passionate about. One small modification to the original sauce...is the use of New Mexico Chile Peppers.

All backers will receive a 16 ounce bottle of my All Natural 'custom' sauce. It is fabulous on any meat, and even on grilled OR raw vegetables. I have some friends that use it as a Salad Dressing.

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Poppin' with a purpose. One kernel at a time.

Popped Culture is a social enterprise. We pop and sell sweet, artisan popcorn with unique flavor combinations to support youth development.

Each young POPerator gets paid to sell their popped products directly to customers, to businesses, and to shoppers online while they learn business and life skills through our POPrietary POP Academy.

With your help we can grow our impact throughout Pennsylvania.

Meet our POPrietor. The popcorn kid.

Mark R. Wieder, Esq. is the owner and sole POPrietor of Popped Culture. Mark left his career as an attorney to get things poppin' elsewhere! Leaving in search of passion and purpose in his life, he now helps local youths tackle the problems they face at home with the help of foreign concepts he learned abroad.

Popped Culture popcorn. Our popped products.

We pop and sell sweet, artisan popcorn with unique flavor combinations. Our tasty popcorn snacks come wrapped in pop art designed by local artists and adorned with witty, pop culture names like Godfather's Garlic Parm, Spicy Lime Hot Mess, Coconut Lime Baewatch, and American Apple Pie. (We hear Stiffler's mom approves.)

The POP Academy. More than popping and selling popcorn.

Our curriculum teaches students analytical, interpersonal, and leadership skills in a web-based forum. Mentor feedback on the job validates key employment traits meaning mentees graduate ready for thriving wage employment, a greater focus on continuing education, and the support they need to succeed in business.

Investing in opportunity youth between the ages of 14 and 24 unlocks an enormous potential for the economy while starting a ripple effect for future generations.

We set up the upcoming generation ready to enter the workplace with shoulder-to-shoulder skills that will land them in living-wage positions, reducing their likelihood for government assistance, or taking to the streets for additional income.

Growing POPerations. What we need.

Our goal is to raise $10,000 to put towards our growing POPerations.

This covers  a popcorn popper ($5,000), hand washing and dishwashing sinks plus install ($2,000), and a farmer's market style booth in Philadelphia ($3,000). Having built our first popcorn stand by hand, I know that this gives us the resources we need to build a bare bones place.

However, the more you donate, the more you can help make our space sweet with fun artwork and goodies.

Our stretch goal is $20,000. We'll use these proceeds to build a stand, and we'll work with Lancaster's local Amish community building a rockin', poppin' Amish popcorn buggy.

Our second stretch goal is $30,000, which will allow us to unlock an augment realty experience where our physical buggy, badges, and stands come to life digitally on your phone through an app.

We've put together a slew of fun, limited edition perks and a first release product to reach our goals.

Featuring: limited edition merchandise from local artists and artisans.

Our limited edition perks include a set of three 1.5 inch numbered enamel buttons; a pop art inspired t-shirt; and a signed, numbered, screen-printed-by-hand, color poster by local artist Stephen Michael Haas. Stephen developed our logo, painted an out-of-this-world mural at our stand, and adorned our trailer with "Popcorn Kisses."

Looking for an experience? Choose from creating a custom seasonal flavor with the help of our POP Staff; take a Tuktuk ride through Lancaster with 5 of your friends while talking to a refugee and snacking on popcorn; work with Stephen Haas on a custom piece of artwork; or get a private party with our poppin' buggy!

Last but not least, we're introducing kernel and spice kits with this campaign. Our POP Staff wants you to pop with a purpose at home just like they do. Each kit comes with our white butterfly popcorn from Lancaster County, four spice blends, and a how-to video so you can re-create popcorn fantasies at home.

You'll get popcorn kernels plus the following spices:

  1. Apple + Chai,
  2. Hibiscus,
  3. Garlic + Parsley + Lemon, and
  4. Cayenne Pepper + Crushed Red Pepper + Ancho Powder + Kaffir Lime + Cilantro.

Help us grow our impact.

We can't thank you enough for visiting our campaign page.

You can help improve the life of a child by supporting what we do.

During our two years in business we created dozens of unique flavors, worked with over 100 partners, donated more than 1700 bags of popcorn to students staying for after school care, and taken on two young mentees.

Support our campaign by sharing our story or making a financial contribution. With your help we could turn youth in Central Pennsylvania into a community of leaders with promising futures. Thank you!

--------

This crowdfunding campaign is part of The Great Social Enterprise Pitch, a friendly competition facilitated by ASSETS and the Lancaster County Community Foundation. The Pitch consists of social enterprise ideas based in Central Pennsylvania. A Social Enterprise is a market-based, income-generating enterprise that aims to solve a social and/or environmental problem through its business activities. Social enterprises focus on a trip bottom line: people, planet, and profit. Upon completion of the Crowdfunding phase of the competition, 5 ideas will be chosen to move on to the Live Pitch, during which the contestants will present their ideas to a panel of judges, with winners receiving a package of cash and pro-bono prizes. In 2017, winners received over $65,000 in cash and pro-bono prizes. Please visit www.lancasterpitch.com for more information. To access to the crowdfunding sites of all participating social enterprise ideas, click here: www.indiegogo.com/partners/SocialEnterprisePitch.

By contributing to this campaign, you give permission to this business and to ASSETS to collect and use your name, email address, and mailing address. Your information will not be sold or shared with other organizations. You may opt out of electronic communications by selecting the unsubscribe link and following instructions on any emails that you receive.

story:
What Is Hawaiian Icicles?

Our team wanted to bring a favorite island treat into something everyone could enjoy.  Yes, there are Tigers Blood and Coconut flavored frozen goods out there.  But we couldn't find one that tasted exactly like a delicious shaved Ice.  Which is why we import our syrup straight from the island of Honolulu, Hawaii.  Each popsicle is Handmade in a FDA Approved facility and shipped right to your door.  No pain of going to the store and carrying a huge box of popsicles.  We ship same day every time.

When Creating our popsicles we made sure of THREE things:

1. A delicious flavor that tastes exactly like a shaved ice from Hawaii

2.  An easy to eat non-messy product.

3.  High Quality Ice formula that is soft every single time.

 

About Us

Hunter & Supe both started their first companies in high school.  Hunter ran a Shaved Ice stand and Supe started his own sunglass brand selling online.  The two of them are well-known for their hard work and the fun culture they bring into other's lives.  

Both Hunter and Supe enjoy skiing.  Hunter enjoys boating and playing with his dogs brand new puppies:)  Supe loves to mountain bike and golf.  

Our goal with Hawaiian Icicles is not only to provide a dang good popsicle that people will love but, also a fun brand that people can relate and engage with.  We are both have taken a leave from our college studies to get this company off the ground.  Your donation will not only help us get you delicious popsicles but also help us move this company into the future and continue to do what we love.  

We can't express how grateful we are for every-single one of you for donating.  From both of us, Thank you!

What we need & What you get

We are raising $15,000 to go towards are manufacturing.  We currently do not have the supplies necessary to keep up with the multitudes of orders we are receiving.  People are LOVING our popsicles and that makes us so happy.  Yet, we would be able to offer quicker delivery times if we had the proper equipment.

Your donation gets you a box of our delicious popsicles at a DISCOUNTED PRICE!  We promise you will never have a bigger or better popsicle in your life.  We are so positive in the quality of our popsicles that if you were to not like them you can send us an email and get a full refund!

If all funding is not raised we will STILL SHIP OUT ALL POPSICLES.  We have the resources to still continue to ship popsicles.  Your delivery time may be pushed back though.

Why Hawaiian Icicles

Not only did we want to create a delicious product but also a fun and awesome brand!  Hawaiian Icicles has the best customer service and the most fun group of hard working people you will ever meet.  We are dedicated to making you happy and helping you smile with a delicious treat!

Our Worries

We are a 100% honest company.  Our current worries are that we are not going to be able to keep customers because our delivery times are so long.  We try our hardest day in and day out to make popsicles and keep up with the demand yet we cannot.  Your donation will help us get orders out the same day they are placed!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Honestly, any share by social media, email, or word of mouth is helpful.  Please just tell your friends and family to simply donate $5.  IndieGoGo has these awesome share links you can use:)

About Us
Hunter & Supe both started their first companies in high school.  Hunter ran a Shaved Ice stand and Supe started his own sunglass brand selling online.  The two of them are well-known for their hard work and the fun culture they bring into other's lives.  
Both Hunter and Supe enjoy skiing.  Hunter enjoys boating and playing with his dogs brand new puppies:)  Supe loves to mountain bike and golf.  
Our goal with Hawaiian Icicles is not only to provide a dang good popsicle that people will love but, also a fun brand that people can relate and engage with.  We are both have taken a leave from our college studies to get this company off the ground.  Your donation will not only help us get you delicious popsicles but also help us move this company into the future and continue to do what we love.  
We can't express how grateful we are for every-single one of you for donating.  From both of us, Thank you!

What we need & What you get
We are raising $15,000 to go towards are manufacturing.  We currently do not have the supplies necessary to keep up with the multitudes of orders we are receiving.  People are LOVING our popsicles and that makes us so happy.  Yet, we would be able to offer quicker delivery times if we had the proper equipment.
Your donation gets you a box of our delicious popsicles at a DISCOUNTED PRICE!  We promise you will never have a bigger or better popsicle in your life.  We are so positive in the quality of our popsicles that if you were to not like them you can send us an email and get a full refund!
If all funding is not raised we will STILL SHIP OUT ALL POPSICLES.  We have the resources to still continue to ship popsicles.  Your delivery time may be pushed back though.

Why Hawaiian Icicles
Not only did we want to create a delicious product but also a fun and awesome brand!  Hawaiian Icicles has the best customer service and the most fun group of hard working people you will ever meet.  We are dedicated to making you happy and helping you smile with a delicious treat!

Our Worries
We are a 100% honest company.  Our current worries are that we are not going to be able to keep customers because our delivery times are so long.  We try our hardest day in and day out to make popsicles and keep up with the demand yet we cannot.  Your donation will help us get orders out the same day they are placed!
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Honestly, any share by social media, email, or word of mouth is helpful.  Please just tell your friends and family to simply donate $5.  IndieGoGo has these awesome share links you can use:)

story:
Milk House Shakes is the proud winner of Sacramento's 2017 Calling All Dreamers Competition! 

Milk House Shakes will be more than just a milkshake shop. By combining unique and delicious shakes with fun merchandising and an engaging experience, my plan is to develop Milk House Shakes into a popular Sacramento destination. Playing on the proximity of the Capitol and the political nature of the city, Milk House Shakes has this unique opportunity to bridge the gap between our nation's past and Sacramento's present.

At its core, Milk House Shakes serves milkshakes named after US Presidents. For example, FDR is the Nutella shake because Nutella was created during Roosevelt's presidency in WWII by an Italian baker. Chocolate and sugar were heavily rationed so the baker added hazelnut paste to chocolate to make it last longer. The Warren G. Harding shake is a green tea shake during the spring and summer and the chai tea shake during the fall and winter. Harding was president in the early 1920s during the infamous Teapot Dome Scandal - considered the first big political scandal in US history. 

(Side note: As a big fan of the Drunk History skits, one of my dreams is to go on the show and talk about the Teapot Dome Scandal. It is so fascinating!)

Every donation will drive me closer to realizing my dream of being a small business owner in Downtown Sacramento. This funding campaign will take the current space from an empty shell to an inviting milkshake shop! Specifically it will help cover the build for such things as: plumbing, electrical, flooring, counters, cabinets and equipment. 

Every project has risks and challenges. Milk House Shakes is a new endeavor, it's not an expansion. However, the prize package of Calling All Dreamers includes resources and guidance from many talented and successful individuals that I can access when needed. Milk House Shakes is projected to open in early 2018.

A full list of shakes can be found at www.milkhouseshakes.com. Coffee beverages will also be served. Follow my journey on Instagram, FB or Twitter and see more weekly #FunFactFridays; because US History rocks, especially Abe Lincoln.

All funders will be listed on the website for at least one year. Every donation will drive me closer to realizing my dream of being a small business owner in Downtown Sacramento. Thank you very much for your support!

story:
Reinvigorating Luxuries as Fresh and Delicious as they should be...

The combination of Nature’s finest and most carefully sourced ingredients expressed in perfectly developed recipes of beverages that look luxurious, and taste delicious.

That’s the special collection of refreshing beverages that Ruvy is preparing in order to make your days feel fresh and taste wonderful!

From our Green Iced Tea proposition, which is made with premium Green Tea leaves, Ginseng and Honey, to our Pomegranate Cherry Juice, which combines the antioxidant powers and delightful fragrances of Pomegranate and Cherries, we are bringing a catalog of five juice flavors and five iced tea recipes for the uplifting moments that you deserve to enjoy!

The Freshest Answer to Everyday Problems

Everything looks better and lighter when you’re having a fresh juice or iced tea while you’re figuring out how to complete a complex project, or commuting under the asphyxiating heat of a hot summer afternoon, or simply getting a uniquely clean and uplifting kick of raw natural energy after a powerful session at the gym.

That’s at least how at Ruvy Beverages we see things: after all, the perfect blend of hot pressed carrots and oranges with a home-brew taste can do wonders for your days.

That’s why we’re working hard to bring you these extraordinary beverages that are obtained through an almost artistic production method: yes, we take your needs and the way a juice or an iced tea can satisfy them in a really serious way!

All About The Bottle?

As passionate creators of premium juices and iced teas, we’d like to think it isn’t all about the bottle. Yet, sadly, it would almost seem that it is… Let us explain. Yes, we have designed beautiful bottles with beautiful presentations that compliment the very special beverages that we will be offering. However, we would not think that bottles would become such a decisive part of our project.

The truth is that they have, though.You see, as a newly established startup, we are facing a strange dilemma: while we have an outstanding formulation for 5 different juice and 5 different iced tea beverages that promise to make you reeeally happy, and an existing and strong customer base across the world that is ready to purchase our products, the truth is that we can only start getting our beverages out on the market if we are able to make a big production run; yes! A picture may be worth a thousand words, but it doesn’t bring a thousand sales on its own…

The absurd element in this equation is that, while we already have a bottler to partner with in order to help us with the bottling part of the production, we found out that this bottling company (as all other bottling companies, actually) will not produce a small number of bottles – they only take large orders for mass-production.

So we are ready to start and get our juices and iced teas out, making people’s lives fresher, HAPPIER and better… but we need the capital SO to take a stronger step and immediately start a mass-production of our beverages that will then be used when the retailers that we’re in contact with receive our beverages and decide to place their larger orders.

At the same time, great pictures of our bottles and enticing descriptions of our beverages won’t get us far on their own and put them under the eyes of new potential retailers and new customers. Such is the situation that so many startups like us face … having a great product is perfect, but not having a way of making it known is unhelpful, to say the least.

So… we are now anticipating to raise $80,000 to fund our first mass production and the general bottling costs to take Ruvy beverages global… which is why we’re inviting you to:

  • Get early and special access to our juices and iced teas while also supporting our mass production by choosing one of the great rewards that we have on offer – including generous discount up to 60%! Along with amazing accessories to enjoy your beverages. 
  • Share this campaign on social media, as well as with your friends and family members who may also want to enjoy the quality of our premium juices and iced teas.
  • Become an early retailer of Ruvy Beverages, getting an extra special deal and becoming part of the history of a beverages company that literally has all the ingredients to become a global success story in the industry.

Thank you so much, and we hope to be soon shipping our amazing Fine Juices and Iced Teas!

story:
Hi. I’m Tom Lynch, founder of The Dinger Spirits. I’ve been in the wine and spirits business for 18 years, successfully making and marketing products and brands for others. From the first time I went back to Ireland and heard the story of my "Dinger Lynch" family, I knew one day I would make my own craft spirit, just like my family before me. That day is here, and my family and I need your help to launch The Dinger Poitín.

When I was told I was part of "The Dinger Lynchs," I asked where the name came from. As it was explained to me, back in the day in rural parts of County Clare, Ireland, if you’re the best at something, you were sometimes referred to as “The Dinger.” And that’s when I started to hear statements like, “Your people were the dinger at poitín-making,” and “Your family’s poitín was the dinger!”

Historical photo of rural poitín-makers.

It turns out poitín (pronounced po-cheen) is the name for the world’s first craft spirit – the original unaged whiskey first made in Ireland by monks nearly 1400 years ago. It was outlawed in 1661. Once outlawed, it was made illicitly by folks like those in my family and started to be called poitín after the small pot stills used (versus the very large stills used by the large, legal Irish whiskey companies). A lot of the poitín made that way was horrible, some of it even dangerous. But occasionally, in the hands of a skilled distiller, the poitín was amazing. And those poitín-makers became legendary - like my ancestors.

 

My daughter walking on the old Dinger Lynch farm in County Clare, Ireland

I’ve worked on this poitín for several years; learning about the history of how poitín was made, what grains were grown on and near our family farm, how Irish immigrants like my great-grandfather made poitín in America and elsewhere, what flavors and characteristics mixologists and whiskey-lovers most want in an unaged whiskey today. Mostly, I started working with some great distillers learning all I could about spirit-making. And now I’m ready.

This campaign is going to help my family turn our dream of restarting our family’s legacy into a reality.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our approach to making our craft spirits is a little different. We’re not building a distillery. There have been more than 1,000 new craft distilleries built in the last 10 years, and even with explosive growth in craft spirits sales, there is more distillation capacity than demand.

Rather than spending hundreds of thousands of dollars to build a distillery before we ever make a drop of whiskey, I have partnered with Independent Distilling Co, a medal-winning local distillery in Decatur, GA that has the perfect pot still for making poitín  - copper, hand-made, direct-fire heated, alembic head – a poitín-maker’s dream! They also have all the most modern spirit-making equipment (and licenses), so all the money we raise will go directly into buying the best ingredients, packaging and production.

The small, hand-made, direct-fire heated, alembic head pot still at Independent Distillers in Decatur, GA, where I'll make The Dinger (one of their modern, flat, open-top fermenters in the background).

That means every dollar helps us put the best poitín in the bottle and re-introduce The Dinger to the world with an awesome launch marketing campaign in early 2020 (well, ok, just our home state of Georgia at first…).

As a spirits-maker, poitín is exciting because unlike most other spirits, there are very few restrictions due to it being made from nearly anything for hundreds of years. We will only use ingredients and techniques that were readily available in the late 1800s, but do it on modern equipment with an eye towards modern tastes.

We’re NOT making a whiskey that requires many years in a barrel to be great. Great poitín is rich, smooth, flavorful and delicious right off the still. It means we have the freedom to make an unaged spirit unlike any other. One that can be loaded with rich character and delicious flavors. A whiskey that can become legendary.

Specifically, we need to raise enough money to be able to distill our first run, print labels, buy bottles and closures and cases, and print marketing materials. Every dollar we raise helps all of that be bigger and better.

 

Perks

We’ve got some unique and fun perks for you that you will love whether you are a fan of whiskey, Ireland, or just big dreamers. They include:

Shirt and Flask – A package that includes a unique The Dinger shirt, and a branded flask.

Private Launch Party Access – Access for two to our private launch party in early 2020 where we’ll pour the first bottling of The Dinger, mix poitín cocktails, have Irish music and, well, lots of the craic.

Visit us for our monthly tastings and cocktail-making lessons – One year’s access to monthly tastings and cocktail-making lessons (including vouchers for 2 cocktails/month).

Our buddy and cocktail expert, Casey.

Help us bottle, get a bottle – A select few will be able to help us bottle and label our first run of The Dinger, and a voucher for a signed bottle of poitín you just helped finish.

Back label of The Dinger Poitin, me about to sign it.

Your Personal Barrel – You’ll receive your own 2-liter barrel, and a voucher good for one filling of the barrel with 2 liters of The Dinger Poitín. Pour it off as you want, age it as much as you like. In essence, you’ll be making your very own version of The Dinger aged whiskey from The Dinger Poitín.

Your own 2-liter barrel full of The Dinger Poitin for you to age and pour as you like.

Distiller For The Day – Up to five people will be able to be the “distiller for the day,” which means you’ll be in the distillery, sleeves rolled up, helping to make The Dinger. And when that batch goes into the bottle, your name will be printed on the back label as a distiller, and we’ll give you a voucher for a  case of it to proudly share with family and friends.

Whether we're fermenting or distilling on the day you're here, you'll be hands-on, actually learning and helping make poitín. Then get a voucher for a case of the poitín you helped make, with your name printed on the back, listed as a guest distiller.

 

White-to-Brown 13 bottle vertical) – We've never heard of anyone doing this, so... We are going to set aside a full barrel of The Dinger Poitín for aging into a two-year-old whiskey. Ten people will get a voucher for a bottle of the original unaged poitín, then every two months for two years we will pull ten more bottles out and send them to you. At the end of two years you will have 13 bottles – the last will be our first-ever 2-year aged The Dinger Whiskey, and the others will be a vertical collection of the entire process from fresh out of the still until it is aged. We’ve never seen anything like this and think it is a rare and very cool way to experience a spirit.

A Guided Trip To County Clare – I will fly up to four people to Ireland (2 couples), provide accommodations and be your personal tour guide around County Clare where we’ll visit the old Dinger Lynch farm, see the charming market towns of Ennis, Doolin, Lahinch and others, visit the Cliffs of Mohr, the Burren, ancient ruins, and have plenty of local music, Guinness and of course, mighty craic. Four days, three nights accommodations plus transportation. Our flight to Ireland will leave from Boston or NY. Meals and drinks are your own, and you can extend as long as you like.

A photo I took on my last visit to the Cliff's of Mohr.

 

The Importance Of Your Contribution

Imagine going back to where your family immigrated from, hoping to learn some facts or maybe a story or two, and rather, being given the gift of a legacy. My family made poitín so well that they not only earned a nickname for it, but the name and the legend of how good they were at their craft survived for more than 100 years after they left Ireland for America.

Imagine you’ve made a career of working in the same business as your family’s legacy and imagine having the chance to take all you’ve learned to once again bring to life that reputation for making the best.

I know you like helping dreams come true. That means helping fund not just great, big, cool dreams, but funding those that have a real chance of succeeding. Those run by people with a track record of success. I’ve done this many times for other companies. This time it will be my own, my family’s.

With your help, my family and I can do it.

 

Risks & Challenges

There are risks, as with every new company, including these main ones:

  • Craft distillery saturation. There are over 1,000 new small distilleries built in the last 10 years. There is a lot of competition. However, because we’re not building a distillery, we won’t start the business highly leveraged or deep in debt before we ever make the first bottle. That means every dollar is going right into quality ingredients, the best production, and great marketing that will set us apart and help us stand out.
  • Poitín is a new type of spirit to most consumers. We are entering a new, small but fast-growing category that requires some education. Luckily, I have done this dozens of times with spirits and wines for some very successful companies and have learned a lot from those experiences. I know how to do the work required to raise awareness and create demand.
  • Getting the spirit to consumers. Alcohol beverage distribution is very complex and difficult. Most people who start making a craft spirit struggle getting it to consumers. It will be difficult for us too, but I have great connections and contacts and have worked in the business for 18 years. We have a better chance than most to actually be able to sell enough of our spirit to be successful.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thanks for reading this.

Please tell all your whiskey-loving, cocktail-loving, Ireland-loving, Decatur, Atlanta, or Georgia-loving family and friends about this campaign and the perks, and ask them to consider contributing.

Post to social media using the hashtage #poitín, #whiskey, #crowdfunding, #DecaturGA, #Atlanta, #ATL, #GeorgiaMade #slainte and be sure to tag us at:

Instagram: @TheDingerPoitín

Twitter: @DingerPoitín

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/TheDingerPoitin/

Thank you.

Slainte!

Meals and drinks are your own, and you can extend as long as you like.A photo I took on my last visit to the Cliff's of Mohr. The Importance Of Your ContributionImagine going back to where your family immigrated from, hoping to learn some facts or maybe a story or two, and rather, being given the gift of a legacy. My family made poitín so well that they not only earned a nickname for it, but the name and the legend of how good they were at their craft survived for more than 100 years after they left Ireland for America.Imagine you’ve made a career of working in the same business as your family’s legacy and imagine having the chance to take all you’ve learned to once again bring to life that reputation for making the best.I know you like helping dreams come true. That means helping fund not just great, big, cool dreams, but funding those that have a real chance of succeeding. Those run by people with a track record of success. I’ve done this many times for other companies. This time it will be my own, my family’s.With your help, my family and I can do it. Risks & ChallengesThere are risks, as with every new company, including these main ones:
Craft distillery saturation. There are over 1,000 new small distilleries built in the last 10 years. There is a lot of competition. However, because we’re not building a distillery, we won’t start the business highly leveraged or deep in debt before we ever make the first bottle. That means every dollar is going right into quality ingredients, the best production, and great marketing that will set us apart and help us stand out.
Poitín is a new type of spirit to most consumers. We are entering a new, small but fast-growing category that requires some education. Luckily, I have done this dozens of times with spirits and wines for some very successful companies and have learned a lot from those experiences. I know how to do the work required to raise awareness and create demand.
Getting the spirit to consumers. Alcohol beverage distribution is very complex and difficult. Most people who start making a craft spirit struggle getting it to consumers. It will be difficult for us too, but I have great connections and contacts and have worked in the business for 18 years. We have a better chance than most to actually be able to sell enough of our spirit to be successful.
 Other Ways You Can HelpThanks for reading this.Please tell all your whiskey-loving, cocktail-loving, Ireland-loving, Decatur, Atlanta, or Georgia-loving family and friends about this campaign and the perks, and ask them to consider contributing.Post to social media using the hashtage #poitín, #whiskey, #crowdfunding, #DecaturGA, #Atlanta, #ATL, #GeorgiaMade #slainte and be sure to tag us at:Instagram: @TheDingerPoitínTwitter: @DingerPoitínFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/TheDingerPoitin/Thank you.Slainte!

story:
Our Story

My wife Kayla and I formed Harbinger Beer Company in 2017 after purchasing two old store fronts in Downtown Caddo, Ok.  It was an easy decision for us to restore these old buildings instead of starting from scratch.  We love to breath new life into anything we can restore and these buildings needed and still need a lot of TLC.  This is not only about having a building to house our business, but just as much about revitalizing Downtown Caddo.  With your contribution we will do great things.

You can watch us in the video above as we gather bricks for this campaign nearly two years ago as we were prepping for construction.  You can see where we started and the shape of our building at the time. The overlay image before the video is of the taproom a few months ago. See other photos of our renovation on our facebook page here https://www.facebook.com/harbingerbeer/

What We Need & What You Get

We would like to reach a goal of $7500 to put toward finishing out our taproom and outdoor sitting area at the front of the building.  The town of Caddo has given us permission to extend 7ft onto the sidewalk for our covered outdoor seating and rod iron fencing.  To meet our goal of $7500 we only need 150 contributor at $50, and we have way more bricks than that ready for the engraver.

With your contribution of $50 you will receive an engraved brick that will go into the construction of the taproom and columns of the outdoor sitting area.  Space is limited, but we would like to see names on every brick!  The engraved brick can have up to two names and  or family name.  In memory of bricks are also welcome. Let us bring Caddo back to life one brick at a time.

Once we get rolling, Brick in the Wall members will also be included in special exclusive deals in the taproom as they are announced.  Not only do you get to be a part of the brick and mortar (literally) but you can get a return on investment through taproom savings, so don't miss this opportunity!

We would love to meet or exceed this goal. Any overages will stay in the construction fund and will be used on outward facing public areas of our property to beautify the town.

The Impact

We hope that we can impact others and they too can see the beauty of these historic buildings and possibly encourage other businesses or individuals to take advantage and bring other buildings back to life.

Risks & Challenges

We have met many challenges on our journey to open our nano-brewery, but none that we could not overcome.  If we do not reach or exceed our goal, the funds that are raised will still be used in construction moving forward.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute at this time, please share our story to help us spread the word.  That is a contribution in itself and we thank you.
