story:
The ScentedSilicone Journey – taking the next step with the Chocit Anticrave Band!

The Chocit AntiCrave Band showcases the possibilities of ‘ScentedSilicone’, a bespoke, odourless silicone that we work our magic on to fill with fragrance. We can encapsulate any fragrance, cleanly and without chemical undertones, and then mould it into amazing, fragranced products. The fragrance lasts and lasts and the possibilities are pretty much endless. We’d like your help to develop those possibilities, creating jobs and developing skills along the way.

This is the journey –come along with us!

A bit about us and ScentedSilicone!

Ben Giles and Sid Madge have been business partners for about 4 years now. Ben lives in Cardigan on the west coast of Wales and Sid Lives in Bala, North Wales.

Ben Giles
Creator and Managing Director

Ben is an entrepreneur and a science geek at heart. He developed the innovative 'ScentedSilicone' as a solution to the fleeting nature of beautiful but ultimately expensive fragrances. It took him two years to do some initial groundwork and then teamed up with Sid Madge to develop the idea further. A bespoke odourless silicone and the technology to encapsulate any fragrance within it - it’s taken a while but boy, it’s been worth the wait. 

Sid Madge

Marketing & Creative Director

As a marketing and creative guru, Sid immediately saw the commercial avenues that would make ScentedSilicone a worldwide fragrance phenomenon and success. He teamed up with Ben to develop ScentedSilicone into a completed product, ready for market entry, and then devised the tactics that would launch ScentedSilicone to the rest of the world.

The next stage of the journey

Having developed the concept of ScentedSilicone, we spoke to many great people involved in silicone, perfume, fragrance and merchandise. Our discussions across those industries have confirmed our belief that this is a fabulous concept. To take ScentedSilicone to the next stage of its journey, we have been searching for a product that will show off the quality and potential of what we have created, and at the same time have a positive effect in our communities – and we’ve found it! 

We became aware of some research carried out at St George's Hospital, London, which indicates that the fragrance of vanilla can reduce the craving for chocolate by up to 50%. This sparked our idea to use our technology to produce a wristband to help support people trying to lose weight. 

Encapsulating the rich, warm fragrance of Tahitian vanilla into our odourless silicone: the Chocit Anticrave Band was born.


Top 3 Scents by the Scent Marketing Institute/SCENTtrends

  1. Feel safe, secure and nostalgic: Talcum powder
  2. Be more alert: Peppermint, citrus
  3. Relax: Lavender, vanilla, chamomile - Dawn Goldworm 12:29

What We Need & What You Get

It's the norm that silicone items like this are made in Asia. We have tried hard to go against this tide, and bring manufacturing and jobs closer to home. Our fragrance oil is sourced in the UK, the special bit where we turn the pure fragrance oil into a powder to be encapsulated into the silicone is carried out in the UK and even the amazing odourless silicone we have created is made in the UK!!  However, we still have to send everything over to the Far East to have the final product manufactured from all the component parts that we create here in the UK.

We want to bring the manufacturing of our products back to the UK – if possible back to Wales. We want to be able to buy moulds and machinery and train local people here, in the UK, to make our great products and then send them out across the globe.


$10,000 will enable us to purchase a press and a couple of moulds and to employ and train one person to operate the machinery and help us make our ScentedSilicone products! With all the ideas we have – from iPhone covers smelling of apples (what else?) to clothing tags fragranced with the in-store brand perfume – we’re hoping we can employ more than one person too!

As we have worked on ScentedSilicone, we have become aware of a huge – almost endless – number of applications and uses for the product: from merchandising and marketing to more serious hygiene and medical applications – anti-stress and anti-anxiety products, and we are even in the early stages of developing a band to help Alzheimers sufferers. We are looking to raise funds to develop these avenues 


We need your support and your money – what do you get?

Well, we’re really, really excited about our Chocit Anticrave Band – and the possibilities it offers to support people trying to lose weight or who simply want to reduce the amount of chocolate and sugar in their diet.

The Chocit Anti-Crave Band is also the first ScentedSilicone product to go into production, so we’re offering our Indiegogo supporters the chance to be the first people to get their hands on it. Not only that, but choose our ‘Chocit bonus perk’ and in addition to receiving a fab Chocit Band, you will be one of only 1000 in the world to receive 2 limited edition ScentedSilicone ‘For Him’ and ‘For Her’ wristbands encapsulating perfumes we have been working on with a great fragrance house for the past 2 years. They smell amazing, and our technology means that the fragrance is pure and will last and last! We’ve also designed perks to share with your family or friends, or even your workplace, gym or diet club.

Risks & Challenges

Bringing a new product to market always has risks and challenges to be overcome, but we’re already a long way down the road and can  show results from our hard work. We've worked out why 'off the shelf' silicone doesn't work as a fragrance carrier. We’ve developed a bespoke, odourless silicone that allows for scent to be stable, and slowly released over months, if not years, untainted by any nasty chemical undertones. We’ve sourced the best pure fragrance oils to use in our silicone, and our prototypes work. We’ve built up a great team and have travelled internationally to confirm there is a market for our products. We can demonstrate the resilience and effectiveness of both our business and our product at overcoming challenges and the risks that we've already encountered and will continue to meet any new challenges in the same way: head on!

The Impact

Your contribution will help us here at ScentedSilicone bring manufacturing back to the UK, offering new possibilities for skills training and employment. It will also allow us to continue working to explore and develop the possibilities that ScentedSilicone offers. By supporting us, you will be part of that journey by being among the first to own a ScentedSilicone product – the Chocit AntiCrave Band. You can be an ambassador, empowered on your own journey to resist cravings for chocolate, reducing your sugar intake and helping you lose weight. The Chocit Band smells so good that even if you aren't looking to lose weight, you will benefit from the sense of wellbeing that the rich vanilla fragrance brings.

There are so many amazing possibilities for ScentedSilicone – you can be there on the journey with us, and help us realise them!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't feel you can contribute, please help us by spreading the word. Tell your friends, their friends and friends of their friends!! Make some noise for us wherever you live and on whatever social platform you use each day. Please follow us on Twitter, Facebook, Pinterest, Linkedin, and Google+. We are confident there will be other platforms introduced before this reaches you ... so if we have missed any - use them too!! 

Blog, talk, shout, sing about ScentedSilicone and the Chocit Anticrave Band!

And if you think of an amazing idea for ScentedSilicone, get in touch - we'd love to hear about it!

story:
Ralvin Ciders is made up of husband and wife duo, Shea and Mark Germany. We have a passion for all things craft beverage and the stories behind them. Cider has become our specialty- here's how:
 

In 2016, Mark left his 16 year retail management career to pursue his and our dream of opening a winery and vineyard. Half way through our Enology and Viticulture training we noticed a hole in the industry. We looked at each other and said, "Hey! Where's all the cider?" Thus, our baby Ralvin Ciders was born. We could not believe the lack of cider circulating through Texas and much of the United States and we knew this would be our "in". 

Since that AH-HA moment we have been tinkering around with several recipes and have made big, bold, and unique hard apple ciders- something we have not found anywhere else. We want to bring this cider to Lil'd-- Denton, Texas. There are no other cideries in Denton and no other people like Dentonites. The fun-loving and genuine people that call Denton home is what has drawn us here to stay. 

 

 

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

We'll be playing the waiting game right there along with you. It's no secret that the licensing process takes several months so we know that we likely won't be delivering or selling alcohol products until 2019. However, in the meantime with this first round (and later, round two + three) we will be able to establish ourselves even more firmly within our community, build camaraderie, demo our space, and prep for the glorious day that we receive our permits!

No money? 

We sincerely thank everyone who is able to contribute financially. Seriously, crowd-funding is the biggest and scariest step to this whole process! We know that making a donation is not a reality for everyone so if you can't claim a perk then do us a solid and share our campaign on social media or come to one of our events!

story:
About OddPitch Brewing

Gabe Stinchfield has been in the craft beer industry for nearly a decade.  Starting in retail, then bartending, then management, as well as sales and marketing for distributorships and breweries.  He also began home-brewing around the same time, which sparked his desire to open a brewery.  Six years ago he began the plans for OddPitch Brewing and has been focused on it ever since.

Including Gabe, OddPitch Brewing consists of an incredibly talented group of people.  Our Queen and General Manager, Kendra Bell, has an extensive background in customer service and management.  She's the reason the place will still be standing at the end of the day, the walls are just for show.  We have a very talented brewer, Jake "Tranquility Blouse" Principe, who will be joining the team as we get closer to opening our doors. 

This campaign is the last step in making the dream of OddPitch Brewing a reality.  When the campaign concludes we will finalize on a location for the brewery and begin renovating as well as ordering equipment.  It's been a dream for ten years, a hope for six, and finally it's a reality today.

 

What's It To You and What Do We Get?

For this campaign we are looking to reach a goal of $20,000.  In addition to the money currently raised through investments from friends and family, this funding will allow us to finalize our loan process.  Once finalized, we will use the money we raise here to purchase fermentation vessels and oak barrels.  Anything left over will go directly in to creating a comfortable, welcoming and seriously awesome tap room.

As far as what you get:  the goods.  The treasures!  We are offering a tasty list of perks as our way of saying "Thank you for being so insanely, incredibly, fantastically amazing to us!"  There are several perks that need some explanation and this is where those details are found.  (Please keep in mind that merchandise is subject to slight changes from the pictures.  However, we have every intention of providing quality, comfortable merchandise.  Because, well, it's merch with our logo and we want you to love it as much as we do!)

If you aren't interested in any perks but would like to back the project, check out the "Back It" button just to the right of the video above.

 

THE ODDFELLOWS

  • Check out our website for more details: OddPitch Website
  • The OddFellows are a small group of OddPitch super fans!  Memberships provide individuals with discounted beer and merchandise as well as exclusive access to parties and bottle releases. 
  • This campaign is currently the only way to become a member of The OddFellows.  Any remaining memberships will become available as we near our opening date.
  • Unfortunately, laws prohibit us from shipping alcohol from the brewery.  However, we are happy to hold any bottles for members for a limited amount of time.
  • Price for The OddFellows memberships is for One Year (365 days).  Duration of membership will start within two months of us opening.  Your benefits will begin the first day we are open. 
  • You must be 21+ to be a member of The OddFellows.

SPONSOR A BARREL

  • Your Name/Business Name/Family Crest/Art will be branded (somehow) on to one of the barrels we use to house beer.  We'll work with you to pick a design and method that will be presented on the barrel forever.
  • These barrels will be displayed (and utilized) in our tasting room.
  • Under no circumstance will the barrels bare anything racist, sexist or otherwise degrading and/or completely uncool to your fellow humans.  You don't bring that in to our house.

HANG W/SCOTT PARKER FROM THE LIL SMOKIES

  • Pretty straight forward.  You and Scott will hang out for the evening and in to the night.  If you're happy waiting we'd love for the brewery to be open so you can start your adventure there!
  • All expenses paid.
  • We have nothing planned.  We'll let you and Scott figure out the details if you prefer.  Seriously, movie, concert, sushi, arcade games?  Sit around and listen to his collection of weird, ambient folk metal?  As long as you have an awesome time!
  • Transportation to Missoula, MT not provided.

BREW YOUR BEER

  • Exactly.  Come brew/blend a beer with us!  You and the production team will discuss a beer to brew and make it happen.  We'd prefer to do something that we could package so we can immortalize you on the label, but we're open to suggestions!
  • Once ready for packaging, we'll work on a name and a sweet label for the beer.  We'll also make sure you get a good stock of it.
  • Name and label will once again follow our standards of nothing racist, sexist, degrading and/or being uncool.  Seriously, not in our house.
  • You must be 21+ for this perk. 
  • We do not provide transportation to Missoula or lodging during your stay.  But heck yas queen we'll pick you up at the airport or your hotel if needed!

ULTIMATE FAN PACKAGE

  • This is going to be awesome!  Gabe's dad, The Rhyno, will drive you, a friend/loved one and the OddPitch Brewing crew around Western Montana for a couple days.  We're going to drink, eat and have a super rad time.
  • We'll set up brewery tours.  Maybe do some Go Karting!  Really, it's your party, we're just invited.
  • Yes, you must be 21+ for this perk.

 

*Some perks or parts of perks may not be available until the brewery is open and operating.  We will ship everything we can, as fast as we can and we sincerely appreciate your patience on the rest.

 

Bonus Stuff!

There are two things we want to do for you during this campaign.  Not only as a thank you for contributing, but because we thought it'd be motivating, and honestly, really funny.

1. Wizard Staff Event - As a mid-campaign motivator, Gabe and Kendra will be filming a Wizard Staff montage.  For those of you unfamiliar with what a Wizard Staff is please reference Wikipedia.  By the end of week two of the campaign, for every $1k that has been funded we will each drink a beer and make our Wizard Staff.  We will document this event and provide you with, what we think will be, a very entertaining short video.

2. Reach $13,579 - It's all Odd numbers!  Get it?!  Whichever one of you incredibly awesome supporters gets us to $13,579 (or puts us over that mark) will receive a very special bonus along with the perk you choose.

3. You Really Like Us! - We are offering a special treat to our followers and likers!  If you are Like #300 on Facebook or Follower #400 on Instagram you'll join us (once we are open) for a private tour and tasting of the brewery.  Already Like/Follow us?  If you are the person who suggested us to the winner they can bring you along!

 

What More Can I Do?

Shalikeascribe (Share, Like, Subscribe)!  Share this campaign with everyone you know!  Like us on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter!  Subscribe to our newsletter on our website!  Share!  Share!  Share!

 

                               

 

Thank you so very much for taking the time to read about us and our vision.  This truly is everything to us and we know it's going to be amazing.  Through passion, experience and hard work, there isn't any doubt that we can provide Missoula, Montana, and the World with delicious beer and an exciting brewery adventure!  CHEERS!

story:
Growing up I would pull up a chair to my Grammy's kitchen and watch her bake cakes, pies, and cobblers. This is one of the main reason's I love to bake. Watching her put love into each treat and then watching everyone's faces light up with each bite was like magic to me. This is what sparked my love for baking. What was once a hobby has now become a major part of my life and this campaign will allow me to become free of the many restrictions I have baking from my home kitchen. 

I am needing $15,000 to purchase a small plot of land and build a shop. $15,000 will not cover the entire cost but, it will allow me to start the project. By opening this shop I will be able to take more orders and share my joy of baking with even more people. It has always been my dream to have a full bakery and this is my gateway to doing that.

Right now there are no cake shops or bakeries in my area beside the local grocery store and none that offer the custom treats that I make. My shop will save many people the drive to the outside cities to get a decent sweet treat. I have gone from one or two orders a month to six or more most weekends in just a years time. I take pride in being able to offer delicious and beautiful treats at prices that don't break the bank. Many of the families in my town and surrounding areas simply cannot afford a $200 cake. I keep my prices affordable while putting out quality products, and still making a profit. I am sure I will never become a millionaire from my baking but the joy I get with each order is worth much more! 

There are times where business is just not as constant as other times of the year. I plan to get contracts with local and surrounding businesses to ensure that I have some type of order coming through at all times. I also plan to put back a percentage of each paid order to cover those "dry" periods so that Nummees stays afloat at all times. 

No matter the amount, $20, $10, $5, or $1 every penny helps. When I grow, it benefits myself and the community. This shop can create jobs, and opportunities for many people.  Please share my campaign so that the words gets around to everyone! 

And most importantly THANK YOU for believing in me and my dream.

Watching her put love into each treat and then watching everyone's faces light up with each bite was like magic to me. This is what sparked my love for baking. What was once a hobby has now become a major part of my life and this campaign will allow me to become free of the many restrictions I have baking from my home kitchen. I am needing $15,000 to purchase a small plot of land and build a shop. $15,000 will not cover the entire cost but, it will allow me to start the project. story:
Who we are & what we're about

Hi we are Shannon/mom/mums and Lia/daughter/dots We are a mother-daughter baking duo with a vision to bring an upscale yet cozy atmosphere to the downtown district of our charming hometown with pies and goodies like grandma used to make, with a twist; with a modern yet eclectic feel. We both have a history in food service and creative arts and feel it's time to branch out on our own. We're two quirky, caring women who have a love for daring flavor combinations and a heart for serving others.

Our goal is to create a warm and welcoming place for a sweet date night, to kick back with friends, or that familiar place open late that lets you unwind after work. We want to impact our community one happy tummy at a time. Our town is lacking a hang out spot where people can walk right in and feel like one of the family. We plan on filling that need. We're a social bunch with the culinary and customer service skills to drive success and embellish our downtown fairway.

We have the recipes, ingenuity, drive and determination. We'll feature many classic pies, several new creations and even pot and shepherds pies. We also will have sweet breads and cupcakes. (a little something for everyone) What YOU our contributors would do for us is bring this from a dream into a reality. We have a plan without enough capital and a vision without enough resources. We don't need much, and the amount may seem very little to many but it's just barely out of reach for us. It truly would be the beginning of so much more than just one storefront, it would be the first step for we business women with dreams of owning an even larger business in the future. Here's to great beginnings. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking to raise at least $2,000. This is a low, make-it-work, bare bones figure, our real hope is more towards $10,000. The $2,000 would cover the permits, licensing, legal fees, and other potential unknowns. We already have a commercial ice maker and espresso machine, part of our need is to have a commercial contractor move a water line, other than that the space is move-in ready. We don't have huge needs as we have been collecting items for the shop over time, but a bit more money to take care of legal fees, licensing, and permits is our really big need. And to ensure the longevity of our business in our town, any funds raised beyond our base $2,000 will be saved and used wisely as the need arises.

Incentives and Perks

Let's talk incentives! As if it isn't reward enough just knowing you've helped bring to life something wonderful, we're happy to offer an incentive for you. Contributions in any amount would be very welcome of course. When you donate you have the option of redeeming your perk, so please indicate.

Even if we don't reach our full campaign goal, we will STILL use every bit of your contributions to make this dream a reality. We REALLY want to make our goal since the % we'll receive when we do is significantly greater. But if we don't... Plans may need to be shifted, dates altered, long hours will be put in, but we are determined. There will be pie!

The Impact

In our previous campaign we shared videos and interviews, where folks here in town talk about not having any place to go and hang out, we know we will be the remedy for this.

We as a family are social people with a heart for hospitality. As servers, we have dealt with the public, building friendships with the many people we come in contact with. We look forward to doing this in an even greater way in our own place, in our own town.

Imagine a quaint, charming, converted home with a cobblestone back patio twinkle-lit for summer evenings filled with the warm comforting aroma of freshly baked pie and the rich aroma of gourmet coffee. This is the dream that you can help breathe life into. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone has the means to contribute financially, but we all know that any good business (or campaign) sees greater success when we use word of mouth. If you believe in this campaign we would love for you to show us around, talk us up, help us reach (and even exceed) our target goal.

Please remember you can use the Indiegogo share tools! Facebook, twitter, or post it to all your contacts in your email address book. (wishful thinking on our part, we know. But it never hurts to ask.)

Thanks for checking us out, stay sweet!
Shannon and Lia

story:
Can you help Imad's Syrian Kitchen create a permanent home in London?

Since Imad fled Syria in 2015, he has cooked for refugees on the streets of Calais and provided free falafel for anyone who can't afford it at his pop-ups in London. He’s also raised almost £200k for Choose Love, keeping a children's hospital running for six months and helping buy food and other essentials for refugees in the Middle East.  

Imad has brought joy to hearts and stomachs everywhere. His warmth, hospitality and delicious food are now ready to have a permanent home in Central London. He just needs a boost to get himself set up. 

In Imad's own true style, he’s committed to donating every pound you invest in him back to Choose Love, once the restaurant is up and running. He'll do this by donating £1 from every bill, and by hosting fundraising supper clubs. 

Once open, Imad's Syrian Kitchen will serve a selection of Syrian mezze, including his famous falafel, as well as main and sharing dishes such as: Fattet Macdous, Crispy baby aubergine stuffed with lamb, topped with crunchy flatbread and a garlic cumin sauce; Watermelon, Halloumi and Za’atar Salad; Hamsit Lahem, slow cooked marinated lamb shoulder; Anginaar, roasted artichoke, stuffed with vegetables and much, much more! 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise 50k to get the restaurant up and running! The money raised will be spent on buying two new fridges, falafel fryers, dishwashers, tables, chairs - and everything else we need in order to open our doors to host our lovely customers! There is no minimum donation and every penny donated to this campaign will be donated back to Choose Love by Imad once his restaurant is up and running. 

We have a list of perks we are offering for set donation amounts - which range from a 3 course meal with drinks included to private supper clubs. 

Risks & Challenges

We acknowledge the risks and uncertainty associated with COVID-19 and we will adhere to up-to-date advice and guidelines as set out by the UK Government when we open our doors. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this page and give what you can to make sure this remarkable man and phenomenally gifted chef can bring his magic to Central London. 

THANK YOU!

story:
You can order Enrich kits by selecting the perks. Estimated delivery is 12/18-01/19

Enrich is an innovatively designed, farm to table experience that revolutionizes how fresh food is grown indoors.

Our experience is the easiest indoor gardening solution on the market, and it is 16X less than our competition. This isn't a $250+ hydroponic paperweight.

While other companies are busy reinventing the wheel, we set out on working with mother nature to create a truly organic experience that is fun and convenient.

All you have to do is buy an Enrich Kit and scan it with our mobile app. After that, our growing algorithm will send you reminders on when to water and how much.

Our Enrich Kits aren't some complicated piece of technology. It isn't hydroponics. It's the way it's been done for thousands of years just made simpler. 

Our Enrich kits come with 12oz of organic soil packed with the right chemical balance to ensure maximum growth without harmful chemicals.

Our seeds are Non-GMO and 100% organic sourced.

Only $15

Living a healthy lifestyle shouldn't cost you an arm and a leg. We set out on creating an affordable experience for all demographics to enjoy truly fresh foods. You can cultivate up to 4X getting multiple uses out of one Enrich kits.

All in One

Our grow kits have everything you need to start growing your own food. You don't have to worry about making a trip to your local DIY store and grabbing a 20lbs pound of dirt. You can grow your food directly in our packaging!

Non-GMO & Organic

100% Organic & non-GMO seeds. Supplied by a reliable and responsible source. We understand the importance of clean food and are focused on delivering a safe solution.

Scan and Grow

Scan our Enrich Kits directly into our Mobile app and from there it will load into a virtual garden. After that, you're all set. We will start sending you reminders on it's watering needs amongst other things.

Grow Anywhere

Our solution is catered to fit in almost any environment. We won't take up your entire counter compared to the other guys. Enrich kits need a minimum of 3hrs of sunlight daily in order to properly grow. You don't have to worry about a messy garden. Our containers don’t leak any water.  Our kits can fit perfectly in any part of your home. 

Unique and Innovative

Our products use fresh organic loose topsoil. Forget about those dried pellets the other guys use. Our packaging not only looks cool but keeps the soil fresh and moist so it's ready to get to work when it shows up to your door. 

American Made & Veteran Owned

Our kits are 100% American made and produced. As a veteran-owned company, we are focused on providing a great product, at a great price, in the most patriotic way possible.

We set out on creating a fun and convenient experience for growing your own food.

Our mobile app not only simplifies the process but creates a platform focused on collaboration with fellow gardeners. 

Virtual Garden

Your virtual garden will house all of your Enrich Kits. You can manage your whole garden from a remote location. 

Recipe Builder

Create and share recipes with friends and family in-app and on other social media platforms. Use our kits to create fun and healthy meals! 

Community Social Media

We've incorporated a social network to allow you to contribute with gardeners around the country. Gardening is all about collaboration and our app removes geographic restrictions. 

One-Click Shop

Ready to purchase more Enrich kits? No need to visit the website. We've incorporated a one-click market into the app so you can always quickly replenish your garden without running to the store. 

Proprietary Algorithm

Once the Enrich kit is scanned, You’ll be asked a couple questions and after that...boom! We’ve developed a growing algorithm to send you reminders on when to water your kits.

 

1. Minimal Access to fresh foods. 

Grow anywhere indoors with our all in one grow kit. 

2. Our children are not educated on how to grow their own food.

Grow one Give one is focused on inspiring our youth to eat healthily.

3. Urban farms have an environmental impact with fertilizer runoff. 

Our kits are grown indoors and have no runoff.

4. Some farms use harmful chemicals to make their plants grow faster and appear more “green”.

Enrich kits are committed to being Non-GMO and Organic. We aren’t cutting corners like the other guys.

​

Enrich Supporter ($15)

1 Enrich Kit

Closed Beta Invite

Enrich Bronze Badge added to your profile on the Enrich mobile app.

Recognition on website & social media once the campaign is over.

Enrich Memeber ($30)

2 Enrich Kits

Closed Beta Invite

Enrich Silver Badge added to your profile on the Enrich mobile app.

Recognition on the website & social media once the campaign is over.

Enrich Enthusiast ($45)

3 Enrich Kits

Closed Beta Invite

Enrich Gold Badge added to your profile on the Enrich mobile app.

Recognition on the website & social media once the campaign is over.

Name shown on our social media banners.

Enrich Super Fan ($60)

4 Enrich Kits

Closed Beta Invite

Enrich Platinum Badge added to your profile on the Enrich mobile app.

Recognition on the website & social media once the campaign is over.

Name shown on our social media banners.

Enrich Master Gardner ($75)

5 Enrich Kits

Closed Beta Invite

Enrich Green badge added to your profile on the Enrich mobile app.

Recognition on the website & social media once the campaign is over.

Name shown on our social media banners.

Enrich Founder ($100+)

5 Enrich Kits

Closed Beta Invite

Enrich Founder Box: Includes Enrich Team T-shirt and all 5 launch products.

Name inscribed on the launch products packaging. Your name will forever be on our products showing our tremendous gratitude for your support.

Enrich Kit named after you. Your name will become one of the preset names in our app when people select names for their plants.

Name painted on our walls (once we get our warehouse).

You shape our products. Founders will be invited to a private poll where they can all vote on the new upcoming products. You will help shape our company.

Let's expand our community to your friends and family.

We can't grow our community without your help. Share Enrich's vision and experience to all your friends and family. 


It won't be long until Enrich is growing in your home.

We will be delivering the first 1,000 Enrich Kits at the latest by January 15th.

As you noticed, we guarantee a delivery between the 15th of December and the 15th of January for the first 1000 units. The materials are already in stock and we contracted with American and local suppliers for this quantity. During our prototype and Alpha stage, all orders were delivered on time. Our software has already been approved by Apple and Android and is ready for a beta launch.

OUR VISION

Our team is focused on socially impacting the 21st century through food supply innovation and educational empowerment.

We here at Enrich believe in a simple culture: 

Support others, dream big, remember where you came from, and have fun.

OUR TEAM

Nathan Trey Foster

CEO & Co-Founder

Nathan is an entrepreneur passionate about delivering product market fit through innovative lean strategies on fast-paced timelines. Building great products and cohesive teams is what drives him the most. Nathan leads the organization, corporate strategy, marketing strategy, fundraising, product development, and software strategy.

David Hosey

CTO & Co-Founder

David Hosey is a computer science student and longtime friend of Nathan. David has a heart for service and thrives on any team. David leads the software development, database development, technology strategy, and the development team. 

Abbey & Allison Browning

Co-CMO

Abbey & Allison a current Sophomores in the Interior Design program at Anderson University in South Carolina with Abbey obtaining a minor in business marketing. Abbey & Alison founded Keys to Mission where they help fund their mission trips through an e-commerce store. Abbey and Allision lead the social media strategy, marketing strategy, creative campaigns, media strategy, and public relations. 

 

TIME OF DELIVERY

As you noticed, we guarantee a delivery between the 15th of December and the 15th of January for the first 1000 units. We can easily facilitate more units but currently lack the funds for the purchase orders. The materials are already in stock and we contracted with American and local suppliers for this quantity. During our prototype and Alpha stage, all orders were delivered on time. Our software has already been approved by Apple and Android and is ready for a beta launch. We will be sending out random kits unless otherwise indicated due to the way they are purchased on Indiegogo. Email us at hello@enrichgardening.com or order through our website if you want a specific plant. We greatly apologize for this dilemma. We are currently in our product stage and are able to quickly fufill orders upon the end of our campagin. 

COMMUNICATION

We’ll be fully dedicated to keeping you notified on the manufacturing of the product and development of the mobile app. We’ll provide updates with emails and social media posts. This is the part we are most excited about! We can't wait to hear your thoughts on the product and software.

GROW ONE. GIVE ONE CAMPAIGN PROGRESS

We are currently piloting our program in local schools in Georgia. Progress is slow and we are still trying to improve the program. We are having trouble getting into the curriculum in this time of year due to restrictive academics. The biggest obstacle we face in expanding this program is red tape created by some public schools and their reluctance to implement our program. This is primarily due to the low inventory we have and current reputation of our company. We are working towards creating healthy relationships and a more methodical approach to getting into schools.

GROW WITH US

Thank you for growing alongside our company as we embark on this journey. You are the driving factor in our success and we can't express our gratitude.

GSU has greatly helped Enrich reach our current state. Faculty, primarily in the Entrepreneurship department, have mentored and advised our company. Special shout out to Kenneth Mathis. He has been Nathan's personal mentor for almost half a year and has poured his soul into ensuring our success. Thank you, sir, for being a mentor, advisor but most importantly, a friend. 

Special thanks to Jack Boring for filming our pitch video. Linked is Jack information! Jack helped film our video at almost no cost. Thanks for being a good friend and believing in our project.

Special thanks to Kitty Yntema and Douglas Foster. Ya'll supported and encouraged Nathan through the lengthy 8 months leading up to this point and he is grateful.

Your name will forever be on our products showing our tremendous gratitude for your support.Enrich Kit named after you. Your name will become one of the preset names in our app when people select names for their plants.Name painted on our walls (once we get our warehouse).You shape our products. Founders will be invited to a private poll where they can all vote on the new upcoming products. You will help shape our company.Let's expand our community to your friends and family.We can't grow our community without your help. Share Enrich's vision and experience to all your friends and family. It won't be long until Enrich is growing in your home.We will be delivering the first 1,000 Enrich Kits at the latest by January 15th.As you noticed, we guarantee a delivery between the 15th of December and the 15th of January for the first 1000 units. The materials are already in stock and we contracted with American and local suppliers for this quantity. During our prototype and Alpha stage, all orders were delivered on time. Our software has already been approved by Apple and Android and is ready for a beta launch.OUR VISIONOur team is focused on socially impacting the 21st century through food supply innovation and educational empowerment.We here at Enrich believe in a simple culture: Support others, dream big, remember where you came from, and have fun.OUR TEAMNathan Trey FosterCEO & Co-FounderNathan is an entrepreneur passionate about delivering product market fit through innovative lean strategies on fast-paced timelines. Building great products and cohesive teams is what drives him the most. Nathan leads the organization, corporate strategy, marketing strategy, fundraising, product development, and software strategy.David HoseyCTO & Co-FounderDavid Hosey is a computer science student and longtime friend of Nathan. David has a heart for service and thrives on any team. David leads the software development, database development, technology strategy, and the development team. Abbey & Allison BrowningCo-CMOAbbey & Allison a current Sophomores in the Interior Design program at Anderson University in South Carolina with Abbey obtaining a minor in business marketing. Abbey & Alison founded Keys to Mission where they help fund their mission trips through an e-commerce store. Abbey and Allision lead the social media strategy, marketing strategy, creative campaigns, media strategy, and public relations.  TIME OF DELIVERYAs you noticed, we guarantee a delivery between the 15th of December and the 15th of January for the first 1000 units. We can easily facilitate more units but currently lack the funds for the purchase orders. The materials are already in stock and we contracted with American and local suppliers for this quantity. During our prototype and Alpha stage, all orders were delivered on time. Our software has already been approved by Apple and Android and is ready for a beta launch. We will be sending out random kits unless otherwise indicated due to the way they are purchased on Indiegogo. Email us at hello@enrichgardening.com or order through our website if you want a specific plant. We greatly apologize for this dilemma. We are currently in our product stage and are able to quickly fufill orders upon the end of our campagin. COMMUNICATIONWe’ll be fully dedicated to keeping you notified on the manufacturing of the product and development of the mobile app. We’ll provide updates with emails and social media posts. This is the part we are most excited about! We can't wait to hear your thoughts on the product and software.GROW ONE. GIVE ONE CAMPAIGN PROGRESSWe are currently piloting our program in local schools in Georgia. Progress is slow and we are still trying to improve the program. We are having trouble getting into the curriculum in this time of year due to restrictive academics. The biggest obstacle we face in expanding this program is red tape created by some public schools and their reluctance to implement our program. This is primarily due to the low inventory we have and current reputation of our company. We are working towards creating healthy relationships and a more methodical approach to getting into schools.GROW WITH USThank you for growing alongside our company as we embark on this journey. You are the driving factor in our success and we can't express our gratitude.GSU has greatly helped Enrich reach our current state. Faculty, primarily in the Entrepreneurship department, have mentored and advised our company. Special shout out to Kenneth Mathis. He has been Nathan's personal mentor for almost half a year and has poured his soul into ensuring our success. Thank you, sir, for being a mentor, advisor but most importantly, a friend. Special thanks to Jack Boring for filming our pitch video. Linked is Jack information! Jack helped film our video at almost no cost. Thanks for being a good friend and believing in our project.Special thanks to Kitty Yntema and Douglas Foster. Ya'll supported and encouraged Nathan through the lengthy 8 months leading up to this point and he is grateful.

story:
MAJOR CAMPAIGN PERK ANNOUNCEMENT:

Everyone who contributes to the Peartree's Underground Dessert Bar campaign, whether it's $25, $50, $75 or more, in addition to you getting some of our great perks like our delicious desserts or custom Peartree's apron, you will receive a chance to win...wait for it....A ROUND TRIP TICKET....ANYWHERE IN THE USA!!!* You read that correctly! $25 = 1 chance to win. $50 = 2 chances to win. $75 = 3 CHANCES TO WIN! You could win a trip anywhere in the USA for as little as $25!!!

***(Anywhere but Alaska and Hawaii)***

 

I've been extremely blessed and fortunate to have had the career I've had as a pastry chef but the truth is: the restaurant industry will chew you up and spit you out. As a woman you're still subject to the choose between having a family or a successful career and I like many, I believe that both can be balanced out. I've recently relocated to Los Angeles for a fresh start. I have been here for about 8 months now and I’m finally ready to get my business off the ground, but I need your help.

 

I am raising $6,000 to start my business: “Peartee’s,”  An exclusive underground dessert bar featuring elegantly plated desserts and some of the best local acts Southern California has to offer. A business that will initially be ran out of my own home, with the ultimate goal of moving into a larger commercial space.

 


     
You may be wondering what exactly is a dessert bar? Well, I’m glad you asked. Picture yourself being whisked off to an exclusive location, your car is valet parked and once inside, you’ll be  greeted by name and escorted to your seat. There, your eyes are automatically drawn to the white table cloths dressed in flickering tea lights, sparkling wine glasses, gold-plated flatware and hand written menus. All dishes are paired with your choice of wine, loose leaf tea, dessert beer or locally roasted coffee. An open kitchen gives you full view of each dish being intriquetly assembled by yours truly, while live music from local artists ties it all together.

 

 
The money we raise from this campaign will go towards the following: 
-  Logo, Signage, Bags, Stickers and Business Cards
- Convection Oven, Speed Rack and Stools
- Sheet Pans, Tea Pots, French Presses and Coffee Grinder
- Menu Slabs, Printer, Paper Goods  
-  Production, Promotions, Decorations
- California Permit and alcohol license (To bake from my home)


It's been my dream to open Peartree’s -- to create a legacy for myself and pave a way for all those women out there who have a dream but haven’t yet obtained the courage to step out on faith and pursue the impossible. I can’t do this without you so please come on this journey with me and help make Peartree’s a reality.

story:
DO YOU MISS THE FILLING STATION AS MUCH AS I DO?

After over 30 years of operating restaurants, I will finally be able to cook fun, delicious food while hanging with my customers.  And at the end of the day, hand- deliver the leftovers to the homeless. 

I started feeding the homeless in Downtown Miami when The Filling Station opened there in 1994.  I never waste anything and I never serve any meal to the hungry men, women and children living on the street that I wouldn't eat myself.  I also give a cold bottle of water with every meal...I wouldn't eat without a drink, why should they?

Preparing interesting, tasty food is a great joy of mine.  And the icing on the cake is watching people "ooh and aah" while they bite into the unique creations.  If you aren't familiar with my history, please click on the link below for Yelp...I'm very proud of the 4.5 Stars that we retained for many years. https://www.yelp.com/biz/the-filling-station-an...

 

I am happy to inform you that I have secured the funds to purchase the truck...This truck WILL happen.  This campaign is designed to bring in the funds needed for the initial capital to operate the business.  This includes insurance, licensing, permits, signage, small-wares and the important stuff like FOOD.  If we don't reach our goal of $30,000, any funds that we do receive will go towards getting THE VERY BEST FOOD TRUCK on the road!    

We are going to deliver excitement at every single event with a prize wheel, games, great lights and music.  This truck is going to have tables, a t.v. and live music when the event permits.  

HOW COOL ARE WE???

I can't emphasize this enough...
If you can't help financially, you can help by sharing this with friends who love going to food truck events, or have catered events, or LOVE really cool burgers, award winning wings, the freshest fish tacos, amazing tater tots, and so much more!

PLEASE HELP  by sharing this with all of your friends by using The Indiegogo tools.

THANK YOU...THANK YOU...THANK YOU!!! 

Adam

story:
Peewee's Ice Cream

Hello! We are Maranda and Bryan,

Peewee's Ice Cream is small-batch ice cream focusing on using local New Jersey ingredients.

In the summer of 2019, we started this ice cream dream. While both working full time jobs, we started our little passion project, never imagining it would lead to something bigger.  We wanted to provide our customers with fresh ice cream made with local ingredients.  Soon we went from selling a few pints a week to not being able to keep up with demand!   

One of our core values is that we believe ice cream should be enjoyed by everyone!  This is why we not only create dairy-based ice cream but also vegan/non-dairy options.  Once we have more space, we will be able to create even more variations such as keto, sugar-free, soy-free and puppy ice cream (just to name a few).

Since starting our small operation in 2019, we have been invited to more farmer's markets and had request's for birthday parties.  We can't wait to help celebrate more important events, community gatherings and farmer's markets with you this upcoming year!

 So the big news is we are opening our very own scoop shop and production kitchen in Medford, New Jersey this summer!

Why are we doing this fundraiser?

Building this scoop shop is a huge undertaking but we are so excited about it!  Having our own space means we can produce more flavors, products and sweet's.  For example, we will be able to start catering parties, creating fun ice cream cakes and hosting special events in our space.  

So this is what brings us to why we are asking for your help!  We are raising money to purchase a new ice cream machine.  To give you an idea of what our current production looks like.....our small machine churns out 4 pints every 30 minutes.  The much bigger machine makes 50 pints in 7 minutes that can help us meet demand. 

Peewee's Perks: We have loaded our perks with some sweet treats (literally).  If there is something you would like to see on there, please let us know!  

Thank you so much for your support! Community means A LOT to us, without you we would not be where we are today.  We look forward to being able to celebrate more, laugh more and eat more ice cream with you!  We are beyond grateful for all the help and encouragement we’ve gotten so far and we’re excited to open our shop in Medford! 

Best,

Peewee's Ice Cream

Maranda, Bryan and Howie the dog

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is financially secure during this crazy time in our lives.  One of the best ways to help support us is to spread the word about Peewee's Ice Cream and about our campaign.  It is crazy how the simple act of sharing can be so impactful!  Even if you can’t donate, sharing our story and letting others know will help us reach more people and meet our goals. We appreciate you taking the time to read this, and for supporting our dream.  We hope to see you soon at 57 N. Main Street, Medford!

story:
Our Mission Statement: 

We plan to combine our unique passions for craft beer and yoga with the community we love.  Our award winning beers and comprehensive approach to the yoga lifestyle will offer the highest quality experience each time you walk through our doors.

The Plan and the Place:

In 2017, we started working on a business plan and looking for a location where we could make our dream a reality. In the summer of 2019 we fell in love with the old car dealership at 302 State St. and began working out the details. We learned that the building began life as a Nash Motors Dealership in the 1940's and was later home to a Volkswagen dealership. This lends a bit of an "art moderne" flair to the old showroom where the yoga studio will be centered. Some of the original architectural features will be retained in the renovations.

We will divide the 5000 sq. ft. facility between the brewery, the taproom, and the yoga studio. With the possibility to expand into an additional 4000 sq. ft., this will be the permanent home of Gasper Brewing Co. and BG Flow Yoga. With a lot of work and a little luck we think it will be perfect.

Our Beers:

We specialize in all types of Stouts, Pale, Amber, and Brown Ales. We will also offer beer styles from around the world and will collaborate with the best in the industry to give our customers variety and provide something for all palates and preferences.

Our Impact:

Besides bringing amazing, unique, and highly drinkable craft beer to the area, we also hope to enrich the neighborhood where we will be located and spark growth in the local economy. We have been developing relationships with other local businesses to coordinate events, tastings, pairings, music events, etc. As the business flourishes we will also be looking to participate in philanthropic initiatives and different ways we can give back to the community.

It is our goal to introduce the people of Bowling Green and Western Kentucky to styles of beer and yoga that aren't currently found in the area. We will offer a combination of original Gasper Brewing beers and an ever-changing assortment of guest taps. We also plan to introduce multiple entertainment options for taproom guests. Speaking of the taproom, this is where YOU come in!

Our Contribution:

We will be funding the majority of the renovation of the building and the build-out of the yoga studio with a combination of savings, current income, and equity from our home. We will also invest countless hours of sweat equity and do the majority of the renovation work ourselves. We currently have the equipment to brew 2bbl batches but are planning to have a 5bbl system in place by opening day or shortly thereafter.

Your Contribution:

We will be utilizing the campaign proceeds to cover carrying costs of the building, equipment purchases and leases, furnishings, salaries, raw materials, etc. 

In exchange for your contribution, you will receive one of our extremely generous perks packages. We have teamed up with a couple of Bowling Green's finest locally owned businesses  to offer not only packages that include our products and services, but also grant you access to their amazing cuisine and unparalleled wine and spirits selections as well.


           hickoryandoakbg.com                    preservationbg.com               duelinggroundsdistillery.com

 

We are also offering a very limited number of packages which will give you a chance to be a part of our team and participate in our shared vision.

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to our perks packages, we would greatly appreciate your help in sharing our campaign and spreading the word about our endeavor. Simply click on the icon for the social media platform of your choice below or cut and paste the following link for our website.

www.gasperbrewing.com

About Us:

What started out in 2008 as a new hobby with a "Mr. Beer" kit quickly grew into a passion. I didn't really care all that much for my first batch, but I had great reviews from family and friends. I was elated to see people enjoy drinking what I had made, but also the control and manipulation of the process appealed to the electrical engineer in me. I knew immediately that brewing beer would always play a major role in my life. To this day, I still get goosebumps talking about the process and the possibilities. I absolutely love brewing beer. 

In 2012, I met the most loving, philanthropic, yoga hippie while volunteering at a festival and soon after we were married. DeAnna was an activist, had years of community involvement with various non-profits, and was seeking something deeper for her life. We joined paths and decided to seek a better life together.

We moved to Colorado the next spring  which presented multiple opportunities for her yoga practice to deepen and my beer horizons to broaden. The next few years would see our jobs and our living situation change multiple times, moving from the mountains to the beach, then from the beach to a blueberry farm, finally coming back to Bowling Green, KY in 2015.

Once we established ourselves professionally in Bowling Green, DeAnna found some fulfillment by teaching yoga at multiple studios in town and I began acquiring equipment to brew bigger and better batches. We quickly made friends at Blue Holler Brew Supplies, the local homebrew shop, and joined the Bowling Green Homebrew Club. We started attending the meetings and found an incredible group of homebrewers that continuously inspire me and have helped me perfect my craft.

story:
** THANK YOU FOR YOUR GENEROSITY!  BE SURE TO CHOOSE A PERK FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTION! **

(If you choose a perk, the extra charge at checkout will cover part of the shipping costs.)

Your contribution will also get you a coupon for a nice discount on your first order of       Tad's Dad's Chili !!

We are Tad Tandler and Gary Barr, the founders of Tad’s Dad’s Chili; we are serial entrepreneurs and have backgrounds in the food business as restaurant owners.

A few years ago, Tad won first place out of 100 entries at a chili cook-off at her school; she was implored by her principal to share her dad’s chili with the world. Since then, scores of people, families, and friends who've tasted it at chili cook-offs, special events, and tailgate parties have asked where they can buy this fantastic chili!  

We know this is the best chili available in any store or restaurant  -- it is our goal to Save the World From Bad Chili, One Bowl at a Time!   This is important to us because we know we can do so much better than what is currently on the market.  We are on a mission to sell this delicious product wherever people are looking for a bowl of tasty chili.

The recipe is ready! The manufacturing process is ready!  Now we need your help to launch Tad’s Dad’s Chili. We need your help to ramp up production to be able to distribute on local, regional, and national levels. We know that once the public tastes Tad’s Dad’s Chili, the demand for the product will be so strong that we will need to be able to quickly scale up our production.  That is why your contribution is so important!

What We Need:

We are seeking $200,000 in funding to launch this fantastic chili! 

This will allow Tad’s Dad’s Chili to:

  • Manufacture batches of chili for local and regional distribution
    (National distribution is our goal!)
  • Find the best quality packaging for frozen foods
  • Fund professional marketing for our initial launch
  • Hire brokers and distributors
  • Hire employees and contractors for growth: grocery stores, restaurants, and convenience stores
  • Find the best fulfillment services to sell Tad's Dad's online
  • Attend and staff local farmer’s markets
  • Pay salaries
  • Develop new Tad’s Dad’s products
    • Vegetarian
    • Green Chili with Chicken
    • Keto-Friendly Beef Chili


We will not stop until we reach our goal of $200,000!  Your contributions will allow us to keep moving forward -- thank you in advance for making this dream a reality!!

What You Get:

Check out the fantastic perks!  Everything is high quality, rich in design, and fun to use and wear.


Your Contribution:  The Impact

Your contribution will bring Tad's Dad's Chili to the market!

  • It will allow us to place a large orders to lower our costs per package, thereby reducing the retail price to you.
  • It will allow us to produce enormous batches to distribute to national markets.
  • It will allow us to expand our product line (vegetarian, keto, and green chili)
  • It will allow us to expand our advertising and marketing budget to reach a larger audience.
  • It will help us to SAVE THE WORLD FROM BAD CHILI, ONE BOWL AT A TIME!

 

Risks and Challenges

Your biggest risk:

  • Stuck with having to eat bowls of bad or mediocre chili!

Our risks and challenges:

  • Being able to scale to meet the huge initial demand
  • Finding the best brokers and distributors for regional and national distribution
  • Getting into the best markets, restaurants, and convenience stores
  • Expanding to on-line sales

All of these risks and challenges are manageable with the right funding, approach, and involvement of the best people.  We are very confident in our relationships with experts in the process; their industry knowledge combined with our experience in the food business is a formula for huge success!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word! Tell all your friends and families!
  • Share our website: http://www.tadsdadschili.com
  • Like and share our Facebook page:  https://www.facebook.com/tadsdadschili/
  • Follow us on Instagram:  https://www.instagram.com/tadsdadschili/
  • Buy our delicious chili!

 

As this guy says, Wake Up To Some REAL Chili!

story:
As a city-dweller, this Frenchie knows how much a good cup of joe is needed in those early and not so early morning hours. It's the right pick-me-up to get the day started. And it's the right brew for those long work nights that can drag you down.

It was our good fortune that we came across this Astoria Gloria Lever AL2-2 Group Espresso Machine. My male human saw the potential of having a custom made vehicle to tote this exquisite mechanical beast around to all those deserving people who love coffee. However, it was my lady human that took the initiative to design the graphics and came up with our official name Butternut Coffee Co. With me as the Spokesperson... or is that "Spokesdog," I'll be able to keep a paw on the pulse of the city and together we will make the perfect mobile coffee team.

To bring an eco-conscious coffee tuk-tuk experience to Downtown Los Angeles and the surrounding areas via the streets and special events.

Along with our good fortune we have partnered with Ubora Coffee in Augusta, GA who will provide us with mouth-watering blends. This includes a coffee that is produced by The Hingakawa Women's Association in Rwanda. Plus, we have hired Grandmaster Mikey Goodwin (IG @mikeygoodwin) to train us in the way of the coffee ninja.

While the Astoria Espresso Machine is being made run-ready, the kind gentlemen over at Barmoor Garage in Ryton, England are converting a 50cc Piaggio Gull Wing Ape Van to meet our specific needs. The Gull Wing Ape is essentially a tuk-tuk that has wings in the back that open up to an area perfect for our espresso machine, grinder, moccamaster, and cold brew dispenser. Did I mention... Autobot.

The Butternut Coffee Co. tuk-tuk will look like this:

We have invested quite a sum of money into this project to get the conversion started on our tuk-tuk. My humans have put their heads together, along with our conversion team, to get all the wires, water pumps, and everything else that's necessary to make this van, branding, and quality roasts from Ubora Coffee to come into fruition. I cannot wait until you have tried our 24 hour Watermelon Cold Brew. You'll love it!

However, we do need your help to raise funds to finish the conversion and to have this amazing piece of machinery shipped from Ryton, England to Los Angeles. Once we pick it up, we will make the final touches to prepare it for the streets of California... to deliver to you a damn fine cup of coffee.

Our funding goal is $20,000. That is the amount needed to cover the remainder of the conversion funds in making sure the tuk-tuk has the proper hookups, water system, power outlets, and switches to enable a smooth transition for the espresso machine, grinder, and moccamaster... making sure that everything is in working order. The funding would also cover US duties and taxes when the van is imported to the United States.

We have included special perks to go to our special people who help us meet our goal:

  •  Limited Edition Illustrated Prints of myself

  •  Coffee beans for at home lovin'
  •  Having a drink named after you
  •  A ticket to the official opening of Butternut Coffee Co.

This campaign is paramount to securing the tuk-tuk that is being converted. If we do not reach our goal then we will lose the vehicle and all the work, time, and funds already invested. Special events are already in motion and we need the van in order to serve coffee at those events.

Here is a small listing of where the Butternut Coffee Co. will be:

  • Ladies & Gents Night Out in Burbank, CA
  • Horror Trivia Night at Blast From the Past in Burbank, CA
  • Holiday in the Park in Burbank, CA
  • Hollywood Blvd. among the stars, and
  • Comic Con 2020 in San Diego, CA

After all, coffee isn't just about coffee. Coffee is about community and the people who live there. I want those who come by our espresso-on-wheels to step out of their busy everyday life... to know they are not just getting a cup of coffee; but, getting Love that is served with Peace and Happiness.

My humans' long term goal is to be able to take other Butternut Coffee Co. tuk-tuks with the same set up to other cities, states, countries, and worlds. I wanna give a shout-out to my pups in Atlanta... I have you in my sights. I'm an LA girl though, and Los Angeles is the place to begin such a goal. As the Spokesdog for the Butternut Coffee Co. I do hope we can count on you for success.

Every adventure has some risks and challenges. However, I feel confident that our team has the ability to take on whatever comes our way. My humans are versed in fast-paced working environments that demand meeting challenges head-on. They have worked in industries such as film/tv, graphic design, escape rooms, conventions, and food service.

We thank you for viewing our campaign. Please tell your friends about our new company, the Butternut Coffee Co., by using Indiegogo's social media share tools.

With a heartfelt thanks,

Butternut Louise & her humans
